30 September 2018: Al-Shabab fighters killed a Somali soldier and injured two others in Bar-Sanguuni, just outside of Kismayo.
29 September 2018: Police and gunmen identified as drug-gang members engaged in a shootout in Garowe, resulting in the death of a civilian bystander and the wounding of two police officers.
29 September 2018: AS fighters detained more than ten civilian residents of Bu'ale town including a former humanitarian personnel.
29 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters threw a hand grenade at soldiers in the Tadamun village in Afgoye town. Soldiers opened fire in response, but no one was injured.
29 September 2018: A South West State Police officer shot and wounded the driver of a minibus in Buur Xakaba following a dispute involving taxes.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
notes: 28 September 2018: Galmudug security forces clashed with each other for unknown reasons in the town of Adaado.
28 September 2018: Unidentified gunmen shot dead a businessman on the outskirts of the Beledweyne town.
28 September 2018: Unidentified gunmen killed a university student in Mogadishu.
28 September 2018: An AS member killed three fellow AS fighters in Ceeel Dhuun Adeegow (c. 47 km north west of Baidoa) after a dispute over taxes collected from the local community.
28 September 2018: At least three AS militants were killed in an airstrike near Jilib village (Shabeellaha Hoose) conducted by anti-Al-Shabaab forces.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 27 September 2018: Suspected Al-Shabaab fighters shot and killed an off-duty NISA official near the Abdalla and Awareere Masjid areas of Wardhigley neighborhood in Mogadishu.

27 September 2018: Somali National Army soldiers claim to have killed 16 Al-Shabaab fighters in clashes with the militants in Jilib village, Marka. A foreign fighter from Afghanistan was among the dead.
27 September 2018: Two people were wounded during a conflict over land that was fought between two clan militias, Luwaay and Leysaan, in Towfiiq neighbourhood of Baidoa town.
27 September 2018: An IED reportedly exploded near the AMISOM base in Hawl-wadaag village (Mogadishu), targeting a Somali National Army vehicle.
27 September 2018: Three civilians were killed and 6 others wounded when an IED device exploded in a restaurant in Al-Waq town, Gedo. Al-Shabaab was blamed for the attack.
27 September 2018: Three police officers were wounded when an IED device they were disarming in the Bakara market detonated.  No group has claimed responsibility.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
notes: 27 September 2018: Prison security officers in Bossaso staged a protest over a lack of salary by blocking movement in and out of the prison. Puntland security forced responded with gunfire, sparking clashes. 1 prisoner and 2 civilians were killed by stray bullets, while 2 police officers and 2 more civilians were injured.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 27 September 2018: Jubaland security forces belonging to Ogaden Sub Clan exchanged gunfire with fellow soldiers near Farjano village in Kismayo. No casualties reported.

26 September 2018: Police forces opened fire on a deaf civilian who failed to follow police commands in the central market of Bossaso town, Bari region. The victim was hospitalized following the event.
26 September 2018: Police forces shot and injured a man at the main roundabout in Garowe town.
26 September 2018: Al-Shabaab linked militants ambushed a convoy carrying khat in Mooda Mooda village, Bay region. 2 Somali National Army soldiers who were escorting the convoy were wounded.

26 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters abducted 4 civilians near Baadcade village (approx. 10km NW of Baidoa, approximate coordinates used). The civilians had allegedly broken an Al-Shabaab imposed ban on cell phones and tobacco in the area.
25 September 2018: 5 people including a woman, boy and one of five armed men were injured by security forces  after a gunfight erupted over a land dispute in Israac village in North Galkayo.

25 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters ambushed two donkey carts that were carrying food commodities and other materials near Walaq village, SW of Wajid town. Two people were killed and the food supplies were burned.
25 September 2018: Unidentified armed men shot and a killed Somtel Telecommunication company employee near Masjid Hareed neighbourhood, Howlwadag district.

25 September 2018: An improvised explosive device targeting Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers exploded in Marka town. Al-Shabaab militants and the soldiers exchanged gunfire following the explosion. One soldier was killed and a second wounded. Al-Shabaab forces claim to have killed 5 soldiers in the event. Fatalities coded as lowest estimate.
25 September 2018: Government forces manning Bar-Smail checkpoint opened fire on a vehicle carrying khat in Afgoye town. The driver was killed and a passenger wounded.

25 September 2018: A report issue by Garawe online stated that a bomb attack hit a police checkpoint in Afgoye town, lower shabeelle, killing one police officer and wounding 2 others. Al-Shabaab has claimed responsibility for the attack.
24 September 2018: A Somali National Army (SNA) soldier shot dead an armed thief who tried to rob him in Yaqshid district, Mogadishu.
24 September 2018: A ciilian man was reportedly shot and wounded by a police officer when he failed to obey instructions near the Masjidul Rahma, Bari region.

24 September 2018: Al-Shabaab shot dead  three truck drivers in Waro-rako grazing area (C. 25km south east of Hoosingo village, approx. coordinates used). 4 other truck drivers were injured by the militatants. Sources suggest that the drivers may have been involved in charcoal trade, which is currently banned by Al-Shabaab.
24 September 2018: Two police officers conducting route safety were shot dead by unidentified armed men near Gaaca area, a village in Bossasso. A passenger was also wounded.
24 September 2018: Unidentified armed men riding a motorcycle shot and killed two electoral delegates male and female at Ceel Qode and Daahisoy villages, in Afgoye town.

24 September 2018: A total of 35 al-Shabab militants were killed and several others wounded after clashes in Qoriyole between Somali National Army troops and Al-Shabaab forces. At least one somali soldier was killed as well during the gunfight.
24 September 2018: A vehicle rigged with explosives exploded in Afgoye, Dharkenley district. Unknown perpetrator at time of reporting.

Brig Farah Galangoli, who was in charge of security in Nugal region was dismissed following the incident. Islamic State has claimed responsibility for the attack
23 September 2018: Government army forces attacked armed men attempting to extort money from residents constructing a house in Kahda area, Mogadishu. One man was killed during the ensuing gunfire.
23 September 2018: Unidentified armed men reporteldy shot and killed a civilian in the Bakara market area, Mogadishu.

23 September 2018: After the assasination of a civilian by unidentified armed men in the Bakara market (event coded seperately), police engaged the assailants. The armed men threw a grenade, injuring 5 people, including 3 policemen.

23 September 2018: Two Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers were wounded when Al-Shabaab fighters attacked their position in of Qoryoley town, Lower Shabelle region. Al-Shabaab sources later claimed to have killed 4 soldiers (fatalities coded at the most conservative estimate).
23 September 2018: Unidentified militants reportedly attacked Somali National Army (SNA) troops in Ambareeso town, Barawe district, setting off armed clashes. No injuries were reported.

23 September 2018: An IED explosion set by Al-Shabaab militants hit a military convoy of Somali government troops near Dhanaane settlement, coastal road, Marka town, killing four government soldiers and wounding three others.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 23 September 2018: Puntland and Somaliland forces in Tukaraq area of Sool region traded artillery shells for around 30 minutes. Two Puntland soldiers were injured.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 23 September 2018: Puntland security forces have killed 12 Al-Shabaab fighters during clashes in the Af Madow mountain range.

22 September 2018: Somaliland military forces clashed with a former Somali-land Army defecter, Gamaal Baaxad, of Habar Honis/Muse Ismail clan in the area of Haldhagan (located 37 km NE of Ceerigaabo). Some injuries among Baaxad.
21 September 2018: Unidentified armed men using pistols shot and killed a senior police officer at Suuqa Beerta vicinity in Hamarjajab district.

21 September 2018: US Africa Command reporteldy conducted an airstrike defending US special forces and allied Somali troops in an area located 50 miles North-west of Kismayo, Lower Jubba region. 18 Al-Shabaab fighters were reported killed in the strike, with two others killed by small arms fire from forces on the ground.
21 September 2018: An elder of Warsangeli Adan Siciid sub clan was shot and killed by armed militias in an area between Baran and Hadaaftimo of Sanaag region.
21 September 2018: Government forces shot from a technical vehicle into a car driven by an official from Banadir regional administration in Hodan district. The owner of the vehicle was killed.
21 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters established a checkpoint along the Mahaday-Ceel Baraf road, and shot at civilians who resisted attempts to extort money. No further info.
21 September 2018: A senior traditional leader, Sultan Hassan Ali Jibril was shot dead by unidentified gunmen in Badhan town (Approx., 120km east of Erigavo of Sanaag region).
21 September 2018: A senior traditional leader was killed by unknown militiamen in Badhan town, Sanaag region while on his way to attend a launch ceremony.

21 September 2018: Unidentified armed assailants using pistols shot and killed a female student as she was in class at the university of Somalia near Bar-Asha at Bar-Ubah neighbourhood in Wardhidgley district.

notes: 20 September 2018: A Galmudug soldier was killed and two others wounded after their convoy was ambushed by armed clan militiamen on the main road of Bali-Higis neighborhood (around 10 km north of Adaado). The victims were members of the Habar Gidir clan.

20 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters reportedly launched a hit-and-run attack against Somali National Army soldiers in the livestock market area of Heliwa district, Mogadishu, sparking clashes that lasted around 20 minutes. One civilian was wounded.

20 September 2018: Suleiman clan/Habargidir and Wagardhac clan/Marhan clashed at the Dacdeer district of Galmudug. 9 people were killed and 16 others injured. Reports issued by Goobjog suggest that the clashes erupted after Ethiopian-backed Liyu police left the area, leaving a vacuum in administration.

notes: 20 September 2018: An IED targeted an AMISOM (Kenyan) convoy traveling from Faafax Dhuun village to Giriley, killing two soldiers and wounding two others.

Among the dead was Captain Ali Dhuh and Abdulle, a senior military official.
19 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters shot and killed a khat dealer in Taragente area (c. 35 km south of Beletweyne town (approx. Coordinates using a description from the source).

19 September 2018: A reporter was stabbed to death in Galkaco town, Mudug region, by an unidentified group of youth. The reason behind the stabbing is not clear.

19 September 2018: Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers claim to have killed 30 Al-Shabaab fighters during an operation in Doolow district, Gedo region. Al-Shabaab forces had ordered locals to bring livestock to a central location for taxation.

19 September 2018: A Somali National Army soldier was killed and two others injured in an IED blast that hit their vehicle as it traveled through Kali-Cafimad located at KM 67 in Marka district. Al-Shabaab later claimed responsibility for the attack.

18 September 2018: Somali National Army soldiers have taken control of Dhanaane, Jilib, Gendershe, and Ow Maki towns after clashing with Al-Shabaab forces. According to a pro-government general fighting in the area, at least 13 Al-Shabaab fighters were killed during the operations. Fatalities spread across 4 locations.

According to a pro-government general fighting in the area, at least 13 Al-Shabaab fighters were killed during the operations. Fatalities spread across 4 locations.

According to a pro-government general fighting in the area, at least 13 Al-Shabaab fighters were killed during the operations. Fatalities spread across 4 locations.

According to a pro-government general fighting in the area, at least 13 Al-Shabaab fighters were killed during the operations. Fatalities spread across 4 locations.
18 September 2018: A Somali National Army soldier was killed and a second injured when Al-Shabaab fighters opened fire on them in Hawo Taako village, Beletweyne.

18 September 2018: An armed clansman from the Cabdalla sub clan of Hawadle clan was shot and killed by a man from the Agoon sub-clan of Hawadle, in Xaawa Taako village in Beletweyne. The motive behind the attack was reportedly clan revenge.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 18 September 2018: Armed men with suspected links to Al-Shabaab shot and killed a NISA soldier in the Bakaara market of Mogadishu using pistols.

18 September 2018: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed Jubbaland state military forces who were traveling through Abdi Birole village, located some 60 km west of Kismayo town. 10 soldiers were reportedly killed initially as their vehicle ran over a land mine planted by the Al-Shabaab militants.

18 September 2018: A Somali National Army soldier shot his rifle into traffic in an attempt to keep the lines moving as cars backed up near the Ex-Cinema Nasri in Hodan district, Mogadishu . A nine-year-old girl was killed and three other children wounded. One of the wounded children later died in the hospital.
18 September 2018: A government soldier reportedly shot into a crowd in the Karan area of the capital, Mogadishu, resulting in a number of civilian injuries.

source: AFRICOM; Calamada; Local Source; Radio Mogadishu; Shabelle Media Network
notes: 18 September 2018: Foreign fighter jets have reportedly bombed areas of Middle Shabelle region destroying the former Sakow district health center and a second Al-Shabaab controlled building. Al-Shabaab sources claimed that three children were killed, and blamed the strikes on US-operated drones. The US air forces refuted the claim, stating that they had not conducted an airstrike since the 11 September. Radio Mogadishu, which supports the internationally recognized government, stated that the strike killed 12 Al-Shabaab fighters and leaders as they conducted a meeting. Fatalities coded at the most conservative point.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 18 September 2018: Jubaland Darwish troops have attacked an Al-Shabaab position in Belet Xaawo, sparking clashes that led to the death of 11 Al-Shabaab fighters and a reported 10 members of the Darwish troops. Darwish troops have now taken control of the area, which is located in an unspecified area south of Belet Xaawo.

17 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters reportedly ambushed a convoy of Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers heading to Mogadishu from Marka town. The ambush took place in Gendershe area of Marka town, and gunfire lasted for about an hour.
17 September 2018: At least one person was killed, and a second injured, when unknown armed men opened fire within a Qat market in Jalaqsi town, Hiiran District.
17 September 2018: Unidentified armed men shot and injured a senior staff member in the Amal Bank in Bakara market, Mogadishu. The motives behind the attack are not clear.
17 September 2018: A Somali National Army soldier reportedly shot and killed a rickshaw driver in Karan district, Mogadishu, after a dispute.

17 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters reportedly conducted a hit-and-run attack against joint Somali Police and National Army soldiers in the Buur Xakaba area of Bay region. No casualties were reported.

17 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighers attacked Jubbaland security forces in Bohol village, Gedo, sparking clashes that resulted in the death of 7 Jubbaland soldiers and 5 AS fighters, and the wounding of 5 others. Al-Shabaab took control of the village following the clashes.
17 September 2018: Somaliland regional coordinator for the Somaliland Ministry of Public Works was stabbed to death by an unidentified attacker in Ainabo for unknown reasons.
17 September 2018: An armed Habar-Yonis/Sacad-Yonis man shot and killed a Habar-Jecho/Reer clanswoman in Elafweyn following a dispute over grazing land. The man was arrested and taken to prison.

16 September 2018: A police officer was shot and killed by an unidentified armed man in Tuurjale area located south east of Bossaso town. Islamic State-linked groups later claimed responsibility for the attack. A number of people have been arrested.

The group claim to have killed and injured 15 soldiers. Fatalities coded as 7. The attack began with a bomb attack which was followed by an exchange of gunfire.

16 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters ambushed a mini bus travelling on a road between Afgoye and Wanleleyn district. Soldiers aboard the minibus shot at the attackers. One civilian female passenger was slightly injured in the event, and the attackers retreated.
16 September 2018: Men with suspected links to Al Shabaab hurled a hand grenade at Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers in Marka town.

assoc_actor_2: Warsangeli Clan Group (Somalia); Dhulbahante Clan Group (Somalia)

16 September 2018: Armed men shot and killed a civilian as he exited a mosque in Wardhigley district, Mogadishu. No info on motivation.
16 September 2018: Government troops reportedly shot at a minibus in Marka town, killing the driver and injuring a passenger.

16 September 2018: Pro-Al-Shabaab sources claimed IED blast killed 7 Jubbaland regional state soldiers as they drew water in the village of Bulo Gadud. The blasts also destroyed two water tanker trucks belonging to the soldiers.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: 16 September 2018: Al-Shabaab militants have reportedly shelled Kenyan troops in a base in Buusaar in Elwak District, Gedo.

16 Sep 2018: A mentally ill woman was found dead in South Galkayo. Reports suggest that the woman was sexually assaulted before she was killed by the attackers. Three suspects have been arrested following the incident.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: 15 September 2018: Ethiopian state TV (FANA) has reported that airstrikes conducted by its military killed 70 Al-Shabaab fighters that were reportedly about to attack on of their bases in Lowi-Erjeeg Village (c. 57 km to the South of Teiglow - approx coordinates used). Two vehicles packed with weapons were also reportedly destroyed.

15 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters reportedly attacked Somali National Army (SNA) troops in Bulo Foolyi area of Afgooye, sparking an exchange of gunfire that lasted for about 30 minutes. The attackers were pushed back.

15 Sep, 2018: Two groups of SWSPF clashed in Berdale town over money collected from a command post they control. One civilian was reportedly killed and two others wounded during the exchange of gunfire.

15 September 2018: Members of the police force reportedly attacked Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers at a checkpoint in Kahda district (Dharkenley), Mogadishu, killing 2 and wounding two others. Police forces took control of the checkpoint following the attack. According to the source, the reasoning behind the attack was that police forces accused the SNA soldiers of extorting money from sand trucks passing through the area.
15 September 2018: Three Somali National Army soldiers were reportedly killed by attacking Al-Shabaab fighters in Tihsile village in Afgoye district, Lower Shabelle region.

15 September 2018: Members of the Boqolhore and Geeledle sub-clans clashed over a land dispute in Dhujo village (3 km north east of Tiyeeglow - approx. Coordinates used). One member from Boqolhore clan was killed.

04 November. 101 cases of rape were recorded in Somaliland between January and November 2018 (coded as one event per month); 105 individuals were accused of rape out of which 87 were arrested and charged.
15 September 2018: Unidentified armed men have reportedly shot dead two young college graduates in the town of Bosasso. It is unclear why they were targeted.

15 September 2018: Somali federal lawmaker Mohamed Mursal Borow was seriously injured and another person (the driver) killed when an explosion targeted their vehicle near the national theatre in Mogadishu. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 15 September 2018: A Landmine reportedly destroyed an AU vehicle and injured two civilians on outskirts of Garbaharey District of Gedo region. No group has claimed responsibility.
14 September 2018: An explosion detonated just outside of the Amal Bank area near the Bakaara market area, injuring one civilian. No further info.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 14 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters claim to have killed and injured an unspecified number of AMISOM troops after targeting their vehicle with a land mine as it passed near the Jowhar airport, near Jowhar town. Unknown fatalities coded as 10
14 September 2018: A suspected Al-Shabaab member shot and killed a civilian as he exited the mosque in Baardheere town, Gedo region. No info on why the victim was targeted.

14 September 2018: The vehicle of a local government official was reportedly targeted by an IED bomb blast that had been attached to the vehicle in Aargada Madina, Wadajiir town, in Mogadishu. The owner of the vehicle reportedly survived the blast and no injuries were reported.

13 September 2018: The United States Air forces reportedly conducted an airstrike against Al-Shabaab fighters who were pushing forward to attack US-backed Somali forces in the Mubarak area of Lower Shabelle, resulting in the death of two and the injury of a third. *Note fighting occured between Al-Shabaab forces and US-backed forces in the same area the day before.

13 September 2018: According to a pro-Al-Shabaab source, fighters from the group attacked two bases belonging to Somali National Army troops in the Suuq Holoha (livestock market) area of the capital, Mogadishu. Al-Shabaab forces claim to have killed "several" soldiers during the clashes, and stated that they had overrun the two bases and taken weapons. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
13 September 2018: A police officer was killed and a second wounded after Al-Shabaab fighters attacked their position in Heliwa district, Mogadishu.
13 September 2018: Gunmen linked to the al-Shabaab group have reportedly shot dead a Somali military official in the Elaysha Biyaha area, just outside of the capital Mogadishu.
13 September 2018: Gunmen linked to the al-Shabaab group have reportedly shot dead two government employees who worked for the foreign and planning ministries in Hodan district, Mogadishu.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 13 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters reportedly shelled an AMISOM base located in the Busaar village, Ceel Waaq district of Gedo. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

12 September 2018: A pickup truck carrying a group of Somali National Army (SNA) Soldiers was reportedly hit by a roadside bomb as it traveled through Alamada town, killing and injuring an unknown number. Unknown fatalities coded as 10. Al-Shabaab later claimed responsibility for the bombing.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 12 September 2018: An al-Shabab figure was killed, while several others were wounded when clashes errupted between the militants and troops from the Somali National Intelligence Security Agency in the Mubarak area of Lower Shabelle Region. Al-Shabaab forces later claimed to have recovered the bodies of two soldiers who were also killed in the fighting.
12 September 2018: Al-Shabaab linked militants reportedly attacked Somali National Army forces in Marka town, sparking an exchange of gunfire. No info on casualties.

12 September 2018: A gunfight erupted as a Somali government tax minister and a group of soldiers attempted to enforce a tax on a quarry in El Ma'an village, Middle Shabelle region. According to the source, arguments escalated into gunfire between the soldiers accompanying the minister and armed guards at the quarry, leaving at 4 dead and 5 others injured.
12 September 2018: Al-Shabaab linked gunmen reportedly shot dead a ministry official, Omar Hasan Ganey, in Hodan district of the capital Mogadishu.

12 September 2018: Gunmen with suspected links to the Al-Shabaab group reportedly shot dead a civilian in the Bakaara market. Security forces later arrested several people with connections to the attack.

11 September 2018: According to a pro-Al-Shabaab website, militants loyal to the group clashed with Somali National Army (SNA) forces backed by US soldiers in the town of Basra, Afgooye district. No info on casualties. *note, Somali government soldiers claim to have captured the town the day before, while some al-Shabaab sources seem to indicate that they still hold the town.
11 September 2018: A senior Al-Shabaab operative named Abukar Hassan Adde, also known as Sayyid Abukar, was killed during a firefight with Somali police in the Heliwa area of Mogadishu.

11 September 2018: 5 coal merchants were reportedly shot dead by unidentified gunmen in Bulo-Gadud area of Lower Jubba region. Al-Shabaab has banned the trade of coal in the area, however, this attack could not be specifically linked to the group.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
notes: 11 September 2018: A landmine explosion reportedly targeted a convoy of Djiboutian troops as they made their way through Beledweyne town, Hiiran region. 11 September 2018: A landmine explosion reportedly targeted the convoy of the commander of Afgoye District police as it passed through Hawo Abdi village, Afgoye district. Several soldiers in the convoy were reportedly wounded but none were killed. Al-Shabaab later claimed responsibility for the attack.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces
notes: 10 September 2018: US-backed "Danab" special forces have taken control of Basra and Baghdadi villages in Lower and Middle Shabelle, respectively. 7 people were killed, three AS fighters and four prisoners.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces
notes: 10 September 2018: US-backed "Danab" special forces have taken control of Basra and Baghdadi villages in Lower and Middle Shabelle, respectively. Fatalities coded as 10 and spread across two locations. *Note- Baghdadi is located near the Balcad town.
10 September 2018: An explosive-laden vehicle driven by an Al-Shabaab militant reportedly rammed into the Hodan district headquarters, killing 6 civilians and injuring 16 others.
10 September 2018: Amaq News Agency (Pro-IS) releases a video depicting the assassination of a Puntland Customs soldier by Islamic State gunmen in Bossaso.
10 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters attack a Somali National Army checkpoint in Hodan district. A civilian and one Al-Shabaab gunmen were injured in the clash.
10 September 2018: An Omar Mohamud pastoralist was killed by Habargidir pastoralists in Ballibusle, Mudug, as part of a clan-related dispute.
10 September 2018: A convoy escorting SouthWest state MP and top commander was targeted by a landmine blast at Hawo Abdi area. Casualties unknown.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 10 September 2018: AMISOM forces posted in Aw Dheegle fire artillery rounds towards an al Shabaab HVT meeting held in Bariire. Al-Shabaab commander Moalim Hashi Jinow was killed.

10 September 2018: Unidentified warplanes (US or Kenyan) conducted an airstrike on suspected AS base near Jana Cabdalle, Afmadow district . Several missiles were fired which destroyed the suspected AS location. Casualties from the attack were unknown. A second source (late breaking) reported 18 deaths.

9 September 2018: On the evening of the 9th of September, a group of Al-Shabaab fighters attacked a military base manned by Somali National Army soldiers in Hilawaa district of the capital, sparking armed clashes. According to the source the attackers were able to take control of the base following the exchange of gunfire. No info on casualties.
9 September 2018: Somali National Army forces battled Al-Shabaab fighters on the road near Basra town. Casualties are unknown.

9 September 2018: Al Shabaab attacked an Police checkpoint in Heliwa's Suuq Xaloota before a patrol of Somali soldiers intervened, killing 1 and injuring 3 insurgents who were detained. 1 soldier was killed and 1 injured.
9 September 2018: Unidentified gunmen assassinated Ministry of Planning Official Hassan Omar Ganey near his home in Hodan, Mogadishu. Gunmen fled the scene.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Somalia (2017-) Prison Guards
notes: 9 September 2018: A prison officer and a woman were shot and seriously wounded by unknown assailants in Netco area of Bossaso. It is unclear if the prison officer was armed at the time of the attack - indications suggest he was not.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 9 September 2018: A government soldier shot and killed a NISA soldier in Afgoye town after an unknown dispute. The perpetrator was later apprehended by security forces.

9 September 2018: A charcoal seller was found dead at Goracdhere grazing area (c. 07 km north west of Bula Geduld Village and c. 30 km north east of Kismayo Town). No further info. Approximate coordinates used.
9 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters attacked a base manned by Somali National Army (SNA) Soldiers between Mahaday and Jowhar towns, Middle Shabelle region, killing 2 soldiers.
9 September 2018: An IED concealed in a wheelbarrow exploded in the Siinay vegetable market, Wardhigley district. 4 people, including municipal tax collecting officers, were wounded.
9 September 2018: An IED buried in the Biyo Dengaka neighborhood livestock market, Heliwa, exploded. Al-Shabaab fighters later claimed responsibility for the incident.
9 September 2018: An IED concealed in a wheelbarrow detonates on Sinai Market, Yaqshiid, Mogadishu. At least one civilian is injured by the blast.
8 September 2018: Three municipal council officers were reportedly injured by a blast that rocked the Warta Nabada district of the capital, Mogadishu. No further info.

8 September 2018: Armed Bahararsame Dhulbahante fired shot at a convoy carrying other Dhulbahante subclan elders traveling to Dhammay. No injuries were reported.

8 September 2018: At least 5 Somali National Army soldiers (SNA) were reportedly killed during an attack by Al-Shabaab militants on their base in Baidoa town, Bay region. According to the source, attacking militants managed to temporarily overrun the base, seizing weapons before fleeing.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
notes: 8 September 2018: A bomb attack set by suspected Al-Shabaab militants reportedy detonated in Bulo Burte town, killing 2 Djiboutian soldiers and wounding two others, including one Somali National Army soldier. This comes on the same day as an armed attack on a Djiboutian base, which ended in injuries.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: 8 September 2018: Ugandan troops (AMISOM) fire several mortar rounds towards a group of al Shabaab militants located approximately 4km north-west of Arabiska, Afgooye. One UPDF soldier collapsed and died over undetermined motives.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force

7 September 2018: Suspected al Shabaab fighters attack a Somali National Army checkpoint located near Abdi Waceyl Cinema in Heliwa district. Media reports suggest three people including a soldier and two bystanders were killed.

7 September 2018: Suspected al Shabaab assailant hurls a hand grenade towards a group of Somali National Army soldiers in front of the Hormud building in Baidoa's Isha neighbourhood. One soldier was injured.

7 September 2018: Armed clashes between national security forces and unidentified militants were reported in the Huriwaa area of the capital, Mogadishu, after gunmen attacked a security point in the area. No info on casualties.

7 September 2018: US forces and allied Somali specially trained soldiers conducted a raid on the house of Somalia's First President "Aden Abdulle Osman Daar" located near Janale Town, lower Shabelle region. Gunfire reportedly damaged the house during the clashes, although it is unclear exactly who the attacking forces were firing at. No injuries were reported, and the Somali government has since issued an apology for the attack.

notes: 7 September 2018: An explosion reportedly targeted AMISOM troops camped in the Shalambod area of Marka district, Lower Shabelle. 6 September 2018: Two local militias clash over control for a ship that mistakenly anchored near Gala Ood; south of Eyl in Nugaal region. The motives behind the anchoring and resulting casualty figures are unknown.

Fatalities spread across two locations.

6 September 2018: The killing of a Baharsame clansman set off clashes between Dhulbahante/Qayaad and Baharsame sub clan militias in Dharkeyn-Genyo and Dhammay villages, Togdheer region. 11 militiamen were killed and 20 injured as a result of the outbreak of violence. Fatalities spread across two locations.
5 September 2018: Unidentified gunmen assassinated an Somali National Army soldier who was travelling on a motorbike through Waaberi district, Mogadishu.
5 September 2018: Suspected al Shabaab militants hurl a hand grenade inside General Gordon barracks in Hodan district. Two Somali National Army soldiers were injured. The assailants escaped.
5 September 2018: Suspected Al Shabaab gunmen attacked and killed four Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers and two civilians in Mogadishu's Karaan District.
5 September 2018: Al-Shabaab-linked militants reportedly detained 60 Elders from the Galguduud region after a dispute over blood money arose.

Unidentified military airplanes reportedly fired up to 5 missiles at Al-Shabaab targets in Bu'ale town, Middle Juba region. According to the source, an unspecified number of Al-Shabaab fighters were killed in the strikes. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
5 September 2018: A Habar-yonis/Sacad Yonis camel herder shot and killed a woman from Habar-Geeko/Biciide near Elaweyne town. No further info.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
notes: 4 September 2018: Armed clashes were reported between two groups of Puntland police forces. No further info. At least one officer was wounded.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 4 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters reportedly attacked AMISOM troops in Qoryoley town, located in the southern region of Lower Shabelle. According to the source, Al-Shabaab fighters were able to gain control of the town temporarily overnight, before pulling out the next morning. AMISOM troops later reported the event, claiming to have repelled the attack on their base and confirming to have killed two Al-Shabaab militiamen during the clashes.

3 September 2018: Hawadle and Habargidir clan militias clash over a land dispute near Banyaaley, Beledweyn in Hiiran. One Hawadle militiaman was killed and a second injured. Both clans are reportedly mobilizing for further conflict.
3 September 2018: Police forces opened fire on football fans after they threw stones at security forces. 1 person was killed.
3 September 2018: Al-Shabaab-linked gunmen assassinate a Clan elder in Hawl Wadaag, Mogadishu. Another civilian was injured during the attack.
3 September 2018: Unidentified gunmen conduct a drive-by shooting in Karan's Jamhuuriya neigbourhood (Mogadishu). Four people, including two nearby SNPF officers, were killed. The assailants escaped.
3 September 2018: Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate a former civil servant of the Hiirshabelle administration in Warta Nabada, Mogadishu. The assailants escaped the scene.
3 September 2018: Hiirshabelle forces attack an illegal checkpoint set by clan militiamen near Boorow, Jowhar district. One militiaman was killed.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: 3 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters claim to have attacked and killed three Ethiopian soldiers in the Diinsoor town area, Bay Region. An additional four soldiers were also wounded in the attack.

2 September 2018: Al-Shabaab militiamen attacked a SWSPF convoy returning from an operation in Togerhoos. Four SWSPF soldiers were injured during the ambush. Further clashes saw Al Shabaab regain control of Togerhoos.
2 September 2018: Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate an elder in Tarabela Sheikh Ibrahim, Daynile. The assailants escaped. The motives behind the incident are unknown.

2 September 2018: At least three Somali soldiers and two children were killed and over ten others were injured after a car bomb exploded near a Quranic school in Hawlwadag district, Mogadishu. According to witnesses, a suicide bomber drove an explosive laden car into the district headquarters. Al-Shabaab has claimed responsibility for the attack. The fatality count includes the suicide bomber.
2 September 2018: Al-Shabaab linked gunmen reportedly shot dead a government tax collector and his security body-guard in the Bakara market, Mogadishu.

2 September 2018: Suspected Al-Shabaab gunmen reportedly assassinated two Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers in the Hamar Jadiid area of Warta Nabada, Mogadishu. Both soldiers were armed at the time of the attack.

2 September 2018: Police forces arrived to the scene of a violent interaction between a government tax collector and Al-Shabaab-linked gunmen in the Bakaara market of Mogadishu and opened fire, killing two civilians and wounding four others. The source did not specify why the police officers shot the civilians.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)

Early September (likely), clashes between rival tribes were reported in Dumay area in Sool Region. According to the source, "recent" clashes resulted in the death of 10 people, and a regional MP in Sool accused the Somaliland administration of fueling the fighting.

1 September 2018: Jubaland and SNAF (43 Brigade) forces launch a hit-and-run assault on an al Shabaab position near Kobon town, Lower Jubba. Five IED cashes were discovered and subsequently destroyed. No injuries or fatalities were reported.
31 August 2018: Suspected Al-Shabaab militants hurl a grenade at the police headquarters in Waaberi district, Mogadishu. No casualties reported.

31 August 2018: A Somali National Army vehicle was targeted with a landmine blast, near the outskirts of Afgooye town, Lower Shabelle region. According to a local witness, the blast occurred in Wanlaweyn area when it was hit by a blast. The driver (a soldier), and a woman (civilian) were killed, while two others were wounded. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

31 August 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters have reportedly killed two civilian shop owners near the Maqayqa military base, Afgooye district. One of the shop owners was reportedly beheaded by the group. This follows heavy clashes the night before with Somali army soldiers.

31 August 2018: Unidentified warplanes (US or Kenyan) carried out an airstrike on Al Shabaab positions near Bu'aale. Casualties unknown.

30 August 2018: Unidentified gunmen assasinate a civilian in Laascaanood town. No info on motive.

30 August 2018: Al-Shabaab militiamen and Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers clashed for around an hour in the town of Marka, Jilibka Marka area. The source did not publish information on casualties.

30 August 2018: Al-Shabaab forces reportedly attacked a Somali National Army position in Afgoye town, near midnight. Three soldiers were killed and 7 injured during the fighting. According to the source, government troops were able to push the attackers back, ending the fighting. Among the dead was the son of the former state minister of the Somali Presidential Palace. State forces later issued a report, claiming to have killed four Al-Shabaab fighters during the gunfight.

30 August 2018: Unidentified fighter jets (US or Kenyan) fire four missiles towards unidentified al Shabaab positions in Jilib. No casualties were reported. SOMTEL and HORMUD telecommunications masts were damaged.
29 August 2018: A Somali National Police officer shot dead a tuk-tuk driver after a dispute in Shibis area of Mogadishu. The perpetrator fled the scene.

29 August 2018: Al Shabaab fighters storm the residence of a Somali National Army officer in Xawaadley. The officer is injured following an exchange of gunfire. Al Shabaab fighters retreat from the area after burning two military vehicles.

29 August 2018: A US drone strike on an area located 40 km southwest of Mogadishu reportedly killed three Al-Shabaab fighters. The source specified that no civilians were killed or injured in the strike. Wanla Weyn given as an approximate location to the strike as per the description from the source.

29 August 2018: Two soldiers were killed and three others injured by an explosion that detonated as their vehicle passed in the Hodan district of the capital Mogadishu. Al-Shabaab has claimed responsibility for the attack.
29 August 2018: Al Shabaab militants attack on SNAF convoy passing through Bulalow village, Afgooye, using an IED bomb. 2 killed and 2 injured.

28 August 2018: Clan fighting was reported in the Qalanqale village on the outskirts of Dhusamareb town, Cadaado Gulguduud region, over a dispute involving grazing land. Injuries were reported but the clashes reportedly caused no fatalities. According to the source, local clan elders have now intervened and stopped the fighting.

28 August 2018: Unidentified gunmen assassinated a prominent civilian Mowliid Adan in Belet Weyne Town. Gunmen fled before the security forces arrived.

26 August 2018: Unidentified gunmen killed a civilian male child in Yaaqshiid, Mogadishu.
26 August 2018: Islamic State gunmen claimed (via Amaq news) that they shot and killed a Somali National Police officer in Yaaqshiid, Mogadishu.
26 August 2018: A Somali National Army soldier shot and killed a Tuk-tuk driver in Belet Weyne after a dispute at a checkpoint.
26 August 2018: Al-Shabab fighters carried out a surprise attack on government forces in Bar Sanguni area on the outskirt of Kismayo in Lower Jubba Region. No info on casualties.

26 August 2018: Al Shabaab (AS) fighters conducted a hit and run attack against a Somali National Army position in Hudur town. AS fighters shot, using small arms, towards the direction of the base. One SNA solder was injured in the attack.
26 August 2018: US forces carried out an airstrike on Al Shabaab insurgents killing 3 in Gendershe town.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 26 August. Buried IED detonated as a NISA vehicle passed. 2 NISA soldiers were killed and 3 soldiers and 1 civilian injured.
25 August 2018: Al Shabaab insurgents intercepted a convoy of 9 donkey carts carrying supplies to Waajid. They siezed the carts and killed 4 drivers while 5 others fled.

25 August 2018: 4 Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers were reportedly killed when Al-Shabaab militiamen attacked the Daynuunay military base in Baidhabo district, Bay region. Two Al-Shabaab fighters were also killed in the attack, and several others injured. According to the report, Al-Shabaab forces managed to take control of the area for several minutes before being pushed out again.
25 August 2018: Somali National Soldiers engaged Al-Shabaab forces in the Burdhubo area in Gedo Region, resulting in the death of 7 AS militiamen and 2 Al-Shabaab leaders.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 25 August 2018: Al-Shabab fighters in Lower Shabelle region reportedly attacked African Union forces travelling outside El Wareegow area near Marka town, sparking armed clashes. Injuries were reported but no fatalities were specified by the source.

25 August 2018: Somali National Army soldiers (SNA) have reportedly opened fire on a mini-bus full of civilians near Kulan Jarer village between Waajid and Xudur districts, killing at least 3 and injuring 7 others, and looting property in the vehicle. The source did not indicate why the soldiers opened fire.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 25 August 2018: A group of Puntland forces have reportedly attacked the bank in northern Galkaayo, demanding that salaries be paid. Protesting soldiers also blocked roads linking the bank to the rest of the town.
24 August 2018: Unidentified gunmen assassinated an Jubaland soldier near a mosque in Baardheere town. The gunmen escaped the scene before the security forces could respond.

24 August 2018: HirShabelle forces carried out an operation to remove checkpoints illegally established by Gaaljecel militias. After an exchange of gunfire the clan militia withdrew. There were no reports of casualties.

24 August 2018: Al Shabaab insurgents fired on a convoy escorting the Deputy Governor of Lower Shabelle. The two groups briefly traded gunfire for about 20 minutes. The convoy that was heading to Marka town reached their destination. No casualties were reported.

24 August 2018: Unidentified armed men and police forces reportedly clashed exchanging gunfire at the Milk Market in Seybiano area, Hodan, Mogadishu. One person, alleged to be one of the armed men, was killed while another civilian bystander was killed in the confrontation.
24 August 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters have reportedly killed a Somali National Army government soldier in Biya'ada (Biyo Cadde), Middle Shabelle region.

24 August 2018: An Al-Shabaab gunmen stepped down from a public minibus at a checkpoint and fired on Somali National Army soldiers. The soldiers return fire killed 3 civilians and injured 1. The insurgent escaped the scene.

24 August 2018: Al Shabaab concealed IEDs in the bodies of 2 soldiers. Southwest forces detonated these devices as they retook the town of Daynuunay. 2 soldiers were killed, along with 1 insurgent killed and 2 injured.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 23 August 2018: A gunfight broke out between two groups of Jubaland soldiers in Kismayo city after the arrest of a senior officer. No info on casualties.

23 August 2018: Clashes continued in the town of Marka between Somali National Army soldiers led by Abdullahi Ali Anod on one side and Al-Shabaab militants on the other. According to the source, 6 government soldiers and 4 Al-Shabaab fighters were killed. SNA soldiers claim to have arrested 27 Al-Shabaab militiamen during operations on the 24 August 2018.
23 August 2018: Al-Shabaab militiamen claim to have killed two soldiers and wounded three more after engaging in short clashes in Barsanguni area near Kismayo.
23 August 2018: Al Shabaab insurgents killed 2 civilians travelling between Ceel Barde and Xudur. The motive of the incident was not known.

23 August 2018: Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers reportedly shot dead a civilian riding in an ambulance at a checkpoint in Daynile district, Mogadishu. The reasoning behind the killing is unclear, however, the source did clarify that the killed person was part of a funeral procession.

23 August 2018: The convoy of deputy minister of defence, Abdullahi Olad Roble was reportedly targeted by an IED blast near the Somali Ministry of Defence. No injuries or fatalities were reported by the source.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
notes: 24 August 2018: A roadside bomb explosion has killed a Djiboutian soldier and wounded two others in the town of Jalalaqsi. The source indicated that Al-Shabaab was responsible for the attack. Al-Shabaab later claimed to have killed 3 soldiers during the attack. Fatalities coded at the most conservative point.

22 August 2018: Forces loyal to Gen Abdullahi Ali Anod have reportedly clashed with Al-Shabaab militants in Marka town, with the soldiers taking control of a market place formerly controlled by the AS militias. No info on casualties.
22 August 2018: Unidentified armed men reporteldy shot dead a civilian in the Bakaara market in Mogadishu. Police forces responded to the scene, prompting the perpetrators to flee.

22 August 2018: suspected Al-Shabaab militants reportedly shot dead two brothers in the Xoosh village, Dharkenley district. According to the source, one of the brothers was a member of the Somali National Army, although he was not on duty at the time of the attack. Police forces in the area have arrested several persons in connection to the incident.

assoc_actor_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 21 August 2018: Al-Shabaab militants and Somali National Army troops backed by AMISOM forces in Marka traded gunfire for around 4 hours. Local sources stated that 7 civilians were injured in the incident.

21 August 2018: Unidentified assailants reportedly hurled a hand grenade at a hotel occupied by the Baraawe district commissioner in Barawe town, Lower Shabeelle region. Security guards at the hotel opened fire after the explosion. No fatalities or injuries were reported.

21 August 2018: Private security guards clashed with youth at the Royal Palace hotel (AbdulAziz district) over entry into the hotel theatre, where a music concert was being held. The dispute escalated and the guards fired into the gathering crowd, injuring two.

21 August 2018: United States drones reportedly carried out an airstrike targeting Al-Shabaab fighters 46 kilometers northeast of the port town of Kismayo, killing two Al-Shabaab linked men in the area. Local sources have suggested that the victims of the strike were part of Al-Shabaab's roadside bomb engineering team.

21 August 2018: An off-duty soldier and his civilian brother-in-law were killed in a landmine explosion that hit their vehicle as it traveled between Lafoole University and Arbiska area in Afgooye district, lower Shabelle.

20 August 2018: Unidentified armed men driving a motorcycle reportedly shot and killed a government soldier in the Nasteho village, Wadajir district in Mogadishu. According to the report, the soldier was armed and on duty at the time of the attack. The attackers grabbed the victim's gun and escaped.

20 August 2018: Unidentified armed men reportedly shot and killed a government soldier in the Tabellah Shiekh Ibrahim village, Dayanile district of Mogadishu. According to the source, the soldier was armed and on duty at the time of the attack.

20 August 2018: Suspected Al-Shabaab militants shot and killed a government soldier near the Bakara market in Mogadishu. The perpetrators escaped from the scene after shooting the soldier. On the same day, Al-Shabaab militants hurled a grenade at government soldiers stationed in the market. No injuries were reported.
20 August 2018: Unidentified gunmen shot dead a Somali National Army (SNA) soldier in the Dabka junction (Hawl Wadaag junction), Mogadishu.

20 August 2018: Two civilians were reportedly shot dead by the governor of Sool's body guards in Lasanod town, Sool region. Local reports suggested that the body guards thought that the victims intended to attack the governor.
20 August 2018: Unidentified gunmen have reportedly shot and killed a barber shop owner in Waberi district of the Somali capital, Mogaidhu. The perpetrator of the killing escaped.
20 August. A UVIED detonated underneath a civilian vehicle in Arbiska. At least 2 were killed in the explosion with several other casualties reported. The motive for the attack is unknown.

19 August 2018: Two armed militias from the Gaaljecal and Jajeele clans reportedly engaged in short clashes over a land dispute in the Gacanka area, Belet Weyne district. No injuries or fatalities were reported. According to the source, elders from both clans met to mediate the dispute.

19 August 2018: An unidentified assailant reportedly hurled a hand grenade at Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers in Marka town, Lower Shabelle. No injuries or fatalities were reported. Ealier in the day, SNA soldiers had engaged in clashes with Al-Shabaab forces in the town.

19 August 2018: Gunmen with suspected links to Al-Shabaab reportedly shot and killed a police officer in the Taleex village area, Hodan district of the capital Somalia. The source specified that the officer was armed and on duty at the time of the attack.

19 August 2018: Al-Shabaab militants reportedly attacked a position held by Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers in the KM 20 village area (Caliyaale), Balcad district, sparking an exchange of gunfire that lasted around an hour. Two SNA soldiers were killed.

assoc_actor_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 19 August 2018: Somali National Army soldiers (SNA), backed by AMISOM troops, reportedly repelled an attempted attack by Al-Shabaab forces on newly-captured areas of Marka town, Lower Shabelle region. The source did not provide any info on casualties. SNA soldiers took new areas of Marka town during armed clashes on the 18 August 2018.

19 August 2018: Al-Shabaab militants reportedly attacked a position held by Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers in Daynuunay area on the outskirst of Baidoa district. According to the report, an unspecified number of soldiers were killed during the clashes, and a cache of weapons were seized by the attacking forces. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
19 August 2018: Al-Shabaab militants reportedly attacked Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers in Bur Hakaba town, Bay region, killing one.

18 August 2018: an explosion targeted Somali government and army officials in Mogadishu's Hodan district as they passed through the Taleh junction area, causing an unspecified number of fatalities. Al-Shabaab media claimed that militants loyal to the group were responsible for the attack. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

18 August 2018: Somali National Army soldiers claim to have seized control of Lusiya, Obasibo, and El-Haji neighborhoods in the port town of Marka after clashing with Al-Shabaab forces in the area. No info on casualties.

18 August 2018: Somali National Army soldiers claim to have siezed control of Lusiya, Obasibo, and El-Haji neighborhoods in the port town of Marka after clashing with Al-Shabaab forces in the area. No info on casualties.
18 August. Fighting between Mareham and Owramale militia broke out, causalities not known.

18 August 2018: Somali National Army soldiers based in Shalaambood reportedly fought intense clashes with Al-Shabaab militiamen on the road between Shalambad and Km50 village, resulting in 12 fatalities. This is separate from a bomb attack on a former commander that happened in the same area the day before.

18 August 2018: Fighters from the pro-Al-Shabaab group have reportedly executed two captured soldiers from the Somali National Army. According to the report, the soldiers were captured after fleeing Baidoa town, Bakool region and were captured somewhere near Hudur town, Xudur region.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 17 August 2018: Puntland security forces reportedly attacked a military base housing Al-Shabaab fighters in the Galgala mountains. According to the report, at least 5 al-Shabaab fighters were killed during the resulting clashes.
17 August. Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a civilian in Daynile.

17 August 2018: According to a pro-Al-Shabaab media source, pro-Al-Shabaab gunmen shot and killed a police officer in the Heliwa area of the capital, Mogadishu. The officer was armed and on duty at the time of the attack.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: 17 August 2018: A group of Al-Shabaab militiamen reportedly ambushed a convoy of AMISOM soldiers (Ugandan) travelling through the Gandawe settlement, Marka district. According to the report, AS militiamen first targeted the lead vehicle with an IED blast, then fired machine gun and small arms fire at the AMISOM troops. Three soldiers were reported injured as a result of the attack.
17 August 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters reportedly hurled a hand grenade at and exchanged gunfire with guards at a hotel in Baraawe where local S/W officials were meeting. No casualties were reported.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
notes: 17 August 2018: A remotely detonated IED exploded at the Gololey village, Balcad district, as an AMISOM convoy was headed to Mogadishu from Jowhar town. The lead vehicle was allegedly damaged. Three Burundian soldiers were injured. Al-Shabaab later claimed responsibility for the attack.
17 August 2018: An IED device was reportedly planted in a tree in Hodan district, Mogadishu. One person was reportedly injured (presumed to be a civilian) in the blast.

17 August 2018: The former head of operations of the Somali National Army was reportedly targeted by a bomb that exploded as his convoy passed on the Mogadishu-Marka road between Shalaambood and KM 60 village, Shabelle region. No injuries were reported.

17 August 2018: A Somali National Army (SNA) convoy traveling between between Ceel-Wareegow and Buushka settlements, Marka district, was reportedly targeted by an IED bomb. According to the report, four SNA soldiers were killed in the explosion while three others were injured. No party has claimed responsibility for the blast.
17 August 2018: Al-Shabaab militants reportedly destroyed a water tanker belonging to the Somali National Army with an IED planted earlier in Muri town. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 16 August 2018: Pro-Al-Shabaab media has reported an explosion targeting a convoy of AMISOM troops in Bulo Mareer, Lower Shabeele. According to the report, the AMISOM troops suffered losses that included "injuries and death". Unknown fatalities coded as 10

August, 2018: Inter-clan violence in the Galguduud region reportely resulted in the death of at least 5 clansmen in or near the month of August, 2018. No further info. This event is linked to the arrest of around 60 elders in early September by the Al-Shabaab-linked administration.

15 August. An unidentified gunman opened fire indiscriminately at night. Motive is unclear but police believe gunmen aimed to sow discord in local community. Gunman escaped but no casualties reported.

15 August 2018: Somali National Army soldiers reportedly killed 11 al-Shabab militants including four commanders during clashes in Muse Haji and Arare areas of Jubbaland state. At least one of the dead held Kenyan citizenship. *The source specified that the areas specified are located "near Bu'aale".

04 November. 101 cases of rape were recorded in Somaliland between January and November 2018 (coded as one event per month); 105 individuals were accused of rape out of which 87 were arrested and charged.

15 August 2018: Pro-Al Shabaab media have reported that militants loyal to the group planted an IED in Hiliwa district of Mogadishu targeting a Bajaj carrying police officers. One police officer was reportedly killed in the blast, with a second injured. A second blast targeted police responders, resulting in additional injuries. *A second source has reported the person killed was a civilian and not a police officer.
August, month of. US forces launch an air strike againt an al Shabaab location 74 miles NW of Mogadishu, killing 4.
14 August: Unidentified gunmen injured the driver of a Tuk-tuk near the Marwaas Mosque. The gunmen fled the scene on foot.

14 August 2018: Somali security forces have reportedly thwarted an attempted attack by Al-Shabaab militiamen on the Alamada village, located just outside of the capital city of Mogadishu. According to the report, of the 5 Al-Shabaab linked gunmen involved in the attack one was injured in the firefight. No fatalities were reported.

14 August 2018: Unidentified gunmen riding on a auto-rickshaw (Bajaj) reportedly attacked a security checkpoint manned by Somali National Army soldiers in the Bal'ad area north of the capital. Several people were reportedly wounded during the gunbattle, which lasted just over an hour.

14 August 2018: Somali security forces backed by soldiers from the United States Army reportedly clashed with Al-Shabaab forces in the Basra settlement area near Balcad district town. US helicopters backed the forces, striking Al-Shabaab fighters with missiles. According to the report, 10 Al-Shabaab forces were arrested following the clashes. No info on casualties.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
notes: 13 August 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters reportedly attacked an AMISOM base (Djiboutian) west of Bulo Burte district, Hiran region. After a short exchange of gunfire AS forces retreated back into the bush. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

13 August 2018: Unidentified gunmen on a Bajaj reportedly opened fire on a soldier at the Balcad junction neighborhoood, Heliwa district. The officer responded with gunfire. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

13 August 2018: A group of Al-Shabaab fighters reportedly attacked the Buulo Fuley (Buulo Folyo) checkpoint in Afgoy district, sparking clashes that lasted for around 20 minutes. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

13 August 2018: Al-Shabaab militiamen reportedly attacked a checkpoint manned by Somali National Army soldiers in the Calamaad (Calamadaha) area, Afgoye district. Soldiers responded with gunfire. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

13 August 2018: At least 9 people were killed and several others wounded after clashes involving Al-Shabaab militiamen and local fighters in Jilib town, middle Jubba region. According to the report, AS fighters arrested several farmers, after which locals took up arms and began clashing with Al-Shabaab forces stationed in the area. The fatality counts include 3 Al-Shabaab militiamen and 6 local clan fighters.

13 August 2018: US drones reportedly launched missiles at unknown targets in the Ceel-Mukayle settlement, Afgoye district. Residents confirmed explosions and Al-Shabaab fighters cordoned off the area. No info on casualties is availiable.
12 August. SWSPF officer shot and killed a civilian man at the livestock market after an argument over tax payment between the police officer and the victim. The perpetrator was arrested.

Clashes were reported on or around the 11 of August, 2018, involving Somali National Soldiers and Al-Shabaab fighters in the number 50 village (Bushka area) in Lower Shabelle region. According to the report, the fighting lead to "deaths and injuries". Unknown fatalities coded as 10
11 August. Unidentified gunmen attacked a civilian vehicle travelling between Galinsoor and Adaado. 1 passenger was killed in the attack.

On or near 11 August 2018, Somali soldiers accompanied by US soldiers reportedly killed 4 civilians (two men, a mother and her son) in the Leego town, Bay region. No further details were given by the pro-Al Shabaab source.

On the 11 August 2018, Somali national soldiers reportedly conducted a military operation in Qoryooley, Lower Shebelle, targeting Al-Shabaab commanders. According to the report, multiple (exact number is unknown) commanders linked to the Al-Shabaab group were killed during the clashes. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

11 August 2018: Inter-clan clashes between the Awramale and Majeerteen clan militiamen reportedly sparked again, resulting in a gunbattle that killed 9 people. According to the report, clan elders have instituted a ceasefire.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: 11 August 2018: Three Ugandan soldiers and two Somali government soldiers were reportedly wounded by a landmine that hit their personnel carrier near Afgooye district, Lower Shabelle. Al Shabaab was allegedly responsible for the attack.

11 August 2018; An unidentified military warplane reportedly conducted airstrikes in Lego area of Lower Shabelle region, apparently targeting Al-Shabaab bases in the area. No info on casualties. *note, the location given by the source may have been incorrect, Leego town is located in Bay region.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: 11 August 2018: At least 4 civilians were killed by a Kenyan warplane that launched missiles at Laan Quru village, located between El Waq and Beled Hawo in Gedo Regio (approx. coordinates used). According to the source, the killed included a mother and two children as well as an elderly person (the source did not specify who the 4th person was).
"Two female health workers employed by a local NGO were abducted by an AOG. Local community members negotiated for their release. The staff members were held for approximately 36 hours."

Gunmen linked to the Al-Shabaab group have reportedly attacked Somali government soldiers stationed at a checkpoint in Yaqshid district of the capital Somalia. According to the Pro-Al-Shabaab source, Calamada, gunmen attacked the checkpoint on the 10 August, killing and wounding an unknown number. Unknown fatalities coded as 10
10 August. Al Shabaab kidnapped 18 Gaaljecel clan civilians in Ceel Cali.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: 10 August, 2018: According to pro-Al-Shabaab media, Ethiopian soldiers going to chew Qat were hit by an IED bomb set by Al-Shabaab militiamen, causing injuries or fatalities. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

09 August. One person was killed after two armed groups (Madhiban and Arab Salah clans) clashed over a clan retaliation issue at Kalabayr Village (c. 20 km West of Bursalah Village). Puntland Police responded and quelled the fighting investigations are ongoing.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 9 August 2018: Somali national forces backed by AMISOM troops have reportedly engaged Al-Shabaab militants in clashes in Awqoy village, located 30 km from Afgoye town (direction/location unknown). No info on casualties.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: August 9 2018: 7 Ugandan soldiers were reportedly killed in an ambush set by Al-Shabaab gunmen in the outskirts of Qoryoley town, Qoryoley District, Lower Shabelle region.
9 August 2018, 5 members of the Somali Red Crescent Society were reportedly kidnapped by suspected Al-Shabaab militiamen in Busle village located on the outskirts of Baidoa.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: 8 August 2018: A Kenyan military plane reportedly conducted airstrikes in Gadon Dabo town of Balad Hawo district, in Gedo region. Local residents being quoted by a pro-Al-Shabaab source say that the airstrikes killed a local herdsman (civilian).

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces
assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 8 August 2018: Somali special forces (Danab) backed by AMISOM troops have reportedly taken control of Bulo-Konto, Dangiga Balow, Basro (also known as Walamoy) and Garas-weyne villages after clashing with Al-Shabaab militiamen in the area. The source did not provide any details on casualties.

The source did not provide any details on casualties.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 8 August 2018: Joint Somali National Amry troops and Amisom forces reportedly took control of Gaywirow village, Qoryooley distrct in Lower Shabelle Region after clashing with militants linked to Al-Shabaab. No info on casualties.
08 August. Unidentified gunmen attacked a security checkpoint in Dharkenley. The soldiers returned fire. No causalities reported.

On or around 8 August 2018, the bodies of two Oromo (Ethiopian) men were found in Bosaso town. This comes with a context of heightened tensions between Oromo and Somali communities in eastern Ethiopia, where fighting between the two ethnic groups has been going on for months. A second source confirmed the event, adding that the dead had been stabbed by a knife.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 8 August 2018: Following an IED blast targeting their convoy in Heliwa district of the capital Mogadishu, AMISOM troops (nationality unspecified) opened fire on civilian bystanders, killing 3-5 people, including one woman.

8 August 2018: Battles continue for a second day; Majeerteen and Owramale clansman clashed over a land dispute in Dalsan village 20 KM SE of Kismayo town. Two family members from Majeerteen clan were reported dead following the gunbattles.

8 August 2018: Somali National Army soldiers clashed with one another after one soldier accused the other's brother of being loyal to Al-Shabaab. The argument escalated into a gunfight, during which a soldier was killed along with two women bystanders. The soldier who killed the other was arrested and taken into custody.
8 August 2018: Unidentified armed men reportedly shot and killed a Somali National Army soldier in the Suuqweynaha market, Karan district (Mogadishu). The attackers escaped.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 8 August 2018: AMISOM troops reportedly attacked AS positions in Awgoye (located 10 km north of Afgoye). After a brief exchange of gunfire both parties withdrew from the area. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: 8 August 2018: Suspected Kenyan air-force planes launched airstrikes on known Al-Shabaab held territory near Tuulan-qurac town (location unknown, however the source has pointed that it is near El Wak town) in Gedo region. Confirmed report suggested there were casualties, however no exact numbers were reported and unclear if fatalities among them.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 8 August 2018: Two remotely triggered IED bombs went off as a convoy of AMISOM troops was driving through Heliwa district, Mogadish. According to the source, the first IED went off, damaging the first vehicle in the convoy and then the second exploded when AMISOM troops stopped to assess the damage. No injuries or fatalities were reported in the blasts.

Abdullahi Ali Omar, Golis Telecommunication Company assistant manager, was reportely killed in Bosaso town of Bari region on the evening of the 7th of August by unidentified gunmen. Al-Shabaab leaders have denied being connected to the shooting.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
notes: 7 August 2018: Fighters linked to Al-Shabaab launched an attack on a Djiboutian base in Bulo Burto town, Hiiran district. According to the report, clashes were fought throughout the night, and an explosion at the airport during the fighting killed and wounded Djiboutian soldiers. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

7 August 2018: Unidentified gunmen reportedly shot dead a police officer (identified as an instructor at the Police academy) in Ansaloti village, Hamarjajab District. The attackers managed to escape and could not be identified, but were suspected to be Al Shabaab. Another source reported the victim as a civilian
7 August 2018: Majeerteen and Owramale clansmen clashed over a land dispute in Dalsan village 20 KM SE of Kismayo town (approx. Coordinates used). Two Majeerteen clansmen were reportedly injured.

7 August 2018: Unidentified armed militants reportedly shot and killed a police officer using pistols in the Beerta Jaadka, Seypiano area of Wadajir district, Mogadishu. The language of the report suggested that the police officer was armed and on duty at the time of the attack. Another policeman was targeted on the same day in Mogadishu.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 7 August 2018: Clashes between Somali National Army troops backed by AMISOM forces on one side and Al-Shabaab militiamen on the other were reportedly fought in Gaaywarow, Qoryooley district. 7 civilians and a single AMISOM soldier were wounded during the clashes, while 5 AS militiamen were killed and 5 injured.

On the 6th of August, suspected to be al-Shabab fighters armed with pistols reportedly shot and killed a Somali soldier in a western neighborhood of Jalaqsi town, Hiiraan region. The source specified that the soldier was armed at the time of the attack.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: August 6, 2018: A landmine explosion targeting an Ethiopian military convoy as it left Baidoa town and headed toward Bardale reportedly killed and injured an unspecified number of soldiers. Al-Shabaab officials speaking to Radio Andalus confirmed the event. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

6 August 2018: A crowd gathered at the scene of a fire in Jayga village neighbourhood, in Wadajir district of the capital, Mogadishu, and began throwing stones at fire fighting vehicles for arriving late. Somali National Army forces arrived to the scene and opened fire, injuring two rioters.

6 August 2018: Al-Shabaab linked gunmen reportedly attacked a Somali National Army base located in Bulo Burto town, Hiiran region. According to the source, Al-Shabaab militiamen fired on the base with small arms for a short time before retreating. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

6 August 2018: Suspected Al-Shabaab militants reportedly attacked a Somali National Army checkpoint in Siinka Dheer village vicinity, in Dayniile District of the capital Mogadishu. After a brief exchange of gunfire AS militiamen retreated. No information on casualties.

On the 5th August, 2018, a suicide bomber reportedly detonated a car bomb at a checkpoint in Afgooye, killing 4 civilians and wounding several others. According to the source, the bomber had aimed at a military vehicle but missed the target, killing the civilians. Two soldiers were also wounded in the attack. Al-Shabaab has claimed responsibility. *The al-Shabaab media outlet claimed that 15 soldiers were killed in the attack, fatalities coded at their lowest point for conservative estimates (includes the suicide bomber)

On August 5th, 2018, at least 4 people were killed and 7 others injured in a suicide car-bomb explosion during a traffic jam on Mogadishu's Makkah Al Mukaramah Road. According to the source, those killed were in cars and sitting in the Bar Italia (Hawl-Wadag district). *fatality count includes the suicide bomber. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack, claiming to have targeted Somali SNAF/NISA soldiers.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: On the 5th of August, Radio Dalsan reported that Al-Shabaab militants had shelled an AMISOM base in Bal'ad town, causing injuries. According to the source, the shelling hit the base located in Hawa-Tako neighbourhood of the town. AMISOM responded by firing back mortars. No casualties were reported.

5 August 2018: 5 Somali national soldiers were injured in an IED blast targeting Somali National Army Second Division commander, Ali Arif. According to the source, the bomb was attached by unidentified militants to the car of the commander, and it detonated once the vehicle reached the inside the old textiles factory in Balcad district.

5 August 2018: Shabelle Media Network reported that Al-Shabaab gunmen had executed 4 people, three of whom were Jubbaland soldiers, in the town of Jilib, Middle Juba region. The 4th person executed was accused of murder.

On the 5th August, 2018, armed men with suspected links to Al-Shabaab reportedly shot dead an elderly man, Hussein Hilowle, in Mogadishu's Karan district. Al Shabaab claimed he was a member of NISA, but this was not clear.

On the 5th August, 2018, Al-Shabaab linked militants have reportedly shot dead a Somali policeman in the Afar Irdodka area of Hamar Waye area, Mogadishu. According to the source, the policeman was killed by armed men with pistols shortly after exiting a mosque. *Seperate sources have reported the event taking place in Xamar Jabjab district.

5 August 2018: Shabelle Media Network reported that Al-Shabaab gunmen had executed 4 people, three of whom were Jubbaland soldiers, in the town of Jilib, Middle Juba region. The 4th person executed was accused of murder.

5 August 2018: Men with suspected links to Al-Shabaab have reportedly opened fire from their car on Somali National Army soldiers in their vehicle near Banadir junction road, in Hodan District of the capital Mogadishu. 2 men in the car were killed, as well as a civilian bystander. 2 government soldiers were also reportedly injured.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: 5 August 2018: Al-Shabaab-linked militants have reportedly attacked an AMISOM base (Ugandan) in the vicinity of the town of Arbacow, Afgooye district. According to the report, artillery, RPG, and gun fire were all used during the attack. No info on casualties. *note: Relief-web identifies the Arbacow base as being in or near Ceelasha Biyaha area.

5 August 2018: An IED of unknown origins reportedly exploded, apparently targeting government soldiers drinking tea in a shot in Ceel Wayn neighborhood of Wajid town. A single civilian was reportedly injured in the attack.

4 August 2018: Unidentified attackers reportedly hurled a grenade at Somali National Army forces in Yaaqshiid district, near the Lanta Towfiq branch office. Sources claim that the attackers were pursued and arrested, although their identity/affiliation remains unknown. No injuries or fatalities.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 04 August. Al Shabaab attacked HirShabelle and AMISOM forces on the edge of Jalalaqsi. A HirShabelle soldier was killed before attackers withdrew.
04 August 2018: unidentified gunmen shot and killed soldier serving under Somali police force in the Irdodko area of Xamar Wayne (Mogadisho, Banaadir).

4 August 2018: Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a Somali National Army soldier as he returned from praying at a mosque in El-Gaabta village neighbourhood, in Hamarjajab District. According to the source, the soldier was armed at the time, and claimed that the attackers stole the soldier's gun after killing him.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 4 August 2018: Al-Shabaab militants reportedly attacked a convoy of AMISOM troops (nationality unknown) headed from Lanta Buuro to KM50, firing an RPG at the convoy that had stopped near the Wareegow village located 13km North-East of Merka District. The two sides reportedly traded gunfire for about 30 minutes until Al-Shabaab fighters withdrew. No injuries or fatalities were reported.
