23 June. Two women were shot and killed after unidentified armed man gun fired at the front of their residence near Kulmiye Hotel in Garsoor village. The motive behind the shooting is unknown. Puntland police are investigating the incident.

22 June. Suspected al Shabaab assailant hurls a hand grenade towards a MoSF checkpoint in Hawl Wadaag. One MoSF soldier and two civilian bystanders were injured by the blast. The perpetrator escaped the scene.

22 June. Reports stated that a hand grenade was hurled at SNA checkpoint near the District Commissioner's Office neighbourhood, in Waberi District. Soldiers reacted with gunfire in the direction believed to be where the perpetrators were hiding. One person was injured by the blast. Government soldiers conducted security search operation of this incident and arrested several suspects.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 22 June. Reports stated that a RCIED buried along the roadside targeted AMISOM forces (consist of 9 battle wagons) at the Warmahan village neighbourhood, Afgoye District. After RCIED blast, al Shabaab engaged the forces in a well-organized direct ambush attack against Convoy which began with rocket propelled grenades (RPGs) followed by heavy gunfire which lasted about one hour after which al Shabaab militants withdrew. Two Vehicles were destroyed by IED explosion and RPG fired by al Shabaab militants. At least 11 people including soldiers and al Shabaab were killed in the fight.

22 June. Reports stated that the government soldiers reportedly shot and killed an unidentified militiaman and injured another one in Xawadley village approximately 24 Kms NE of Balcad District. This shooting came after the militants attempted to open the river edge flood bridge which was closed with sack and stones by the residence people and Government as to protect extra floods. Three others were captured and arrested by Hirshabelle forces.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: 22 June. UPDF forces fire several mortar rounds towards a group of al Shabaab fighters 3km north of FOB Embresso. Outcome and resulting casualty figures unknown.

21 June. Information indicates that suspected al Shabaab fighters ambushed a civilian Toyota transporting (Khad/Mira) from Hagardera Kenya to Hoosingo village at approx. 09km west of the village and (c.75kms SE of Dhobley town). The driver of the vehicle was reportedly killed in the attack while the second driver managed to escape the vehicle with the goods from the incident location.

21 June. Report indicates that a Kenyan warplane conducted an airstrike against an al Shabaab position at Tima Cade grazing area (approx. 25km S of Burdhubo district). According to the information, the warplane targeted al Shabaab hideouts.
21 June. Suspected al Shabaab fighters fire three 60mm mortar rounds towards the Parliament building. The rounds land 150-200m from the building. No casualties reported.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 21 June. Puntland and Somaliland forces exchange artillery fire at Tuko Raq. No causalities.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 21 June. Jubaland forces who were on foot security patrol clashed with al Shabaab fighters near Jubaland/Somali base at Sunguuni village (42km North East of Kismayo town). Four al Shabaab fighters and one Jubbland soldier were reportedly killed and others injured as the result of heavy gunfire exchange. The injured soldier was taken to Kismayo for treatment.

20 June. A hand grenade was hurled at SNA checkpoint near Ex. Control vicinity, in Dayniile District. Soldiers reacted with gunfire in general direction believed to be where the perpetrator(s) was hiding. Perpetrators not known.
20 June. Two unidentified clans clash in the outskirts of Muqakoori. The exact location of the skirmish and resulting casualty figures are unknown.

20 June. South West Special Police Forces (SWSPF) shot and killed three al Shabaab suspects driving a motorbike near Qod Qod village (approx. 30kms SE of Dinsoor district). The SWSPF were in a security operation and heading back to their base in Dinsoor district during the incident. No casualty was reported from SWSPF.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 20 June. Reports state that a RCIED targeting AMISOM supply convoy from Mogadishu heading to Jowhar town detonated at the Eggero settlement between Gololey and Garsaale village under Balcad District (Middle Shabelle region) followed by gunfire. One vehicle was reportedly damaged. One soldier was reported injured by the blast.

20 June. A Khat dealer was shot and injured after a dispute to pay taxes at the check near the Greenline between North and South Galkayo. The customs police seized the Mira Khat that trafficker attempted to smuggle without payment the legal duty. The injured person was taken to hospital for treatment and PL police are investigating the incident.

20 June. Local police forces in a security patrol shot and killed a man and injured two others in Adaado section of Berdale neighbourhood. The security forces reportedly suspected the man and opened fire at him. No further casualty reported form the incident. The police commissioner reportedly ordered the arrest of the men that perpetrated this crime.
20 June. Suspected al Shabaab detonates an explosive under the car of two students in Hodan district. One injury reported.

19 June. At least 12 al-Shabaab fighters were killed and several others escaped with injuries in a fierce fighting with Somali National Army (SNA) at a location in the southern port town of Kismayo known as Bar-Sanguni. United States forces were also involved. SNA and US were able to gain control of the area following the fighting.

19 June. Suspected al Shabaab member hurled a hand grenade at Dalacada police post of (Calanley neighbourhood in Kismayo town) the hand grenade reportedly hit and exploded the wall of the police post. The perpetrator managed to escape from the area. The security forces conducted search security operation after the incident to the roads leading the base. No arrest in connection of the incident have reported

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 19 June. Reports stated that a NISA soldier shot and killed a traffic police officer at the Jiradda Taleex (Talex Allay) vicinity, in Hodan District. The motive is not yet clear, however reports suggested that the two men had some arguments before the incident occurred. The perpetrator was arrested by his colleagues.
19 June. Report stated that the dead body of a young man with knife wounds was found in his home at the Livestock Market area, Heliwa District. The motive for his death is unknown.

18 June. Borama local government official and Police were stoned by Tuur-qaylo residents as they prepared a waste dump in their neighbourhood (Borama town). Police seriously wounded one person and arrested many others.
18 June, on or before. US warplanes (possibly helicopters) landed in Shangare, Awheegle area and Bariirre, abducted seven and killed two members of al Shabaab.
18 June, on or before. US warplanes (possibly helicopters) landed in Shangare, Awheegle area and Bariirre, abducted seven and killed two members of al Shabaab.

18 June. Armed men shot and killed a civilian man after a brief altercation over land dispute at the outskirt of Baidoa town. The perpetrators managed to escape from the area. The local police forces arrived at the scene, where they pursued the perpetrators and managed to apprehend them. Three persons and the perpetrators were arrested in connection to this incident.

17 June. Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against a SNA troop based in Bullo Mareer's entrance checkpoint neighbourhood. The clash was initiated with rocket propelled grenade (RPG) followed by heavy machine gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes, after which al Shabaab militants were forced to withdraw. Reportedly, one SNA soldier was injured in the fight.

17 June. Suspected Kenyan air force conducted an airstrike against al Shabaab positions in Ceel cade village approx. 60km SW of Garbaharrey district. According to the information, the warplane also targeted Cel cadud village, located near Ceel cade village. As a result, three civilians were reportedly injured. There are reports of casualties from al Shabaab fighters but the exact numbers could not be ascertained. 10 fatalities spread over two locations.

17 June. Suspected Kenyan air force conducted an airstrike against al Shabaab positions in Ceel cade village approx. 60km SW of Garbaharrey district. According to the information, the warplane also targeted Cel cadud village, located near Ceel cade village. As a result, three civilians were reportedly injured. There are reports of casualties from al Shabaab fighters but the exact numbers could not be ascertained. 10 fatalities spread over two locations.

17 June. Reports stated that a Government soldier armed with AK47 reportedly shot and killed three men from the same family at the Suuqa Kaaran vicinity in Kaaran District. Further reports suggested that, the primary motive for the clash relates to a land dispute between the two groups. The District soldiers arrived on the scene and conducted security search operation but no arrests were made. The perpetrator managed to escape.
16 June. Three al Shabaab fighters are killed while fighting with government forces in Miisra.

16 June. Reports stated that SNAF personnel and stabilization forces exchanged gunfire for few minutes in Wadajir's Zobbe junction road neighbourhood, Dharkenley. Reportedly, one soldier and one civilian bystander were injured during the exchange. It is unclear what caused the exchange of fire between the two groups.

16 June. SNAF carried out a raid on suspected Al-Shabaab positions at Shangare village near Aw Dheegle. According to reports the raid left 2 killed and 8 captured before the assault team withdrew on helicopters.
15 June. The Islamic State claims responsibility for an IED attack in Daynile district that killed four soldiers. A second IED attack in the district on the same day may be unrelated.
15 June. Green-on-green fighting reported in Hodan. One soldier killed, a bystander injured.

04 November. 101 cases of rape were recorded in Somaliland between January and November 2018 (coded as one event per month); 105 individuals were accused of rape out of which 87 were arrested and charged.

15 June. Reports stated that a RCIED explosion occurred at a checkpoint manned by the Banadir stabilization forces at the Ifka-Halane neighbourhood, in Dayniile District. One SNA soldier was killed by the explosion while two others were injured. Government forces conducted security search operation after the explosion and arrested two suspects who owned small business near the checkpoint for further investigation. No civilian casualties were reported. Perpetrators not known.

14 June. A two hour long violent demonstration against the Somaliland Army presence in Sool region was reported in Lasanod. Three women were reportedly wounded and unspecified number of protestors were arrested.

14 June, on or before. A 14-minute video showed that a civilian youth was tortured by stabilization soldiers at Ex. Control Afgoye neighbourhood, in Wadajir District, while he was lying on the ground. Gunshot were heard in the video. Residents reported that the soldiers suspected the man to be an al Shabaab militant and opened gunfire at him before he was tortured.
14 June. Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate a finance officer working for Hawl Wadaag's District Commissioner office. The assailants escaped the scene.

14 June. Reports stated that an SNA soldier armed with AK47 opened gun fire into a crowd of civilians at Jamhuuriya village in the Wadajir District. Four females including the wife of the accused were injured and taken to Madina Hospital for treatment. The gunfire occurred after the soldier came home and started fighting with his wife, residents gathered at the home to intervene when the soldier opened fire on them. The perpetrator managed to escape.

13 June. Three armed al Shabaab fighters using a rick-shaw, reportedly opened fire at an SNA Soldier at Al-Hudda Mosque in Halwadag neighbourhood, west of Beletweyne town. Information indicates that the soldier responded to the fire and injured two al Shabaab fighters. The soldier was slightly injured and taken to Lamagaley SNA clinic for further treatment, whereas the injured al Shabaab fighters succumbed to their injuries on the way to the hospital. The body of the al Shabaab fighter was dragged on the road and displayed before the local administration building. The other two perpetrators managed to escape from the scene.

13 June. Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit and run attack against SNA soldiers positioned near Manyafulka village (approx. 10kms SE of Baidoa, on the road to Mogadishu). Al Shabaab fired RPGs followed by a brief gunfire exchange from both sides. Al Shabaab fighters later retreated from the area.

13 June. Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit and run attack against Southwest State Police forces at Bakiin checkpoint, at the edge of Baidoa town on the road to Mogadishu. Al Shabaab fired RPGs and small arms after which Southwest State Police forces responded. Fighters retreated from the area after few minutes of gunfire.

13 June. SNA forces in a security operation clashed with al Shabaab fighters near Adeegow village (approx. 42kms NW of Baidoa). The armed confrontation lasted about twenty minutes, with al Shabaab fighters reportedly escaping from the area. After the incident, SNA soldiers returned to their base at Goofgaduud Buurey (approx. 30kms NW of Baidoa). One (01) SNA soldier was reportedly killed in the attack.

13 June. Heavy fighting reportedly occurred between stabilization troops and al Shabaab fighters at Abdiweyeel neighbourhood, in Heliwa District. The clash was initiated with two RPG rounds followed by heavy machine guns which lasted for about 25 minutes. Al Shabaab elements were repelled and they withdrew. Two civilians in a Coffee shop near the Stabilization checkpoint were killed while three others including one SNA soldier were injured. On the same day, suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack on SNA forces checkpoint base of Bar Jowhar vicinity in Heliwaa District. The clash was initiated with a hand grenade followed by light gunfire for about 10 minutes. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

13 June. Reports stated that a district staff member was assassinated by suspected al Shabaab militants as he walked home from work near Nasrudiin Mosque neighbourhood, Howlwadag District. The perpetrators reportedly stole the victim's pistol, smart phone and managed to escape. The District police attended the scene however no arrests were reported. The Islamic State later claimed responsibility.

13 June. Al- Shabaab elements reportedly shot and killed an old man at the Dabakayo-Madow vicinity in Dharkenley District. The victim was reported to be in his shop when he was attacked by two armed assailants. Government soldiers conducted security search operation however no arrests were reported. The perpetrators managed to escape.
13 June. Somaliland police open fire and kill two civilians in Las Anod. The killing led to violent protests the following day.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 13 June. Reports indicate that al Shabaab ambushed JLF/SNA convoy who were reportedly escorting the SNA high profile delegates from Mogadishu lead by the federal army commander for Somalia near Sanguni village approx. 40km North East of Kismayo town. After brief fire exchange al Shabaab fighters retreated from the area. SNA soldier was injured from the attack and taken to Kismayo for treatment.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 12 June. Reports state that RCIED targeting an AMISOM convoy heading to Mogadishu from Jowhar town detonated at the Ilbaq settlement between Qalimow village and Ceelka Geelow village under Balcad District (Middle Shabelle region) followed by gunfire. One of the APCs in the convoy was reportedly damage and one soldier was injured. Perpetrators likely al Shabaab.

12 June. Al Shabaab militants ambushed a public minibus carrying Mira-Kat from Mogadishu to Bulla-Mareer at the Golweyne village in the vicinity of Merka District. The report stated that the Minibus was hit by an RPG round. Four passengers on board of the minibus vehicle were killed while unspecified number of pedestrians were injured and taken to Golweyne Hospital for medical treatment.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces
notes: 12 June. Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit and run attack against the Southwest Special Forces base in Qansax-Dheere district (approx. 120kms SW of Baidoa). After a brief exchange of small arms fire, al Shabaab fighters retreated from the area. Two Southwest soldiers were killed and another was injured in the attack. The casualty from al Shabaab cannot be established.
12 June. Security forces carry out an attack against an al Shabaab position in Baardheere.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 12 June. Report stated that al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against AMISOM base in KM 50 village Settlement (approx. 22km, Southwest of Afgoye District). Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly before the attackers retreated.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 12 June. Al Shabaab fighters attack a NISA checkpoint located near Heliwas SOS Hospital. The attack occurred 25min after another al Shabaab attack targeted a SNAF checkpoint near Abdi Waceyl cinema. The resulting casualty figures are unknown.

12 June. Reports state that Somali Government - Banadir stabilization soldier armed with an AK47 shot and killed a rickshaw (Tuktuk Motorcycle) driver at the EVECO village, Industrial road, in Dayniile District over extortion of money. The District Police attended the scene, however no arrests were made. The perpetrators managed to escape.

12 June. Reports state that a SNA soldier shot and killed a Tuktuk driver at the Ex. Control Balcad vicinity in Heliwa District. The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene after the incident. The motive of this shooting is unknown. The family of the victim are reportedly seeking justice from Government.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Maritime Police Force
notes: 12 June. A PMPF soldier was shot and killed by an unknown assailant in the main market of Bossaso. The motive was not known.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 12 June. The Islamic State's Amaq News Agency (Islamic State) claims responsibility for the alleged assassination of a Puntland intelligence officer in Bossaso.

11 June. Al Shabaab attacks and overtakes a government military base in Ted village. Five (05) SNA soldiers were killed and five (05) others were injured in the attack. Casualties from al Shabaab sides are yet to be established. Al Shabaab fighters reportedly placed IEDs under the dead SNA soldiers before they withdrew from the village. The dead SNA soldiers remain at the incident location, and are expected to be removed today if cleared of IEDs.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
notes: 11 June. Armed clashes oppose groups of Galmudug soldiers supporting President Haaf and VP Arabey/Speaker Ali Yasir. Clashes occurred within the Presidency building in Cadaado. Casualties reported, numbers not known (coded as 10).

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 11 June. Reported clashes between Government troops and al Shabaab fighters occurred at the Siinka dheer neighbourhood in Dayniile District. Suspected al Shabaab militants attacked the military checkpoint manned by NISA soldiers near Siinka Dheer and both sides exchanged heavy gunfire including Mortar and RPG rounds for over 20 minutes. The attackers eventually retreated. Reports indicated that three civilian passengers travelling on a minibus were killed during the gunfire exchange, while three other injured were taken to local hospital. Casualties from both sides could not be ascertained.

11 June. Unidentified assailant hurls a homemade petrol bomb/small explosive device towards an AU Police convoy traveling from Mogadishu Stadium to Mogadishu International Airport. One vehicle slightly damaged.

11 June. Suspected al Shabaab members hurled a hand grenade to a teashop frequented by government soldiers (Southwest and SNA) near Anodka area of Hawlwadag neighbourhood in Baidoa. Three civilians near the area were reportedly injured by fragments of the explosion. The perpetrators managed to escape from the area, however the security forces reached the area and arrested several persons in connection of the incident.
11 June. IED targets soldiers conducting IED search on Buulo Burto airstrip. One soldier suffered light injuries.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
notes: 11 June. IED strikes a BNDF resupply convoy travelling between Gololey and Garsaal. One BNDF soldier was injured by the blast.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 11 June. Puntland and Somaliland exchange mortar fire near Tukaraq. No casualties reported.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 11 June. Al Shabaab fighters fire several mortar rounds towards the Jubaland outpost located near Sunguuni. No casualties reported.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of United States; Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 10 June. SNG, Jubaland and US forces launch an attack on al Shabaab-held Bar Sanguni village, 50 km [north] of Kismayo, inflicting 25 fatalities. The allied forces gained control of the village.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 10 June. Al Shabaab attacks a NISA base in Siinka Dher (Daynile). The stationed soldiers pushed back the attack. Two SNA soldiers were reportedly injured. Casualties from al Shabaab groups could not be ascertained.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 10 June. Crossfire incident at NISA checkpoint four between NISA Checkpoint and four personnel and SNA soldiers traveling in two vehicles. The armed clashes came after SNA soldiers travelling in two Toyota surf vehicles attempted to pass checkpoint four by force. An argument developed with NISA soldiers manning the checkpoint and gunfire exchanged between both sides for about 10 minutes. Four people including two NISA checkpoint soldiers, one SNA soldier and one civilian were reportedly injured and taken to Madina Hospital for medical treatment.

10 June. Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack on SNA troops based in Carbiska village vicinity, in Afgoye District. The clash was initiated with Rocket Propelled Grenade (RPG) followed by heavy machine guns for about 20 minutes, after which al Shabaab militants were forced to withdraw. Reportedly, no casualties were reported from SNA soldiers. Casualties from al Shabaab group could not be confirmed.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 10 June. Reports stated that two mortar rounds (fired from unknown directions) landed at the outside of Qoryoley town in Qoryoley District. Al Shabaab probable perpetrators. The residents confirmed that the mortar shells landed in an empty space and caused no damage/casualty. The intended targeted is believed to be AMISOM base near first Bridge at Qoryoley District.
10 June. IED targets SNAF convoy returning from Maxaas to Beledweyne. Detonation occurred close to Beledweyne. No casualties reported.

assoc_actor_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-); Military Forces of United States
notes: 09 June 2018: Al Shabaab attacked Somali National Army, AMISOM and United States Army near Sunguuni, Lower Juba region. No information on fatalities.
09 June. Islamic State assassinates a government soldier in Afgooye and later claims responsibility.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 09 June. Al Shabaab fighters launch a sustained attack against Sinka Dheer (Daynile) location. Two SNAF soldiers and one NISA officer injured during the clashes. Al Shabaab assailants repelled after 20 minutes.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: 09 June. Al Shabaab fighters attack SNAF checkpoint in Lafoole. In response, nearby Ugandan forces shelled al Shabaab locations. Assailants repelled, casualties unknown.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 09 June. Somaliland and Puntland forces reportedly exchanged artillery shells near God-Qabobe after a group of Puntland troops attempted to establish a base close to SLA positions. Both sides exchanged heavy and light artillery fire until Puntland troops pulled out from the area and retreated to their previous position.

09 June. A group of unidentified armed men reportedly disrupted CARE & ICRC NFI in IDP camp near Garaclagudhal village (90km E of Lasanod). Two female IDP and INGO staff member sustained gunshots injuries. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: 08 June. One American special operations soldier is killed and four are wounded when they came under mortar fire from al Shabaab near Jamaame. The Americans were on patrol with a group of AMISOM-Kenya forces at the time of attack.
08 June. Islamic State assassinates a government soldier in Bakaara Market. IS later claimed responsibility.
08 June. Al Shabaab assassinates a government solider in Afgooye.

08 June. A US air strike targets al Shabaab locations in Jamaame. In the same operation, US and Jubaland forces also raided villages around Jamaame, including Kamsuuma and Kaban. 20 al Shabaab suspects arrested. On 9 June, it was reported that the US and Jubaland forces left Janaame.
08 June. Al Shabaab fighters assassinate a businessman and his wife in Aw Dhiinle. Businessman identified as "Mukhtar". The victim was resupplying SNAF soldiers in Aw Dhiinle. Assailants escaped.

08 June. An al Shabaab RCIED targets SNAF vehicle returning from Afgooye towards Mogadishu ay Daynile. Device missed its intended target and struck a civilian auto-rickshaw. Two passengers injured by the blast. Assailants escaped.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 08 June. Puntland battle wagon reportedly attacked a military checkpoint manned by Somaliland troops near God-Qabobe. Puntland forces opened fire at the Somaliland forces and escaped as Somaliland forces responded.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 08 June. Al Shabaab fighters attack Jubaland/SNAF positions in Ceel Waaq. Heavy fighting reported. Resulting casualty figures and outcome of the attack unknown.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 08 June. Al Shabaab suicide bomber rams his VBIED against newly set-up Jubaland/US outpost near Sunguuni. Resulting casualty figures unknown. Only bomber death confirmed.

07 June. Al Shabaab fighters took control of an SNA base in Daynuunay village (c. 30 km south east of Baidoa) on the main road towards Mogadishu. SNA withdrew from the base before al Shabaab fighters arrived. Two IEDs, targeting SNA forces reinforcement that left Baidoa, exploded near Gasarta village (c. 12 km south east of Baidoa) and near Danbalka village (c. 07 km north west of Daynuunay). There were no reports of casualties. Al Shabaab fighter withdrew from the village and SNA forces later took control of the base. Three SNA soldiers were killed by an IED that exploded at the entrance gate of the SNA base.

07 June. Al Shabaab fighters took control of an SNA base in Daynuunay village (c. 30 km south east of Baidoa) on the main road towards Mogadishu. SNA withdrew from the base before al Shabaab fighters arrived. Two IEDs, targeting SNA forces reinforcement that left Baidoa, exploded near Gasarta village (c. 12 km south east of Baidoa) and near Danbalka village (c. 07 km north west of Daynuunay). There were no reports of casualties. Al Shabaab fighter withdrew from the village and SNA forces later took control of the base. Three SNA soldiers were killed by an IED that exploded at the entrance gate of the SNA base.

07 June. Al Shabaab fighters took control of an SNA base in Daynuunay village (c. 30 km south east of Baidoa) on the main road towards Mogadishu. SNA withdrew from the base before al Shabaab fighters arrived. Two IEDs, targeting SNA forces reinforcement that left Baidoa, exploded near Gasarta village (c. 12 km south east of Baidoa) and near Danbalka village (c. 07 km north west of Daynuunay). Al Shabaab fighter withdrew from the village and SNA forces later took control of the base. Three SNA soldiers were killed by an IED that exploded at the entrance gate of the SNA base. Additionally, 5 militants were reported killed and 10 reported injured.
07 June. Al Shabaab fighters attack SNAF base near Wajid. Fighting escalated until late evening on 07 June. Casualties reported, figures unknown
07 June. An al Shabaab RCIED targets a SNAF vehicle escorting the Chairman of Heliwa District, Ali Abdi Geedi Farayare. Chairman and three SNAF bodyguards killed.

06 June. Biimaal and Abgaal/Abdul Arooni sub clans clashed at Muuri village (c. 16 km south west of Afgoye). There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about one hour. At least three militias from both groups were killed. The motive behind the incident was reported to be clan feuds.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 06 June, on or about. Jubaland forces with American support forces clash with al Shabaab in Buulo Gaduud. Causalities reported, though exact numbers not yet known.

06 June. Al Shabaab shot and killed a clan elder in front of his home at Ali-Shire village vicinity in Howlwadag District. District police attended to the scene of the incident and conducted a security search operation but there were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators managed to escape. The victim was a former Somali lawmaker.

06 June. An armed government soldier using an AK47 shot and killed a drier of a rickshaw at Marwaas Mosque vicinity in Hamarweyne district over extortion money. District police attended to the scene of the incident but there were no reports of arrests. The perpetrator managed to escape.

06 June. Unidentified armed men, suspected to be al Shabaab militants, shot and killed a Bancroft soldier who was on leave at the centre of Balcad town neighbourhood in Balcad district. Government soldiers conducted a security search operation in the area but there were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators managed to escape.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: 06 June. ENDF forces based at Baardheere opened artillery fire against al Shabaab fighters that were observed at Jungal village area (c. 08 km west of Baardheere town). Additional reports suggested that al Shabaab fighters were planning to attack the ENDF base. There were no reports of casualties.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 06 June. Al Shabaab fighters attacked Jubaland forces based at Sanguuni village (c. 42 km north east of Kismayo town). There was heavy exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab retreated. There were no reports of casualties. Later, Jubaland and US forces sent reinforcements toward Sangunni when they clashed with al Shabaab for a second time. Resulting causality figures from the second clash not known.

05 June. Al Shabaab fighters took control of Ceel Waaq town. Al Shabaab fighters shot and killed (possibly executed following takeover) two men, believed to be clan militias who fought alongside local forces. Al Shabaab burnt down the residence of the district commissioner and summoned residents at the local mosque. The local forces left from the town to Ceel-Waaq in Kenya for safety. Three hours later, al Shabaab withdrew from the town. Al Shabaab fighters amassed again around the town three days later with the believed aim of overtaking the village for the second time in a week.
05 June. Al Shabaab ambushes a Hirshabelle-area government military escort in Elka-Gelow in between Bal'ad and Kalimow. 5-17 total casualties reported, including 2 MPs.
05 June. Al Shabaab carried out an attack on a government military base in Baardheere during the early morning hours. Nine al Shabaab reported dead, two captured.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 05 June. Al Shabaab forces attack AMISOM bases in Baraawe and Qoryooley on 05/06. Causality figures remain unknown.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 05 June. Al Shabaab forces attack AMISOM bases in Baraawe and Qoryooley on 05/06. Causality figures remain unknown.
05 June. Biyomaal and Abdalla Arooni militias clash near Muuri settlement. Three people were killed following a one hour long firefight. The motives behind the eruption of violence are unknown.

05 June. An electoral delegate involved in the election of members of the Somali parliament was killed in Mogadishu's Wadajir district. Perpetrators not known, though al Shabaab has conducted similar assassinations in the area.
04 June. Al Shabaab attacks Bulo Burde, capturing and later beheading two Somali soldiers.
04 June. Al-Shabab fighters attacked a police post between Kahda and Dharkenley districts at in Turka Ali Janale village in Mogadishu. The attackers overtook the post. Causalities not known.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 04 June. Jubaland forces engage al Shabaab in Kulbiyow. Jubaland forces claim six al Shabaab dead.

04 June. Banadir Stabilization Forces, while conducting a security search operation, clashed with other SNA soldiers at Waaxda Sadexaad (Branch Three) village neighbourhood in Dharkenley district. There was an exchange of gunfire. At least two people - a civilian female bystander and a soldier, were killed and three others were injured.

04 June. Armed government soldiers using AK47s shot and killed a driver of a rickshaw at Via Liberia road vicinity in Waberi district over extortion of money. District police attended to the scene of the incident but there were no reports of arrests made. The perpetrators managed to escape.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: 04 June. Al Shabaab fighters attack UPDF FOB in Qoryoley. Four mortar rounds land outside of the base. Assailants repelled, no casualties reported.
04 June. An al Shabaab IED detonates in Qoryooley. Five children injured.
03 June. Al Shabaab assassinated two Somali soldiers in Bakaara Market.
03 June. Green on green violence reported in Dharkenley. One soldier killed, three injured.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: 03 June. Al Shabaab fighters attack SNAF base located near a KDF base in Kolbiyow. Assailants repelled. One injured militant reportedly arrested.
03 June. Al Shabaab ambushed a group of civilians between Qurac Joome and Xudur while travelling to Belet Weyne. Six dead and 11 trucks destroyed.
03 June. Two suspected al Shabaab elements shot and killed an unknown youth at the Livestock market in Heliwa district. The perpetrators escaped.
03 June. Unidentified gunmen killed a Heliwa District Commission employee.
03 June. Al Shabaab fighters ambush civilian convoy in Xudur. Possibly 11 trucks burnt, 2 civilians killed.

03 June. A man who hailed from Warsangeli sub clan was shot and killed by armed assailants hailing from Ali Saleeban sub clan at Xamure area (c. 78 km south west of Qandala). The motive of the incident was not clear. The assailants managed to escape.
03 June. An al Shabaab IED targets Bancroft vehicle accompanying SNAF forces at KM50. One vehicle damaged.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 03 June. PSF launched a military operation against al Shabaab hideouts at Maraje valley (c. 41 km south west of Bossaso) where they clashed with al Shabaab. 12 al Shabaab fighters were killed. The two actors clashed in the area the previous day.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 02 June. Al Shabaab attacked and overran an AMISOM base in Shalaambood. Casualties not known. The attack is considered part of al Shabaab's "Ramadan campaign."

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 02 June. Al Shabaab forces launched an attack on an AMISOM base in Qoryooley during the nighttime hours. Causalities not known. The attack is considered part of al Shabaab's "Ramadan campaign."

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: 02 June. Al Shabaab attacked a AMISOM-Uganda base in Amabareson village outside the port town of Barawe. Casualties not known. The attack is considered part of al Shabaab's "Ramadan campaign."

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 02 June. Puntland forces attacked an al Shabaab position in Maraja, killing 40. The operation was in response to an al Shabaab attack on Ballo Khadar the previous day.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 02 June. SNA and NISA forces clashed at Jaale Siyaad college neighbourhood in Deyniile district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 10 minutes. Two civilian bystanders, consisting of a rickshaw driver and a female student, were killed while three others, including a soldier, were injured. Additional reports stated that the primary motive of the clash was related to suspicion of the two security forces.

02 June. Suspected al Shabaab militants attacked SNA soldiers while on security patrol near Baidoa Bus Station at Bakara market neighbourhood in Howlwadag district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 10 minutes. Two SNA soldiers and a civilian bystander were killed and two other civilians were injured. Casualties from suspected al Shabaab militants could not be ascertained. The perpetrators managed to escape.
02 June. Two gunmen exchange gunfire in southern Galkaacyo. One killed one injured. Motives behind the incident unknown. Gunmen hailed from Sacad and Jalah sub-clans of Habargidir.

02 June. Unknown armed attackers, suspected to be al Shabaab elements, shot and killed two male youths at Suuq-bacaad vicinity in Yaqshid district. The victims were reported to be in their vehicle when they were attacked. Government soldiers conducted security search operation but there were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators managed to escape.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 02 June. A driver of a public minibus was shot and killed by a NISA soldier at Jamuuriya village neighbourhood in Kaaran district. SNPF soldiers arrived at the scene and conducted a security search operation but there were no reports of arrests. The motive of the incident was not ascertained and the perpetrators managed to escape.
02 June. Unidentified pistol armed gunmen killed 2 civilian businessmen in the Bakaara market. Both assassins escaped from the location.
02 June. Ali Saleban gunmen assassinate a Warsangeli clansman in Xammure. Motives unknown. Assailants escaped.

02 June. Unidentified armed men shot and killed a female civilian while on her way home at Sigaale village neighbourhood in Hodan district. Unconfirmed reports indicated that the victim was a government staff member. Another two civilian men were killed by unidentified gunmen on the same day at Bakara Junction road vicinity also in Hodan district. The motive of the assassination was not clear. In both cases, the perpetrators escaped.
02 June. US air forces carry out a strike on an al Shabaab position outside of Bosasso. 27 reported dead, none of whom were civilians.

02 June. An RCIED, buried along the road and targeting a Bancroft convoy moving from Baledogle Airport to Mogadishu, exploded at Waraboole village. The lead vehicle in the convoy was damaged. Three soldiers were injured and taken to a nearby hospital for treatment. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
notes: 02 June. An al Shabaab IED detonates near Djiboutian convoy coming back from Buulo Burto airstrip. One vehicle hit, no casualties reported. A second IED detonated in the area, but caused no damage.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: 02 June. An al Shabaab IED targets UPDF convoy between KM50 and KM67. Convoy had departed FOB Lanta Buur and was headed to Marian Gubaay. Outcome and resulting casualty figures unknown.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 02 June. Al Shabaab militants launched an attack against Jubaland forces positioned at Kulbiyow village (c. 178 km south west of Kismayo town). There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 10 minutes after which al Shabaab were forced to retreat.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: 01 June. Al Shabaab attacks a government forces base in Moqokori, later claiming 60 SNG dead. Al Shabaab overtook the area. Al Shabaab updated their figure the following week, claiming 72 confirmed deaths. Ethiopian forces were also involved.

01 June. Two women groups hailing from Habar-Jeclo/Baho and Habar Yonis/Sacad Yonis sub clan clashed at Fadhigaab village. A military soldier who attempted to intervene was shot and injured by a man hailing from Habar Yonis sub clan. SNA later arrested the perpetrator.

01 June. Banadir region stabilization forces conducted security search operation in Hoosh village neighbourhood in Dharkenley district where they clashed with other security forces. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 10 minutes. Two SNA soldiers were killed after they refusing to lay down their weapons. Three people, including one civilian bystander, were injured. Tension was reported to be high in the area.
01 June. Skirmish erupts between two groups of SNAF forces near Ex-Control Afgooye. Two killed, seven injured. Motives unknown.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 01 June. NISA and SNAF forces clash at Jaale Siyaad neighbourhood. Motives related to mutual suspicion of being al Shabaab militants. Two civilian bystanders killed, three perpetrators injured.
01 June. Al Shabaab fighters attack a SNAF checkpoint near Afgooye. No casualties reported.
01 June. Unidentified gunmen assassinate a cleric as he exited a mosque in Baardheere.

01 June. A man hailing from Habar Yonis sub clan shot and killed his fellow clansman at Cerigabo Stadium while attempting to shoot a man hailing from Dhulbahante clan. The victim attempted to separate the two men who were quarrelling when the incident occurred. SLP in Cerigabo arrested the perpetrator.
01 June. Unidentified militants assassinate a civilian in Yaaqshiid. Motive not known.
01 June. A soldier shot and killed civilian driver in Karaan, motives not known.
01 June. Unidentified assassinate a government administrator in Hodan. Motive not known.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Maritime Police Force
notes: 01 June. Al Shabaab fighters attacked a PMPF base located at Balikhadar of Galgala (c. 35 km south west of Bossaso). Four PMPF soldiers were killed and more than 10 soldiers were wounded. Al Shabaab took control of the base for about two hours and destroyed six PMPF vehicles. PSF intervened and recaptured the base. Six al Shabaab fighters were killed and five others were wounded.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 01 June. Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit and run attack against Jubbaland forces positioned at Abdi-Birole village (c. 45 km west of Kismayo town). Al Shabaab fighters fired one RPG-7. There was an exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab fighters retreated from the area.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 01 June. Al Shabaab fighters conducted a probing attack against Jubbland force base at Bulo-gudud village (c. 30 km north of Kismayo town). Al Shabaab fired three mortar rounds. There was a brief exchange of small arms gunfire after which al Shabaab retreated.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 31 May. SNAF and NISA forces clash near KPP junction in Hodan District. Motives and resulting casualty figures unknown.
31 May. Al Shabaab fighters attack SNAF checkpoint in Afgooye. Assailants repelled, no casualties reported.
31 May. US forces launched an air stake against an al Shabaab position 48km southwest of Mogadishu at Gendershe. 11 - 12 deaths reported.

31 May. A prominent youth activist was assassinated by two al Shabaab militants while walking home from work near Abdalle and Awareere Mosque neighbourhood in Wardhigley. The perpetrators stole the pistol of the victim and managed to escape. District police attended to the scene but there were no reports of arrests. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: 31 May. Al Shabaab fighters conduct a hit-and-run attack against a KDF military base in Abdalla Birole. Three mortar rounds fired.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: 30 May. Al Shabaab attack a Uganda base in Baraawe. Assailants repelled.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: 30 May. Al Shabaab attack a Uganda military base in Buulo Mareer. Assailants repelled.
30 May. Unidentified gunmen assassinate a school teacher in Dharkenley. Assailants escaped, motives unknown.

30 May. Kenyan air forces conducted an airstrike against a suspected al Shabaab location at Shimbiray grazing area (c. 35 km south east of Dhobley town - approx coordinates used). Casualties from the attack could not be established at the reporting period.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: 30 May. UPDF forces shell suspected al Shabaab positions in Labayaq from Golweyn. Two technicals and one VBIED allegedly destroyed.
30 May. An al Shabaab RCIED detonates at SNAF Bar Ismail checkpoint, Afgooye.
29 May. Islamic State claims responsibility for an IED explosion in the 'Bar Oba' section of the city. Six Somali intelligence personnel died in the explosion.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 29 May. Al-Shabaab carried out a grenade attack on an NISA checkpoint. 2 injured.

29 May. A grenade was hurled at an SNA checkpoint located at the entrance of Wanlaweyne district. Soldiers reacted with gunfire towards suspected directions of the attack. One SNA soldier was killed and three others were injured. The assailants managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

29 May. A grenade was hurled at Banadir Region Stabilization Forces defensive base near Carwo Idko junction road neighbourhood in Howlwadag district. Soldiers reacted with gunfire at suspected directions of the attack. One SNA soldier was injured and the assailants managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 29 May. NISA soldiers condoned off a private residence that was suspected to be used by four suspected al Shabaab militants as a hideout in Waaberi. NISA apprehended two armed men in possession of pistols at Ansaloti village in Waberi district. The two suspected al Shabaab elements were taken into custody by NISA for further interrogation. NISA troops conducted a security search operation where one suspected al Shabaab militant was killed and another was injured.

29 May. An al Shabaab defector shot and killed an SWSPF soldier and defected back to al Shabaab at Miidow village (c. 22 km north west of Baidoa). The perpetrator took the rifle of another SWSPF soldier as well. The circumstances surrounding the incident was not clear. The perpetrator arrived in an al Shabaab controlled area in possession of the two rifles.
29 May. Al Shabaab fighters attack forward operation base Embresso, outside of Baraawe. Assailants repelled.

29 May. Unidentified armed men shot and killed a Koran school teacher at his home at Kawo-Godey vicinity in Dharkenley district. The perpetrators managed to escape. The motive of the incident was not clear.
29 May. Al Shabaab executes two Kenyans in Fino, Lower Shabelle after they were accused of spying.
29 May. Unidentified gunmen assassinate a civilian. Assailants escaped, motives unknown.

29 May. Two men, suspected to be al Shabaab fighters, assassinated a prominent clan elder at his house in Far Laysaan village (c. 30 km west of Garbaharrey town). The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene. The motive behind the assassination was not clear.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
notes: 29 May 2018: Pro-ISIL elements and Puntland state police clashed in Anjeel village near Qandala, Bari region. No reported fatalities.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
notes: 29 May. Pro-ISIS and police clashed at Canjeel village (c. 70 km south west of Qandala). There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about two hours after which pro-ISIS retreated to the mountain north of Canjeel. Causalities not known.

28 May. A UVIED, attached to a private vehicle owned by a civilian man, detonated near Siinaay junction road vicinity in Boondhere district. The targeted person survived the attack because he was not in vehicle at the time of the explosion. One civilian bystander was killed. Government soldiers arrived at the scene of the incident and conducted a search operation. There were no reports of arrests. The motive behind the attack was not established.
28 May. An RCIED, suspected to be planted by alleged pro-ISIS, exploded killing cattle (c. 05 km west of Qandala). There were no reports of immediate arrests.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 28 May. An RCIED, targeting an AMISOM convoy transporting supplies from Golweyne to Shalambood, exploded at Bullo Mareer town neighbourhood in Merka district. One supply lorry was damaged. There was an exchange of gunfire between AMISOM and al Shabaab which lasted for about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. Casualties could not be ascertained at the time of reporting.

28 May. Unidentified armed men shot and killed a traffic police officer at Manapolyo junction road neighbourhood in Shibis district. The police officer was directing traffic when the two armed men shot him. The perpetrators managed to escape. The district police attended to the scene of the incident but there were no reports of arrests.

28 May. Al Shabaab fighters ambushed SNA soldiers who were driving a Noah vehicle on the main road between Baidoa and Buurhabaka district near Ugaari village (c. 10 km north west of Buurhakaba district). There was a brief exchange of small arms fire after which SNA soldiers escaped from the scene and returned to Buurhakaba. An SNA soldier was killed in the attack. Casualties from al Shabaab could not be established at the time of reporting.

28 May. Al Shabaab militants launched an attack against the SNA base located c. 03 km south of Garbaharrey town. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab were forced to retreat. There were no reports of casualties from SNA. It was suspected that there could have been casualties from al Shabaab though they were taken when they retreated.

28 May. There was a violent demonstration conducted in Lasanod in protest of the Somaliland administration. One person was killed and more than 50 others including three journalists were arrested. SLP dispersed the protestors. Movement of vehicles was restricted and most of the businesses in Lasanod were closed.

28 May. Al Shabaab attackers shot and killed a staff member, working at the parliament, and injured another at Kuwait Palace Hotel vicinity in Waberi district. The man reportedly worked in parliament as head of finance section. The victim was in his vehicle when two assailants approached him and shot him. The perpetrators managed to escape. District police attended to the scene of the incident but there were no reports of arrests. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
27 May. Rival clans (not identified) clash east of Mataban over unspecified motives. Media reports suggest high tensions between Galgaduud, Hiiraaan and Middle Shabelle.

27 May. Pastoralists and al Shabaab fighters clashed at Elbaraf village vicinity in Mahaday district. The clashes occurred after al Shabaab militants imposed taxation to residences. Casualties from the clash could not be confirmed at the time of reporting.

27 May. SNA and al Shabaab fighters clashed at Buufow Bacaad (c. 07 km north west of Merka district). There was an exchange of heavy gunfire which lasted for about 30 minutes after which al Shabaab managed to take control of the town. SNA soldiers vacated the town. After one hour, SNA troops with re-enforcement recaptured the town from al Shabaab militants without resistance. At least two SNA soldiers were killed and three others, including two civilian bystanders, were wounded.
27 May. Al Shabaab fighters attack SNAF checkpoint at Ex-Control Balcad landmark in Heliwa. Two civilian bystanders injured, assailants repelled.

27 May. A UVIED attached to a private vehicle owned by a civilian man detonated near 21 October School in Waberi district. The target survived the attack because he was not in the vehicle at the time of explosion. A child was injured. Government soldiers arrived at the scene and conducted a search operation but there were no reports of arrests. There was no motive established for the incident.

27 May. Suspected al Shabaab attackers shot and killed a famous clan elder at Dabaqeynka village vicinity in Dharkenley district. The man was one of the electoral delegates who participated in elections in Southwest state in 2017.

27 May. Police forces raided the residence of the al Shabaab deputy commissioner for Miisra village (c. 30 km north east of Diinsoor district). The targeted al Shabaab member was not at the house during the attack. His son was killed and the daughter was injured in the raid. The security forces reportedly returned to their base in Dinsoor.

27 May. An SNA soldier shot and killed an owner of a restaurant over a payment dispute in Diinsoor district (c. 90 km south west of Baidoa). The victim demanded for payment from the soldier which caused a brief altercation. Security forces arrived at the location of the incident and managed to arrest the perpetrator.

26 May. Two groups of government soldiers clashed at Godka Jilacow and Dabka junction road neighbourhoods in Boondhere and Howlwadag Districts. There was heavy exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 10 minutes. One SNA soldier was injured. Further reports suggested that the primary motive of the clash was related to both groups suspecting each other. An SNA soldier intervened and successfully mediated a cease fire.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: 26 May. Al Shabaab fighters ambush a SNAF patrol near Cusman Qule. Assailants retreat after a 20 minute firefight, and the intervention of UPDF forces, who shell the area.

26 May. An INGO staff member sustained minor injuries after an armed group shot at their rented vehicle at Labad village (c. 30 Km north of Hobyo district). The motive of the incident was related to registration of beneficiaries. The perpetrators escaped from the area.

26 May. Unidentified armed men using pistols shot and killed a young male at the Medicine section of Bakara Market in Heliwa district. Government soldiers conducted a security search operation but there were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators managed to escape after the incident.
26 May. Unidentified gunmen assassinate businessman Mohamed Ali Hariir in Dharkenley. Assailants escaped.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 26 May. Puntland and Somaliland forces clash in Tuko Raq.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 26 May. Jubbaland soldiers, while on security patrol, clashed with fellow soldiers over suspicions of al Shabaab presence at via-Afmadow neighbourhood in Kismayo town. Four soldiers were injured.

25 May. Suspected al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against SNA troops based at Biyo Degeenka neighbourhood in Heliwa district. The clash was initiated using an RPG followed by heavy exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab militants were forced to withdraw. Casualties could not be confirmed at the time of reporting. Al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility for the attack.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: 24 May. Al Shabaab fighters ambush a KDF patrol near Afmadow. Assailants repelled, no casualties reported.

24 May. Al Shabaab shot and killed a municipal tax collector at El- Dhere market in Dharkenley District. The assailant managed to escape. Police officers responded and conducted search operations but there were no reports of arrest.
24 May. Anti-al Shabaab forces (likely US or Kenyan) conducted an airstrike in Afgoye district killing 10 al Shabaab militants.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 24 May. Somaliland and Puntland security forces clashed at Tukaraq and surrounding areas. There were reports of casualties, numbers not known.

23 May. An SNA soldier shot and killed a fellow soldier near Xawaal Arundi village (c. 16 km north west of Buurhakaba district). The victim was driving one of the vehicles in a convoy transporting military rations to Buurhakaba district. The perpetrator was part of reconnaissance mission patrolling the road between Buurhakaba and Daynuuney village. The motive behind the incident was not clear. The victim was brought to Baidoa.

23 May. Habar Jeclo and Habar Yunis sub-clans clashed at Yufle located north east of El-Afwein (c. 30 km west of Erigavo). Three casualties were reported. Inter-clan conflict between the two rivalling sub-clans increased in the region. The Somaliland government mobilized a team of elders and prominent politicians to mediate the clan conflict in Elafweyn.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 23 May. NISA agents and bodyguards of a Member of Parliament clashed at Fiat NISA checkpoint near KM 0. NISA agents shot at his vehicle after he passed through Fiat security checkpoint without stopping and his guards responded with gunfire. The Member of Parliament escaped unhurt. There were no reports of casualties.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 23 May. Two suspected armed al Shabaab elements were shot and killed by NISA soldiers at Bakara market area. The NISA soldiers confiscated two pistols from the deceased and the bodies were taken for further investigation. Al Shabaab denied that the militias were their fellow fighters, however this was not confirmed.

23 May. Suspected al Shabaab militants shot and killed an SNA soldier at Hawo-Tako village vicinity in Wadajir district. Government soldiers conducted a security search operation after the incident but there were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators stole a firearm belonging to the soldier and escaped.
23 May. Al Shabaab attacks military camps at Bulo Mareer and K50. The casualties resulting from the two attacks are not yet known.
23 May. Al Shabaab attacks military camps at Bulo Mareer and K50. The casualties resulting from the two attacks are not yet known.
23 May. Unidentified armed men shot and killed an unidentified male at Elasha Biyaha settlement in Afgoye district. Pro-ISIS group claimed responsibility of the assassination.
23 May. Unidentified gunmen assassinate a civilian. Assailants escaped, motives unknown.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 23 May. AMISOM fired artillery rounds towards residential areas in Elasha settlement village (c. 20 km west of Mogadishu) in Afgoye district after their defensive base was hit by a mortar round. Residents at the village confirmed that the artillery rounds impacted the village from the AMISOM base near Hormuud building in Elasha settlement. There was no response fire from al Shabaab militants or reports of casualties.
23 May. Al Shabaab fighters fired at least five mortar rounds towards FOB Arbacow. No casualties reported, assailants repelled.
23 May. US AFRICOM announces drone strike targeted group of al Shabaab fighters 20km north-west of Mogadishu. 10 militants killed.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: 23 May. Unknown warplanes (likely either US or Kenya) conducted an airstrike against suspected al Shabaab location at Shimbirole -Gudududow grazing areas (c. 45 km south east of Dhobley town). Casualties from the attack could not be established at the time of reporting.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 23 May. Puntland forces fire several mortar rounds towards Somaliland base near Qod Gaboobe. Rounds land outside of the base. No casualties reported.

23 May. A member of the Puntland parliament and his guard were shot and killed by unidentified armed men in front of Classic Hotel in Galkayo. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the assassination. The perpetrators escaped from the scene. Police arrived at the scene but there was no report of arrests.
22 May. Al Shabaab fighters attack FOB Arbacow. RPGs and possibly mortars used during the attack. Assailants repelled, casualties unknown.
22 May. Unidentified armed perpetrators assassinate a police officer in Bakaara Market.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces
notes: 22 May. A Toyota Noah VBIED, targeting an SNA Danab (special forces) unit convoy from Bali-dogle Airport headed to Mogadishu, exploded at ITOP Factory in Afgoye. At least nine people consisting of two government soldiers and seven civilian bystanders were injured. The suicide bomber who drove the VBIED was killed. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack.

22 May. Suspected pro-ISIS elements, shot and killed a traffic police officer at Bakara junction road neighbourhood in Hodan district. A civilian bystander was injured. The perpetrators managed to escape. District police attended to the scene but there were no reports of arrests. Pro-ISIS claimed responsibility of the attack. Pro-ISIS published photos of the incident to prove their claim.
22 May. Somaliland police shot and killed an Ethiopian migrant who attempted to escape from Wajale Immigration.

22 May. An Egyptian national working with fisheries for the past three months was abducted by unknown armed perpetrators in the proximity of Botaan hotel in Bossaso. The motive was unknown. Police were reported to be investigating.
22 May. An al Shabaab roadside blast kills two civilians between Ex-Control Afgoye and Hanta Dher neighbourhoods in Daynile.
22 May. Al Shabaab car bomb detonates in Afgooye killing 12 Somali soldiers.

21 May. Clan militias of unknown origin clashed at Waradheere rural grazing area (c. 25 km south of Matabaan district). There was a brief exchange of small arms fire which lasted for about half an hour. Three armed militias were killed and two others were seriously injured. The motive of the incident was related to disputes over gazing land. The security situation was reported to be tense. Both clans were reported to be mobilizing for a possible armed confrontation. Traditional leaders and politicians from both clans attempted to deescalate hostilities between the two clans.

21 May. An RCIED, buried alongside the road targeting a vehicle belonging to SNA headed to Haanta Dheer, exploded at Ex. Control Afgoye. After the explosion, there was an exchange of gunfire between SNA and the unidentified perpetrators. The vehicle belonging to SNA was damaged. Three civilian bystanders were killed and two soldiers were injured. The perpetrators managed to escape.

21 May. Al Shabaab shot and killed an SNA soldier at the District branch one vicinity in Dharkenley district. SNPF soldiers arrived at the scene and conducted a security search operation. There were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators managed to escape the scene.

21 May. Unidentified armed men shot and killed a custodial corps soldier travelling to his home at Branch four village neighbourhood in Dharkenley district. Government soldiers arrived at the scene and conducted a security search operation. There were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators managed to escape.

21 May. Al Shabaab shot and killed a public land broker at the Dabaqeynka village vicinity in Dharkenley district. The victim was from the mosque when two armed men attacked him. The perpetrators managed to escape. District police attended to the scene but there were no reports of arrests.
21 May. Unidentified gunmen assassinated an older man during evening prayers in Dharkenley.
21 May. Al Shabaab fighters fire three mortar rounds towards FOB Arbacow. Rounds land inside the base. No casualties reported.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 21 May. Jubaland soldier kills his commander near Via Afmadow, following refusal of following orders. Soldier had previously left his unit in Gaduud without authorisation.
20 May. Military forces clash with al Shabaab and overtake Mubah, El Ali Ahmed, Yasoman villages in Hiiran. Al Shabaab suffered 'heavy causalities.'
20 May. Military forces clash with al Shabaab and overtake Mubah, El Ali Ahmed, Yasoman villages in Hiiran. Al Shabaab suffered 'heavy causalities.'
20 May. Al Shabaab fighters attack SNAF base near Ceelasha Biyaha. Small arms fire supported by mortar rounds. Resulting casualty figures unknown.
20 May. Al Shabaab gunmen killed a staff member of Prime Minister Hassan Ali Kheyre's office in Taleh neighbourhood, Hodan.
20 May. SNPF officer kills a civilian in Jowhar. Motives unknown. Assailant later placed in custody.

assoc_actor_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 20 May. Beheaded body of Somali/Kenyan allegedly working for AMISOM discovered in Daynile. Victim identified as "Hassan". Al Shabaab believed responsible.
19 May. Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate SNAF officer Mohamed Adow in Wabeeri. Assailants escaped.
19 May. Unidentified gunmen assassinate University Graduate and current construction engineer Mohamed Addow. Assailants escaped, motives and exact incident location unknown.
19 May. Al Shabaab assassinates Colonel Ali Raaghe by planting a UVIED under his vehicle. Group claims responsibility.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 19 May. Puntland and Somaliland forces exchange "artillery fire" near Qod Gaboode, near Las Anod. No casualties reported.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 18 May. Al Shabaab assailant hurls a hand grenade towards a NISA checkpoint near Salama Hotel. One NISA soldier injured. Assailant escaped.

18 May. Al Shabaab assassinated two soldiers at two different locations in the nighttime hours. The first attack occurred in Shibis Districts, while the second occurred at an unknown location near Bar-Ubah junction.

18 May. Al Shabaab assassinated two soldiers at two different locations in the night-time hours. The first attack occurred in Shibis Districts, while the second occurred at a location near Bar-Ubah junction.
18 May. Two groups of SNAF soldiers clash over unspecified motives in Balcad. Two SNAF and three civilians injured.
18 May. Al Shabaab gunmen conduct a drive-by shooting against SNAF checkpoint at Bar Ubaax Junction. One SNAF killed, three injured, including a civilian bystander. Assailants escaped.
18 May. An al Shabaab explosive detonates in Yaaqshiid, killing four police and wounding two others.
18 May. An al Shabaab explosive detonates in Daynile killing two soldiers.
17 May. A man throws a hard grenade into a Baidoa restaurant after he was denied a Ramadan meal card. Four injures.

17 May. Suspected al Shabaab assailant hurls a hand grenade towards Southwest forces in Onkod, possibly Southwest Special Police Force. One Southwest soldier and three civilians injured. Assailant escaped.
17 May. Al Shabaab assailant hurls a hand grenade towards SNAF checkpoint in Yaashiid. One SNAF injured. Assailant escaped.
17 May. Al Shabaab raided a house in Hodan district, killing a Somali intelligence official and two other soldiers.
17 May. Al Shabaab fighters conduct a drive-by shooting against Damanyo Army camp, opposite UAE training camp. One SNAF soldier injured. Assailants escaped.
17 May. Al Shabaab explosions took place in Heliwa and Hawl Wadaag Districts killing 10 soldiers total.
17 May. Al Shabaab explosions took place in Heliwa and Hawl Wadaag Districts killing 10 soldiers total.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Maritime Police Force
notes: 17 May. A vehicle belonging to PMPF was carjacked by six armed perpetrators in Bossaso. The vehicle was driving towards Qardho. There was an exchange of gunfire between police and the perpetrators at Alhamdulilah CP. Two perpetrators and two police officers were wounded. Police arrested the perpetrators and seized the vehicle. The vehicle was taken to Qardho Police Station for further investigation.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
notes: 17 May. Unidentified assailants hijack a Puntland police vehicle. Firefight ensued. Two assailants and two Puntland Police injured. Puntland forces arrested all perpetrators.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 16 May. At least 11 IEDs concealed in a paper bag exploded at multiple locations in Hodan, Howlwadag, Wardhigley and Waberi Districts. Sporadic retaliatory gunfire was reported in the districts. There were no reports of casualties. Perpetrators not named by the source.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 16 May. At least 11 IEDs concealed in a paper bag exploded at multiple locations in Hodan, Howlwadag, Wardhigley and Waberi Districts. Sporadic retaliatory gunfire was reported in the districts. There were no reports of casualties. Perpetrators not named by the source.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 16 May. At least 11 IEDs concealed in a paper bag exploded at multiple locations in Hodan, Howlwadag, Wardhigley and Waberi Districts. Sporadic retaliatory gunfire was reported in the districts. There were no reports of casualties. Perpetrators not named by the source.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 16 May. At least 11 IEDs concealed in a paper bag exploded at multiple locations in Hodan, Howlwadag, Wardhigley and Waberi Districts. Sporadic retaliatory gunfire was reported in the districts. There were no reports of casualties. Perpetrators not named by the source.

16 May. Suspected al Shabaab elements hurled two hand grenades at the residence of Banadir Region Stabilisation Forces Commander located at Howlwadag district commissioner office near Dabka junction road in Howlwadag district. Government forces at the location reacted with retaliatory gunfire toward the general direction of the attack. At least four people were injured. The perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack.

16 May. A hand grenade was hurled at Marwaz Mosque near Afar-Irdood Police Station checkpoint neighbourhood in Hamarweyne district. Soldiers reacted with gunfire towards the general direction of the attack. There were no reports of casualties and the assailants managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack.
16 May. Al Shabaab assassinated a government employee in Yaqshiid.

16 May. Unknown warplane (either US or Kenyan) conducted an airstrike against a suspected al Shabaab location at Abdulle-alim grazing area (c. 20 km south east of Dhobley town). Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 16 May. Fighting continued between Somaliland and Puntland forces in Tuko Raq.

15 May. Armed clan militias (not identified), supported by SNA, clashed in an area at Xalfooley and Tardo (c. 80 km east of Jalalaqsi). There was an exchange of gunfire. Initial reports indicated that two militiamen were injured at the armed conflict incident located at Xalfooley.

15 May. Armed clan militias (not identified), supported by SNA, clashed in an area at Xalfooley and Tardo (c. 80 km east of Jalalaqsi). There was an exchange of gunfire. Initial reports indicated that two militiamen were injured at the armed conflict incident located at Xalfooley.

15 May. There were violent demonstrations reported in Burao where demonstrators protested to the Somaliland government bias towards one of the clans fighting in Elafweyn. The demonstrators burnt tires in Burao and damaged an unspecified number of shops. Somaliland security forces arrived at the scene and dispersed the protesters. A police officers and a civilian sustained serious injuries. There were reports of arrests. The protests lasted over two days, 14-15 May.

15 May. Southwest state forces raided the residence of a mid-level al Shabaab member in Misir village (c. 10 km south east of Tiyeeglow town). There was an exchange of gunfire between the man and the armed forces. The son of the mid-level al Shabaab member was killed and another was injured.
15 May. SNPF conduct security sweep in Kaxda (Dharkenly). Gunmen, likely al Shabaab fighters, engage the SNPF detail. No casualties reported, SNPF forced to abandon the operation.

04 November. 101 cases of rape were recorded in Somaliland between January and November 2018 (coded as one event per month); 105 individuals were accused of rape out of which 87 were arrested and charged.

15 May. A former al Shabaab defector who later joined the security forces in BeletHawa district shot and killed a security officer. At the time of the incident, the deceased was believed to be on his way to visit his family at Kaboleey neighbourhood. The perpetrator escaped with the AK47 belonging to the deceased man fled to nearby villages in Belethawa district. Police were reported to be investigating the incident.
15 May. Somali soldier kills civilian driver of a tanker on Zobe Junction, Hodan.
15 May. Al Shabaab fighters fire one, possibly more, mortar rounds towards FOB Baraawe. One round landed inside the perimeter of the base. No casualties reported.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
source: Local Source; Puntland Post; Radio Risala
notes: 15 May. Early morning hours, reports were received on fighting that broke out at Tuk-Raq (Sool-Sanag disputed region between Somaliland/Puntland) between Somaliland Army (SLA) and Puntland Army (PLA), using all types weapons, including heavy artillery and tanks, and infantry units supported by technicals. Reportedly, the PLA initiated the attack in order to take the advantage, as SLA was celebrating the Independence Day. Heavy casualties from both sides were reported and the fighting continued during the day. The Puntland Post reports 48 dead, mainly Somaliland soldiers. Small clashes were also reported the previous day. Puntland forces claim capture of the area.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
notes: 15 May. Hundreds of locals conducted a violent demonstration in protest to the demolishment of illegal structures in Golcise area of Bossaso by municipal authorities. The protestors blocked a road and burnt tyres. Police dispersed the crowd. There were no reports of immediate casualties.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
notes: 15 May. Four people were shot and wounded by an alleged policeman at an IDP camp located east of Bossaso. The motive was not clear and the perpetrator escaped. Police were reported to be investigating.
14 May. A soldier who hailed from Marehan clan was shot and killed by another soldier hailing from Sa'ad clan in Galinsoor. The perpetrator escaped from the area.

14 May. There were violent demonstrations reported in Burao where demonstrators protested to the Somaliland government bias towards one of the clans fighting in Elafweyn. The demonstrators burnt tires in Burao and damaged an unspecified number of shops. Somaliland security forces arrived at the scene and dispersed the protesters. A police officers and a civilian sustained serious injuries. There were reports of arrests. The protests lasted over two days, 14-15 May.

14 May. There was a violent demonstration reported in Cerigabo against the Somaliland government. The demonstrators looted shops belonging to Habajeclo Isaq sub-clan members. One person was killed and two others were injured by police. The demonstration was triggered by an attempt to arrest a commander of the Somaliland military who defected SLA in support of his clan (Habar-yonis sub-clan). Additional reports revealed that the defected commander and his militia took a military truck carrying salaries for military personnel into Sanag region.
14 May. Armed clashes opposing SNAF and al Shabaab leave at least 30 people killed at an area between Moqukori and Bulo Burto. Clashes started on 12 May 2018 and lasted until 14 May.

14 May. ISIS elements shot and killed a young male at Abdalla Shideye vicinity of Bakaro Market in Howlwadag district. The perpetrators made a recorded of the dead body after which they escaped from the scene. The district police attended to the scene but there were no reports of arrests. Pro-ISIS group claimed responsibility for the attack.

14 May. A rickshaw driver was shot and killed by unknown armed men at Zobe junction road in Hodan district. SNPF soldiers arrived at the scene and conducted a security search operation but there were no reports of arrests. The motive of the incident was not clear and the perpetrators managed to escape.
14 May. A man was shot and killed at Bulsho Junction in Waaberi Village, near Garrowe. The culprit was arrested by police. Investigations were reported to be ongoing.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
