notes: 14 May. Puntland and Somaliland surveillance units briefly clashed at a place near Tuk-raq. There were no reports of casualties but tension was reported to be high.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti); AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia); Hawadle Clan Militia (Somalia)
notes: 13 May. Al Shabaab, on a bandit clearing operation, clash with government soldiers and Hawadle militia manning a checkpoint between Halfoley (near Dinlaabe) and Jalalaqsi villages. Fighting took place in both Hiiraan and Middle Shabelle and lasted over two days.The government troops were being supported by Djibouti commanders. Ethiopian forces were later dispatched and provided reinforcements. 12 dead over two days. VOA claims 13 dead.

13 May. At least three hand grenades were hurled at an SNA base located in Badbaado IDP camp in Dharkenley district. Security forces responded to the location and conducted a security search operation but there were no reports of arrests. Four people, including two SNA soldiers, were injured. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
13 May. Armed clashes opposing SNAF and al Shabaab leave at least 30 people killed at an area between Moqukori and Bulo Burto. Clashes started on 12 May 2018 and lasted until 14 May.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti); AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia); Hawadle Clan Militia (Somalia)
notes: 13 May. Al Shabaab, on a bandit clearing operation, clash with government soldiers and Hawadle militia manning a checkpoint between Halfoley (near Dinlaabe) and Jalalaqsi villages. Fighting took place in both Hiiraan and Middle Shabelle and lasted over two days.The government troops were being supported by Djibouti commanders. Ethiopian forces were later dispatched and provided reinforcements. 12 dead over two days. VOA claims 13 dead.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 13 May. An RCIED, buried alongside the road linking Jowhar and Balcad and targeting an AMISOM/SNA convoy, exploded at Gololey village neighbourhood (c. 16 km north east of Balcad district). There was heavy exchange of gunfire thereafter. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack. Causalities not known.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 13 May. A hand grenade was hurled at NISA checkpoint near Aimiska neighbourhood in Yaqshid district. Thereafter, there was an exchange of gunfire between NISA and the perpetrators after which the perpetrators managed to escape. There were no reports of casualties. Perpetrators not known.

13 May. Armed SNA uniformed men using AK47s shot and killed a civilian driver of a minivan at Sharey Village vicinity in Wanlaweyne district. The incident occurred after SNA demanded for extortion money which the driver refused. The perpetrators managed to escape after the incident.

13 May. Suspected al Shabaab fighters ambushed a civilian Nissan pick-up from Dhobley at Hawuna area (c. 25 km east of Dhobley town). The driver of the vehicle was killed and the passenger was injured. The injured victim was brought to Dhobley Hospital for treatment. The suspected al Shabaab fighters took the vehicle and drove to an unknown location.
13 May. Al Shabaab media reports that a US airstrike (likely targeting al Shabaab) struck civilians in Afgooye district, causing an unknown number of fatalities and injuries.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti); AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia); Hawadle Clan Militia (Somalia)
notes: 12 May. Al Shabaab, on a bandit clearing operation, clash with government soldiers and Hawadle militia manning a checkpoint between Halfoley (near Dinlaabe) and Jalalaqsi villages. Fighting took place in both Hiiraan and Middle Shabelle and lasted over two days. The government troops were being supported by Djibouti commanders. Ethiopian forces were later dispatched and provided reinforcements. 12 dead over two days. VOA claims 13 dead.
12 May. Armed clashes opposing SNAF and al Shabaab leave at least 30 people killed at an area between Moqukori and Bulo Burto. Clashes started on 12 May 2018 and lasted until 14 May.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti); AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia); Hawadle Clan Militia (Somalia)
notes: 12 May. Al Shabaab, on a bandit clearing operation, clash with government soldiers and Hawadle militia manning a checkpoint between Halfoley (near Dinlaabe) and Jalalaqsi villages. Fighting took place in both Hiiraan and Middle Shabelle and lasted over two days. The government troops were being supported by Djibouti commanders. Ethiopian forces were later dispatched and provided reinforcements. 12 dead over two days. VOA claims 13 dead.
12 May. A civilian man was beheaded by al Shabaab fighters near Xalfooley village (c. 39 km north east of Jalalaqsi district) and seized his livestock.
12 May. Al Shabaab assassinates a civilian in Dharkenley.
12 May. An al Shabaab blast targets a market in Bulo Mareer, four civilians dead, five injured.

11 May. Al Shabaab attack and overtake Qoryooley District from government forces. Government military forces suffered an unknown number of causalities. Al Shabaab control of the area was "brief." It is not known if government forces regained control. Military forces later denied al Shabaab was in control of the area.

11 May. Two groups of armed youngsters using machetes and sticks clashed at Qasabka neighbourhood in Burao. Three youths were seriously injured from both sides and were taken to Burao Hospital. There were no reports of arrests. The reason for the clash is not known.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces
notes: 11 May. Al-Shabaab forces in the Sei Piano neighbourhood (Hodan) of Mogadishu killed a commander, who was a member of the US-trained Alpha Group. The commander and three other soldiers who were his bodyguards were shot dead - total numbers not known.
11 May. Al Shabaab launched 13 mortar shells against a Turkish military base in Mogadishu. An unknown number of causalities reported.
11 May. SNAF received a tip over three IEDs being emplaced near FOB Albacow Junction to Afgooye-Mogadishu road. Two IEDs detonate when SNAF patrol reach the area. No casualties.
10 May. Al Shabaab capture Kahda in Mogadishu following an assault. Causalities not known.

source: AFP; Daily Nation (Kenya); Garowe Online; Radio Risala
notes: 10 May. Between 3-5 al Shabaab officials are killed in a US/Somali airstrike and raid in Bariire. The special forces are believe to have killed five civilian farmers in the process, though the government denies this.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 10 May. Al Shabaab elements attacked AMISOM and SNA troops positioned at Xero Labaad and police station neighbourhoods in Qoryole district. The joint forces managed to repel the attackers. Three al Shabaab attackers were killed and three civilian passers-by were injured in the clashes. Casualties from the Government and AMISOM were not reported.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 10 May. Al Shabaab hurled a hand grenade at NISA soldiers (Alpha Group unit) who were chewing khat in a house near Saybiano neighbourhood in Hodan district. There was an exchange of gunfire thereafter. At least four NISA soldiers, including a senior officer, were killed and two others were injured. The assailants managed to escape after the incident. NISA soldiers arrived at the scene and conducted a search operation but there were no reports of arrests. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack.

10 May. Two armed men, suspected to be al Shabaab elements, shot and killed an SNA soldier who was sitting in a cafeteria near Ex. control Afgoye in Dayniile district. The perpetrators stole the AK47 riffle of the victim and managed to escape. The district police arrived at the scene of the incident but there were no reports of arrests.
10 May. An al Shabaab IED targets a government vehicle travelling between Afgoye and Wanlaweyn districts. "Deaths and injuries" reported.

10 May. The regional chair of the ruling political party, Kulmiye, for Sool region was killed by unknown armed men in Lasanod. The motive of the perpetrator was not clear. The regional authorities authorized an extensive security operation in Lasanod and its vicinity.

10 May. Al Shabaab shot and killed a businessman at Bakara Market neighbourhood in Howlwadag district. SNPF arrived at the scene of the incident and conducted a security search operation. There were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 10 May. Al Shabaab fighters detonated an IED against Jubaland forces near Qam-Qam village area. The soldiers were on foot patrol when the incident occurred. One soldier was killed and three others were injured.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 10 May. Jubaland convoy struck by an al Shahaab roadside IED near Luuglaaw. Casualties reported, exact figures unknown (coded as 10)
09 May. A suspected al Shabaab suicide bomber kills between 4-14 and wounds several others in Wanla Weyne.

09 May. Unidentified clan militias clash in several areas in Sool and Sanaag regions. The fighting began in Dhidinka, near the town of Eel Afweyn, spread to many areas, among them Sigadher, Dararweyne and Fadhigab. Seven were killed in Eel Afweyn, nine killed in Fadhigab and five killed Dhidinka.

09 May. Unidentified clan militias clash in several areas in Sool and Sanaag regions. The fighting began in Dhidinka, near the town of Eel Afweyn, spread to many areas, among them Sigadher, Dararweyne and Fadhigab. Seven were killed in Eel Afweyn, nine killed in Fadhigab and five killed Dhidinka.

09 May. Unidentified clan militias clash in several areas in Sool and Sanaag regions. The fighting began in Dhidinka, near the town of Eel Afweyn, spread to many areas, among them Sigadher, Dararweyne and Fadhigab. Seven were killed in Eel Afweyn, nine killed in Fadhigab and five killed Dhidinka.

09 May. Unidentified clan militias clash in several areas in Sool and Sanaag regions. The fighting began in Dhidinka, near the town of Eel Afweyn, spread to many areas, among them Sigadher, Dararweyne and Fadhigab. Seven were killed in Eel Afweyn, nine killed in Fadhigab and five killed Dhidinka.
09 May. Al Shabaab kills three police officers in an open air market in Yaaqshiid.
09 May. Green on green clash in Wadajir. Causalities not known.
09 May. Suspected US drone strike targets unidentified al Shabaab position near Aw Dheegle. Outcome and resulting casualty figures unknown.
09 May. Al Shabaab stoned a woman to death for multiple marriages in Lower Shabelle Region.

08 May. Two groups of government soldiers, divided along clan lines namely Daud and Kabale of Abgaal sub clans, clashed over land dispute at Kawo-Godey neighbourhood in Dharkenley district. At least one government soldier was killed and three others were injured. Tension was reported to be high and there was no mediation between the two groups.

08 May. Four mortar rounds, fired from an unknown direction(s), impacted on Stadium Mogadishu neighbourhood in Wardhigley district. At least five civilians were injured by a mortar which landed near Ali Kamin area. Perpetrators believed to be al Shabaab.
07 May. Fighting between Somali soldiers and al Shabaab in Daynuunay. Three al Shabaab dead, two soldiers wounded.
07 May. A police officer was shot and killed by an assailant hailing from Ali Saleeban sub-clan in Carmo area.

07 May. Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit and run attack at an SNA checkpoint in Captain Las vicinity (c. 12 km north west of Merka district). SNA responded and the al Shabaab attackers were forced to withdraw. Casualties could not be ascertained at the time of reporting.

07 May. Unidentified armed men shot and killed security personnel at One Shabelle University at Tabeelaha Sheikh Ibrahim village in Dayniile district. The incident occurred shortly after the victim exited from a shop to enter his vehicle. The perpetrators managed to escape with his vehicle after the shooting. Government forces arrived at the scene and conducted a search operation. There were no reports of arrests.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 07 May. Islamic State "Amaq News Agency" claims responsibility for assassination of NISA officer. Video released.

07 May. US air forces conducted an airstrike targeting al Shabaab hideouts in Warad and Hararrow (JiilJiiley general area) grazing areas located west of Ceel Cali village. The security official said a number of al-Shabab fighters were killed in the air strikes and destroyed materials in the militants' camp which included technical vehicles and weapons.
06 May. Al Shabaab assassinates a police officer in Wadajir during the morning hours.

06 May. Al Shabaab attackers hurdled three hand grenades at the residence of Baraawe Deputy District Commissioner at Bashiir Goobe in Dayax village neighbourhood in Baraawe district. The attack was followed by a brief exchange of gunfire between the attackers and the guards of the Deputy District Commissioner after which the attackers withdrew. Three civilian bystanders were injured.

06 May. SNA and al Shabaab fighters clash near Qurunlow village (c. 32 km east of Baidoa) on the road between Baidoa and Burhakaba district. The armed clash occurred after SNA forces attacked al Shabaab fighters on the road. Three SNA soldiers were killed and two others were injured. Casualties from al Shabaab fighters could not be established at the time of reporting.

06 May. A man was shot and wounded by an armed civilian over a land dispute at Waaberi roundabout at the centre of Garowe town. Both men hailed from Reer Yoonis sub clan of Isse Mohamoud. The wounded person was taken to hospital for treatment. The culprit was arrested and investigations were reported to be ongoing.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: 06 May. Eight Kenyan soldiers were killed and two others seriously injured after an improvised explosive device (IED) hit a military vehicle near the Somali town of Dhobley on Sunday. Al Shabaab claims 15 dead.
06 May. A bomb placed under the vehicle of a Yemeni national detonates in Shibis district, killing the target. Al Shabaab blamed.

05 May. Pastoralists hailing from two sub-clans of Ceyr clan clashed at an isolated area near Qalanqale (c. 40 km north west of Dhusamareb). Two people were killed and around 15 others were injured. The armed clash was triggered by a previous clan confrontation.

05 May. Hargeisa local municipal, supported by SLP, conducted a security operation intended to relocate people residing near Qudhac-dher Dam in Hargeisa.The residents resisted and pelted stones at the police. Three people were shot and injured and an unspecified number of people were arrested.
05 May. Al Shabaab fighters ambush Southwest convoy near Gasarla. Five militants , three Southwest soldiers killed.

05 May. Suspected armed SNA freelance men reportedly shot and killed a businessman at Beerta Katka neighbourhood near Seybiano in Hodan district. SNPF arrived at the scene and conducted a security search operation. However, there were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators managed to escape. The reason for the attack is not known.
05 May. Somali soldier shoots and kills civilian in Kaxda (Dharkenley). Assailant escaped, motives unknown.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
notes: 04 May. A group of armed men manning a checkpoint in Bura Wadal village, Sool region, have injured Puntland's Deputy Police Commander Colonel Bile Farah Ali after they opened fire on his vehicle.

04 May. Suspected al Shabaab shot and killed a senior police officer at Suuq Weyne vicinity in Wadajir district. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack. Later, a second attack claimed by AS as hand grenade was hurled at Wadajir Police station near Hassan Hilaac village in Wadajir district. Soldiers reacted with gunfire towards suspected directions of the attack. One police officer was injured by the blast. A suspected man was arrested by the police after the attack.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 04 May. Puntland troops ambushed a group of Somaliland forces who were collecting firewood near God-Qaboobe (52km E of Lasanod). Somaliland forces reportedly responded with gunfire and both exchanged fire. There were no reports of casualties.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 04 May. Jubaland and US forces conduct joint operation against al Shabaab in Bar - Sunguuni. Outcome and resulting casualty figures unknown.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 03 May. Somali government forces backed by African Union troops have captured the strategic town of Baidoa from al Shabaab. A soldier was killed and three others were wounded in the attack.

03 May. Al Shabaab killed a police officer who was sitting in front of a coffee shop at Kulmiye Hospital in Bondheere district. The motive of the assassination was not clear and the perpetrators managed to escape.

03 May. SNA forces, on a reconnaissance mission, clashed with al Shabaab fighters at the edge of Morgabet village (c. 40 km west of Xudur town). There was a brief exchange of small arms fire after which al Shabaab fighters retreated from the area. There were no reports of casualties and SNA forces returned to their base.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
notes: 03 May. Two groups of Puntland police clash at Burawadal for unknown reason.
02 May. Al Shabaab militants shot and killed two people consisting of an SNA soldier and a female khat dealer at Bar Ubah junction road neighbourhood in Howlwadag district.
02 May. A police officer was shot and killed by al Shabaab at Kaaran Police Station.

02 May. Two groups of government soldiers, divided along clan lines namely Hawaadle and Habargidir sub clans, clashed over extortion of money from a new building at the Siliga (Ex. US Embassy) village in Wadajir district. At least four government soldiers were killed and four others were injured

02 May. Al Shabaab fighters executed a militiaman hailing from Gaaljecel clan at a public gathering in Mukuyle village (c. 125 km south west of Beletweyne town). The victim was detained by al Shabaab near a nearby rural area on 30h April 2018 after he killed his fellow clan member.
02 May. Unidentified actors abducted a German Red Cross nurse in Mogadishu. Another Red Cross worker was assassinated on 28/04.
02 May. IED detonates in front of hotel Nasaney in Qansax Dheere. Two civilians killed, Southwest forces arrested several suspected al Shabaab militants in the aftermath of the explosion.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 02 May. Puntland forces shoot and kill a civilian near the airport for unknown reason.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 02 May. Al Shabaab fighters attack Jubaland checkpoint near Gaduud. Assailants repelled, no casualties reported.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 2 May 2018: Jubbaland troops backed up by locals clashed with Al Shabab over Livestock tax dispute In Dhobley town (Jubbada). No reported casualties

01 May. A hand grenade was hurled at SNA on foot patrol at Ali Kamiin village vicinity in Wardhigley district. Soldiers reacted with gunfire towards the general direction of the attack. One SNA soldier was injured by the blast. The unidentified assailants managed to escape from the scene.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
notes: 01 May. Galmudug forces clash with local militias in Cabudwaaq following set-up of illegal checkpoint. Casualties reported, figures unknown (coded as 10).
01 May. Al Shabaab claims to have killed "more than 10" government soldiers in an attack in Dhobley on or before 01/05.
01 May. Pastoralists clash with al Shabaab outside of Afmadow over taxation. Casualties reported, figures unknown (coded as 10).
01 May. A members of the WHO is shot and killed in Mogadishu. Radio Risala implies al Shabaab responsible.

30 April. SNA and armed pastoralists from Marehan clan, sub-clan of Daarood clashed at Abudwak town. There was an exchange of gunfire. The incident occurred after pastoralists refused to comply with firearm restrictions in Abudwak town. One pastoralist was killed and another was injured.
30 April. Al Shabaab attacks and kills an intelligence official in Siinka Dheer.
30 April. Al Shabaab attacks a government soldier position in Wadajir. Three reported dead.

30 April. Suspected al Shabaab militants shot and killed an SNA officer at Siinka Dheer area in Suuq Bacaad in Deyniile district. Government soldiers conducted a security search operation but there were no reports of arrests made. The perpetrators escaped and al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 30 April. SLA soldiers while collecting firewood from an area near Tuka-raq were shot at by Puntland troops. One SLA soldier was injured and later succumbed to his injuries at the SLA military base in Tuka-raq.
29 April. Al Shabaab clashes with farmers in Garbahaarey. Both sides suffered an unknown number of causalities.

29 April. Two groups of government soldiers clashed at Haanta Dheer neighbourhood in Deyniile district. There was heavy exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes. At least five civilians were killed and six others were injured. Further reports suggested that the primary motive of the clash related to a land dispute between the two groups.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 29 April. A magnetic IED attached to a private vehicle detonated near El - Hindi village vicinity in Howlwadag district. The target was a NISA officer. However, he was not in the vehicle when the explosion occurred. The vehicle was destroyed. There were no reports of casualties. NISA soldiers arrived at the scene and conducted a search operation where they arrested one male alleged to be behind the UVIED explosion.
28 April. An al Shabaab suicide bomber kills three police officers, including a commander, in Gaalkacyo. Several other injures reported. The fatality total was raised to seven the following week.

28 April. Militia hailing from Biimaal and Abgaal/Abdulle-Arooni sub clans clashed at Muuri village (c. 16 km south west of Afgooye). There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for more than three hours. At least three fighters were injured and a civilian female bystander was killed.

28 April. Al Shabaab fighters shot and injured a man at Rays-Gore village (c. 18 km east of Garbaharey district). The victim had an argument with al Shabaab fighters after the man was denied access to his farm by al Shabaab fighters. The victim was taken to Garbaharey town for treatment.
28 April. A Gaaljecel militiaman killed a member of his own clan for unknown reason near Mukuyle. The perpetrator was executed by al Shabaab in the following days.

assoc_actor_2: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent
notes: 28 April. An aid worker with the International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) was killed after an explosion caused by a device fitted to his car. Perpetrators not known.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 28 April. The deputy chief of Waberi District's National Intelligence Security Agency was wounded when an explosive planted under his vehicle detonated. Perpetrators not named by source.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 28 April. An al Shabaab landmine strikes a Jubaland vehicle in Urungow, near Dhobley, killing between four and five.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 28 April. A UVIED, targeting an immigration personnel, exploded at Buundo Kowaad (first Bridge) neighbourhood in Waberi district. The targeted person informed the EOD team. However, the IED exploded before arrival of the EOD team injuring a NISA District Commander who was standing near the vehicle.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force; AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: 27 April. US, Jubaland and Kenyan forces attack an al Shabaab base at Bar Sanguni, 45km north of Kismayo. 30 al Shabaab dead. Al Shabaab claimed they had inflicted losses on the allied forces, but did not provide numbers.

27 April. Unidentified armed men, suspected to be al Shabaab militants, shot and killed two people including an SNA soldier and a civilian female bystander at Howlwadag junction area in Howlwadag District. SNPF soldiers arrived at the scene of the incident and conducted a security search operation but there were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators managed to escape.

27 April. Al Shabaab shot and killed a police officer at Gaheyr University vicinity in Dharkenley district. The perpetrators managed to escape after the incident. Government soldiers arrived at the scene of the incident but there were no reports of arrests.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 27 April. Al Shabaab gunmen assassinate NISA officer near Gaheyr University. Assailants escaped.
27 April. Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a civilian in Xudur.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 27 April. An IED, targeting an AMISOM convoy travelling along the Afgooye-Mogadishu road, exploded at the vicinity of Boodboodka (c. 02 km south east of Afgoye District). The convoy was headed to Baraawe from Mogadishu. An AMISOM armoured vehicle was extensively damaged by the blast. Casualties from the incident was unknown.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 27 April. An RCIED, targeting an AMISOM convoy travelling from Afgoye to Shalamboot town, exploded at the outskirt of KM 60 village (Siinka Dheer). The AMISOM lead battlewagon was damaged. Casualties could not be confirmed at the time of reporting. The perpetrators managed to escape and al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
27 April. An al Shabaab IED targets a civilian minibus in Mahadaay. Casualties not known.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 27 April. A group of Jubaland soldiers from academia base located north east of Kismayo went on a search for rogue soldiers. There was an exchange of gunfire between the two JSF groups at Afmadow Shaqalaha neighbourhood in Kismayo town. JSF managed to arrest three absconders. There were no reports of casualties.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 27 April. An IED, targeting a mobile Jubaland (JSF) Toyota Pick-up carrying a civilian, exploded at c. 09 km south east of Dhobley town. Six JSF were killed and the vehicle was destroyed. The civilian driver sustained slight injuries.

27 April. Clan militia shot and killed three women from a rival clan (both unidentified) near Aliyow Mumin village (c. 20 km south west of Baidoa). The incident was related to ongoing clan conflict between two rival clans in the area. Al Shabaab fighters intervened as the incident location is under their area of influence.
26 April. Two unidentified rival clan militias clash over unspecified motives. At least three killed.
26 April. Al Shabaab ambushed a group of US forces at Buulo Gaduud, "inflicting losses." Numbers not known.
26 April. Al Shabaab fighters attack a SNAF checkpoint in Hawl Wadaag. Female civilian bystander killed, assailants escaped.

26 April. Two clan militias clashed near Surmay Daaraya village (c. 22 km south west of Baidoa). The clash occurred after a dispute over ownership of land. Three people were killed. One of the clan militias were overpowered and managed to escape from the area.

26 April. A man who hailed from Dasheshe clan was shot and killed by an armed man hailing from Omar Mohamud clan at Golise Masjidul Huda, Bosasso area. The perpetrator was arrested and taken to the central police station for further investigation. The motive of the killing was not clear.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 26 April. Jubaland forces attacked an al Shabaab position at Bu-xaji village (c. 70 km south west of Kismayo). There was a brief exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab retreated from the area. Three al Shabaab fighters were killed. The soldiers confiscated three AK47s from al Shabaab fighters.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 26 April. A group of al Shabaab attacked a Jubaland position at Degelame village located along the Kenya-Somalia border (c. 12 km south of Dhobley town). There was a brief exchange of gunfire after which JSF were forced to withdraw from the location. Injuries reported.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 25 April. ISIL assassinates a NISA officer in Hawl Wadaag and later claimed credit.
25 April. Al Shabaab fighters ambush a military convoy near Tayeeglow. Casualties unknown.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 25 April. Suspected al Shabaab shot and killed a NISA soldier at Buurdheere village neighbourhood in Waberi district.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: 25 April. Al Shabaab forces ambush a group of AMISOM-Uganda soldiers at Ceel Waregow. An exchange of gunfire followed. An unknown number of causalities reported on both sides.
25 April. A SNA soldier was stabbed and injured by a civilian over a land dispute at Wabari neighbourhood in Dhobley town.

25 April. Two armed al Shabaab elements shot and killed an unidentified youth in Howlwadag district. The victim was attacked shortly after he came out of a shop. The perpetrators escaped. The District Police attended to the scene but there were no reports of arrests made.

25 April. Unknown attackers, suspected to be rogue SNA elements, shot at a public vehicle carrying khat from Mogadishu to Afgoye at Elasha Biyaha area in Afgoye district. One female khat dealer was severely injured. The perpetrators stole the khat and escaped from the area.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: 25 April. An RCIED, planted on the road between Bulo-gudud and Wirkoy villages and targeting AMISOM and SNA forces on foot patrol (the force may have been led by the Americans), exploded near Wirkoy village, 38 km north of Kismayo town. The joint forces were conducting a security operation against al Shabaab fighters when the attack occurred. Three SNA soldiers were injured and transported to Kismayo for medical treatment. Perpetrators likely al Shabaab.

25 April. An IED, buried alongside the main road and targeting an SNA vehicle, exploded near Imbaresso village at Barawe. At least two SNA soldiers were injured. Al Shabaab fighters claimed responsibility for the attack.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 24 April. Al Shabaab fighter hurls hand grenade towards AMISOM position in Shibis. Al Shabaab claims two injured.
24 April. Unidentified gunmen assassinate an auto rickshaw driver in Bakaara market.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: 24 April. Al Shabaab attacks AMISOM-Uganda forces in Ceelasha Biyaha during the early morning hours. There were no immediate reports on casualties, however al Shabaab said in a statement that its fighters inflicted "heavy casualties" on the AMISOM troops. Enemy casualties are often embellished inflated by al Shabaab.

24 April. A hand grenade was hurled at the Office of the District Commissioner at 1st May village in Waberi district. Soldiers reacted with gunfire towards suspected directions of the attack. There were no reports of casualties and the unidentified assailant managed to escape.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 24 April. An IED, targeting an AMISOM convoy travelling from Merka to Afgoye, exploded at Buullo Naagad village near Kelicafimaad, 18 north of Merka. There was an exchange of gunfire between al Shabaab fighters and government forces. The lead vehicle of the convoy was damaged and two AMISOM soldiers were injured.

24 April. Unidentified armed men shot and killed a rickshaw driver at a bus station at the Livestock market in Heliwa district. The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene. The motive of the incident was not clear.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 24 April. NISA soldier kills civilian driver of auto-rickshaw. No arrests made.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 24 April. Jubaland forces clashed with al Shabaab fighters in areas located 5 km east of Abdalle Birole village. There was a brief exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab retreated from the area. There were no reports of casualties.

24 April. An unidentified armed soldier shot and killed a civilian female at Lido Beach vicinity in Abdiaziz district. The victim was on her way home when the armed man attacked and shot her. Her body was taken to CID for further investigation. The motive of the incident was not clear.
23 April. Suspected al Shabaab assailant hurls a hand grenade towards police checkpoint in Suuq Bacad, Yaaqshid. No casualties, assailant escaped.

23 April. Two groups of students of Dayaxa Boarding School clashed in Cerigabo due to clan related conflict. The fighting started after two students from Habar Jeclo and Habar Yonis clan fought. The fight escalated to other students from both clans.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 23 April. Al Shabaab fighters conduct a hit-and-run against Moalim Nuur NISA checkpoint. Assailants repelled, casualties unknown.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
notes: 23 April. Al Shabaab conducted a hit-and-run attack against an AMISOM Burundian troop base at Arbacow vicinity (c. 15 km west of Mogadishu in Afgoye district). There was heavy exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 30 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. There were no reports of casualties.
23 April. Al Shabaab fighters attack a government forces location in Afgooye. Military forces pushed back the attack, "causing causalities" - numbers not known.

actor2: Military Forces of United Arab Emirates (2004-)
notes: 23 April. Two dead and five others injured when soldiers trained by the UAE and Somali government forces clashed in Mogadishu. The clash started after UAE soldiers attempted to take some military hardware from the government forces.
23 April. Two groups of students at Dayaxa Boarding School clash. Incident triggered by ongoing clan conflict between Habar Jeeclo and Habar Yonis. Causalities not known.

23 April. A woman was shot and sustained a non life threatening injury after an armed man hailing from Omar Mohamud clan shot at a rickshaw driver who was carrying the victim near Classic Hotel in North Galkayo. The motive for the incident was unknown.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 23 April. Several gunshots were heard behind a UN compound in Garowe. Reports confirmed that the commander of the residence of the former Vice-President was killed by his fellow soldier, reasons unknown.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
notes: 23 April. An armed civilian man (from Reer Hussein sub-clan of Isse Mohamoud clan) shot and wounded two police officers in front of the central police station in Garowe. In response to the incident, another police officer shot and killed the attacker. The motive for the incident was unknown and the dead body was taken to hospital.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 23 April. Jubaland and al Shabaab forces clash at Buulo Gaduud. Causalities of unknown number reported on both sides.
22 April. Two SNA groups clashed for unknown reasons in Balcad district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about half an hour. There were no reports of casualties.
21 April. Al Shabaab fighters ambush a military convoy travelling between Middle Shabelle and Hiraan regions at or near Jalalaqsi. Casualties and outcome unknown.

21 April. Unidentified armed assailants attacked a government force checkpoint at Hamarjadid village in Wardhigley district. The attackers initiated the attack using a hand grenade towards the checkpoint. There was a brief exchange of gunfire which lasted for about half an hour. One soldier and a civilian bystander were killed. The attackers escaped.
21 April. An armed clash occurred between two groups of Gahayle Reer sub-clans in Arta area of Bossaso due to a land dispute. Two people were killed and two others were wounded.
21 April. Al Shabaab attack a government forces base in Wardhigley. One death reported.

20 April. Al Shabaab hurled a hand grenade at a tea shop in Barawe district. Government forces were in the area before the assailants threw the hand grenade. Four people, believed to be civilian bystanders, were injured. Al Shabaab claimed the responsibility of the attack.

20 April. Residents of El-Afweyne demonstrated against the arrest of a prominent Somaliland traditional leader by Somaliland authorities. The demonstrators burnt tires and blocked roads in El-Afweyn. Demonstration were also reported in Ainabo town, but it is not known if these demos were violent.

20 April. A dead body was found near Buulo-Dooro IDP camp in North Galkayo. The victim was from Leelkase clan. Bullet wounds were found on his body. The motive for the killing was unknown. Puntland police were reported to be investigating the incident.
19 April. Government forces and al Shabaab clash in Yaaqshiid. At least one al Shabaab dead.
19 April. Two Gahayle/Reer Arab clans clash in Arta over land dispute. Two people killed, two injured.

19 April. A UVIED, attached to a vehicle belonging to an official of the Ministry of Fisheries, exploded in Taleex Village near Hodan Police Station in Hodan district. There were no reports of casualties. Perpetrators not named by the source.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 19 April. Puntland forces launched a military operation against Al Shabaab in Mardarshon area of Galgala and killed three al Shabaab fighters.
15 - 19 April, period between. Details limited - clan clashes reported in Bossaso and Belet Weyne. One death reported.
18 April . Al Shabaab ambush in Balcad, 5 SNA killed.
18 April. Idig Facle and Warsangeli clans cash over land dispute outside of Balade. One injured. PSF and Police intervened, arrest four perpetrators.
18 April. Two groups of SNAF soldiers exchange gunfire during checkpoint incident in Hodan. Resulting casualties unknown.
18 April. Unidentified gunmen open fire against civilian minibus in Beled Weyne. Four injured.
18 April. Al Shabaab fighters shot and injured three civilians at charcoal burning site 5km from Beerhani.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: 17 April. Combined Jubaland/Kenyan forces overtake al Shabaab forces in Qoqani, after it have been under their control "for several hours." No Jubaland/Kenya causality, though witness claimed to have seen "dead bodies" of al Shabaab.

17 April. Military forces engage al Shabaab along the road linking Beledweyne town to Mataban and Mahas. After a sustained gunfight, military forces regained control of the area, as well as other surrounding areas. 30 al Shabaab dead. No reported military dead.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 17 April 2018: Al Shabab Assailants killed Somali intelligence agent in Mogadishu. The assailants had managed to escape the scene before security forces arrived.
17 April. Al Shabaab assailants shot and killed two government soldiers in a tea shop located at Arbiska neighbourhood in Afgoye. The perpetrators escaped after the incident.
16 April. Al Shabaab ambush of soldiers in an El Garas location. 2 SNA killed.

16 April. A government soldier shot and severely wounded a rickshaw driver at Ceelasha Biyaha in Afgoye district. The soldier was managing traffic congestion on the road before he shot at a crowd. The perpetrator was arrested by security forces.

16 April. Al Shabaab fighters abducted a member of Hiraan Regional Youth Group from Miircadde area, 40 km east of Beletweyne town. The motive behind his abduction was related to his active role in the youth and social activities in Maxas district especially with the youth organization in that district.
16 April. Two armed men shot and killed a civilian man in Bondhere District. The victim was closely associated with NISA soldiers in the district.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 16 April. Jubaland forces clashed with a group of al Shabaab fighters at Qoqani. There was a brief exchange of gunfire. There were no reports of casualties, however it is believed al Shabaab forces gained control of the area following the clash.

15 April. An IED, targeting government soldiers, exploded at Buulo Foolyo in Afgoye district. There was an exchange of heavy gunfire between al Shabaab fighters and government forces. Al Shabaab briefly took control of the checkpoint and took an unspecified amount of money. At least three soldiers were killed. Casualties could not be ascertained at the time of reporting.
15 April. Al Shabaab operative hurls a hand grenade towards SNAF checkpoint near former Milk Factory. No casualties reported, assailant escaped.
15 April. Al Shabaab shot and killed a police officer near Yaqshid district offices at Fagah junction.

15 April. An RCIED, buried along the roadside and targeting an SNA vehicle, exploded near the Ministry of Defence. Security forces opened shot towards suspected directions of the attack. There were no reports of casualties. Perpetrators not named by the source.
15 April. SNAF troops clash with an unidentified armed militia after later attempted to set-up an illegal checkpoint and extort taxes from ongoing building sites. Casualties unknown.

04 November. 101 cases of rape were recorded in Somaliland between January and November 2018 (coded as one event per month); 105 individuals were accused of rape out of which 87 were arrested and charged.

15 April. Armed men using pistols shot and killed a university lecturer at Oodweyne village in Deynile district. The victim came out of a nearby garage when the armed men attacked him. The motive of the killing was not clear. The assailants escaped.
15 April. Al Shabaab shot and killed a businessman in Wanleweyn district. The businessman refused to pay tax to the group. The perpetrators escaped.
15 April. Pro-Puntland militiaman (group not identified) shoots and injures Dhulbahante/Wacays Khat dealer in Qod Qaboobe, near Las Anod. Motives unknown, assailant escaped.
14 April. Hawadle and Jareerweyne clan militias clashed at Banaaney area, north of Beletweyne town. One death, two injuries.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 14 April. Al Shabaab fighters attacked NISA troops based in Yaqshid district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 25 minutes. Two civilian bystanders were injured. Casualties could not be ascertained at the time of reporting.
14 April. Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate an official of the Ministry of Education. Two assailants escaped.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 13 April. Al Shabaab kills a Puntland soldier in Gaalkacyo.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 13 April. A Puntland soldier shot and injured a khat dealer from Dhulbahante Wacays Ali Sub-clan near Godaqaboobe village, 53 km east of Lasanod. The motive of the incident was not clear. The perpetrator escaped from the scene.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 12 April. Al Shabaab combatants attacked an AMISOM convoy moving near Danow settlement at Buulo Marer town. There was an exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab were forced to withdraw. Casualties could not be ascertained at the time of reporting.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: 12 April. Al Shabaab fighters ambush UPDF convoy travelling to Buulo Mareer, near Danow. Assailants repelled, no casualties reported.
12 April. A bomb explodes during a football match in Baraawe, between 4-5 dead. The bomb was placed in the 'VIP' section of the stadium, targeting soldiers. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.
12 April. A IED, attached to a vehicle owned by a tax official, exploded at Hanti-wadag district in Jowhar town. No reports of causalities. Perpetrators not known.
12 April. An accountant working for the municipality was shot and killed at Israac Village in North Galkayo. The motive of killing was unknown. The perpetrator managed to escape from the scene.
12 April. A roadside bomb exploded at Kahda district. A civilian truck was damaged. Two passengers were injured in the explosion. Perpetrators not named by the source.
12 April. IED detonates when civilians attempt to remove it, 2 killed. Perpetrators not known.
11 April. Al Shabaab killed a police officer near Badbaado settlement in Wadajir district.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: 11 April. Al Shabaab fighters attack UPDF defensive position near Baraawe. Resulting casualties unknown.
11 April. Armed clashes erupt between two SNAF soldiers. Casualties and motives unknown.
11 April. US AFRICOM conducts airstrike against VBIED in Jana Cabdalle. Casualties unknown, VBIED destroyed.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 11 April. Joint Jubaland/US forces advance on Sunguuni near Jamaame, clash with al Shabaab. No casualties reported.
10 April. Two groups of SNAF soldiers, organized along unidentified clan lines, clashed in Wadajir district over a land dispute. Two soldiers were killed and four others were injured.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 10 April. Al Shabaab attacked an AMISOM base in Ambareeso Settlement located outside Barawe district. There was an exchange of heavy gunfire after which al Shabaab were forced to withdraw. At least one AMISOM soldier was injured in the attack.
10 April. Two SNAF soldiers assassinate two others in Daynile. This clash is distinct from a similar one in Wadajir. Assailants fled with confiscated weaponry. Motives unknown.
10 April. An RCIED, placed on the roof of a small teashop located exploded. Five people were injured. A child, who was injured in the incident, died in hospital. Perpetrators not named by the source.
10 April. An IED, targeting an elder and broker, exploded in Wadajir district. The victim was seriously injured. Three bystanders were injured. Perpetrators not known.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 10 April. Puntland and al Shabaab fighters clashed at Madarshon area of Galgala, 67 km south west of Bossaso. There were no reports of immediate casualties and arrests.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
notes: 10 April. Civilian bus driver shot and injured by custom police at Main Customs checkpoint. Driver had attempted to escape. Perpetrator also arrested.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 10 April. Al Shabaab detonated an IED, targeting a Puntland military vehicle, at Balikhadar area of Galgala, 35 km south west of Bossaso. One soldier was wounded.
09 April. Two hand grenades exploded at Lanta Towfiq in Yaqshid district. Two soldiers were injured. The unidentified perpetrators managed to escape.

09 April. Two local clan (identities not given) militias clashed at Faangurmurre grazing area near Bukure (c. 125 km east of Beletweyne town) due to a dispute over grazing land. The armed clash lasted for about three hours after which one of the clan militias retreated from the location. Eight militias were killed from both clans and 24 others were injured.

09 April. A hand grenade was hurled at SNAF soldiers in Howlwadaag district by unknown perpetrators. The soldiers opened fire towards suspected directions of the attack. A female bystander was injured. The perpetrators manage to escape.
09 April. Government forces conducted a security operation at Goofgaduud where they clashed with al Shabaab. One al Shabaab fighter was killed.
09 April. Unidentified assailant injures Omar Mohamud/Majerten civilian in Qardho. Assailant later arrested, motives unknown.
09 April. Kenyan forces bombed three al Shabaab locations near Faafax Dhuun. It is not known if the Kenyan force used aircraft or artillery. Causalities not known.
09 April. A heavy explosion was heard at an al Shabaab location near Jilib. The type of blast and casualties could not be established.
08 April. US forces launch an air strike against ISIS figures in Dadar. Four deaths reported.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 07 April. A NISA commander and his body guard were shot and killed by al Shabaab at Elasha Biyaha in Afgoye district. The perpetrators took the vehicle of the commander and AK47 belonging to the body guard.

07 April. An RCIED buried at a military checkpoint exploded at Xaanshooley (c. 05 km from Jowhar town). Two soldiers and one civilian were killed and four others were injured. Perpetrators not named by the source.
07 April. Unidentified perpetrators shot and killed a prominent businessman who hailed from Dhulbahante/Nuur-Ahmed sub clan near Goolada in Las Anod.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 07 April. Armed clashes oppose al Shabaab with Jubaland troops outside of Kismayo, one officer killed.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 07 April. Media reports state that a security official was killed in clashes between opposing Jubaland forces. The reason for the clash is not known.

06 April. A hand grenade was hurled at a house in Yaaqshid. The house hosted a wedding ceremony during the attack. The motive of the attack was unknown. The perpetrators managed to escape. There were no reports of casualties.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 06 April. SVBIED stopped at checkpoint detonates. One NISA killed, three bystanders injured.
06 April. Unconfirmed local reports claim a grenade is thrown at a wedding party. No casualties reported at present. Perpetrators not known.
06 April. Two al Shabaab suicide VBIEDs detonate along airport road. Three al Shabaab dead, one soldier. The Somali Memo, al Shabaab's propaganda arm, claimed 18 soldiers dead.
06 April. Somaliland police shot and injured a person who refused to stop at a checkpoint in Waridaad.
05 April. Al Shabaab assailant hurls a hand grenade towards SNAF checkpoint in Afgooye. Three civilians and one SNAF injured. Assailant escaped.

05 April. An SNA soldier was shot and killed by another soldier at the centre of Baidoa town. The circumstance surrounding the killing of the soldier was unknown. Police forces arrived at the scene of the incident and managed to arrest the perpetrator. He was reported to be under custody for further investigation.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: 05 April. Al Shabaab ambushed a KDF reinforcement convoy from Tabta at Jaldesa (c. 42 km east of Dhobley). The group was travelling to aid following an IED attack in the area. No reported causality.
05 April. Rival clan clashes (actors not identified) near Mandheere. One civilian killed. Clashes triggered by dispute over farmland ownership dispute.
05 April. Infighting between SNA troops in Daynile, with a number of casualties of both SNA and civilians reported - Numbers not known.
05 April. A US airstrike leaves three al Shabaab dead near Jilib.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: 05 April. Two roadside IEDs have immobilised two KDF vehicles near Dhobley. Causality figures, perpetrators not known.
05 April. Unknown armed men shot and killed a herder from Dhulbahante clan near of DaboTaag. The motive of the killing was unknown.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 05 April. A Puntland soldier, who hailed from Reer Mohamud clan, sub-clan of Majeerteen, was shot and killed by an armed man hailing from Leelkase clan near a police post at Garsoor village in North Galkayo.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 05 April. A Puntland soldier from Reer Mohamud clan sub-clan of Majeerteen was shot and killed by a man hailing from Leelkase clan near a police post at Garsoor. The motive is unknown. Perpetrator escaped from the area.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 05 April. Al Shabaab conducted an attack against Jubaland forces based at Bulagadud. There was an exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab retreated. There is no reports of casualties.
04 April. Security forces attack journalists outside the Parliament building. The reporters were covering a governing dispute.
04 April. Two soldiers exchanged gunfire at Buundaweyne. During the armed confrontation one civilian bystander was killed and a second injured.
04 April. Habar Jeclo and Habar Yonis clans clashed at Fadhi Gaab. Four people were killed and nine others were injured.
04 April. An al Shabaab IED detonates at Sana' Junction against SNAF convoy. Three bystanders killed.
04 April. A deceased man was found in South Galkayo. Bullet wounds were observed on his body. The motive for the killing is unknown.
04 April. Local clan militia assassinates local Khat dealer outside of Belet Weyne, injures two bystanders. Assailants escaped, motives unknown.
04 April. IED targets SNAF vehicle near Sinka Dheer. Two SNAF injured.

04 April. An RCIED targeting the deputy district commissioner of Deyniile exploded in Karan District. The Commissioner survived after the incident. Five bystanders were killed and four others were injured. Perpetrators not known.
04 April. An al Shabaab IED planted at house of electoral delegate detonates in Belet Weyne. One child injured.
03 April. Al Shabaab fighters ambush a SNAF convoy near Buusaar. Assailants repelled, casualties unknown.
03 April. Unidentified armed attackers shot a civilian man who participated in the 2016 Lower House elections in Dharkeynley district. No one claimed responsibility of the attack.
03 April. A man was wounded by an unknown assailant at Jiiragarob, south east of Bossaso. The motive was not clear. Police were reported to be investigating.
03 April. An al Shabaab RCIED targets vehicle of Wadajir district commissioner. One bystander injured.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 03 April. Al Shabaab fighters conducted a probing attack against Jubbaland forces based at Afmadow. Al Shabaab fired at Jubaland force base using small firearms and machine guns. There was a brief exchange of gunfire which lasted for about ten minutes after which al Shabaab retreated. Initial reports indicated that mid-level al Shabaab officer was killed in the attack. His body taken by al Shabaab.

02 April. Al Shabaab attacked an SNA force base located west of Bulo Burte district. Al Shabaab fired small firearms from a distance towards the direction of the base. SNA forces did not respond to the gunfire. Al Shabaab fighters retreated from the area. There were no reports of casualties.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
notes: 02 April. SNA troops and AMISOM Burundian contingent clashed at Jowhar Airport. The incident occurred after a plane carrying khat landed in Jowhar airport and SNA troops, alleged to be loyal to one businessman involved in the khat business, entered into the airport and open fire against the AMISOM Burundian forces. One AMISOM solider killed, two others wounded.

02 April. Al Shabaab attacked a military base at Busaar. There was an exchange of heavy gunfire which lasted for about one hour after which al Shabaab were forced to retreat. At least one confirmed death.
02 April. Police shot and killed two men riding motorbikes at Tiidale village, 10 km north west of Dinsoor. The two are believed to be al Shabaab conducting a mission to capture defectors.

02 April. Two unknown perpetrators hurled two hand grenades at Bossaso municipality office. There were no reports of casualties. PSF arrived at the scene and conducted a security operation in the area.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 02 April. An al Shabaab IED targets AMISOM logistics convoy at Warmahan. One vehicle possibly destroyed. Causalities not known.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
notes: 02 April. An al Shabaab IED targets a BNDF convoy travelling from Mahaday to Jowhar. One water truck damaged, one injured.
02 April. A person was shot and killed by unknown armed men in Hodan district. The motive behind the incident was not clear.
02 April. Two civilian men were abducted at the centre of Garowe city by Issa Mohamoud militia. The abducted men hailed from Isaaq clan. The kidnapping was related to revenge.

02 April. An RCIED exploded at a location 8 km west of Bulo Burte. Seven civilians killed. The target was not clear. No one claimed responsibility for the incident, though authorities blame al Shabaab. Radio Risala claims 10 dead.

02 April. An IED prematurely detonated near Manyafulka. An AMISOM convoy was on its way to Baidoa from Burhakaba at that time. However, the convoy had not reached the area where the explosion occurred. There were no reports of casualties.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 02 April. Al Shabaab fighters conducted an attack against Jubaland forces at Bulogudud. Al Shabaab fired mortar rounds and shot at the base using light firearms at a distance towards the direction of the base. Jubaland forces responded with heavy gunfire. Al Shabaab fighters retreated. There were no reports of casualties.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 01 April. A group of al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM convoy moving near Hanshiekh, Balcad district. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
source: Goobjoob; Local Source; Radio Risala; Shabelle Media Network
notes: 01 April. Al Shabaab fighters attacked two (possibly multiple) AMISOM bases at Buulo-Marer and Golweyn settlements in Kurtunwarey district. A VBIED advanced towards Golweyn but AMISOM soldiers fired towards the vehicle destroying it. Causalities not known. The second incident involved two VBIEDs approaching an base at Buulo-Marer. One VBIED managed to infiltrate the base and detonated. Afterwards, there was an exchange of small arms fire between AMISOM and al Shabaab. AMISOM troops repelled the attack. At least four AMISOM soldiers and 22 al Shabaab were killed. Ammunition was also confiscated by AMISOM troops. AMISOM claims 30 al Shabaab dead; a Somali official claims 66 dead; numbers widely varied. The most common figure in the days following the attack is 59.
01 April. Al Shabaab attacks a forward operating base in Mashalaay. Causality numbers not known.
01 April. Four are killed in a local militia clash over rights to a borehole at Rako Raaxo .

01 April. Somali National Police open fire on a vehicle trying to access airport road in Wadajir. The vehicle managed to escape the Police cordon and it is at present unclear whether this incident was criminality or al Shabaab related.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 01 April. Al Shabaab attacks an AMISOM base in Qoryooley, 6 al Shabaab attackers reported dead.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
source: Goobjoob; Local Source; Radio Risala; Shabelle Media Network
notes: 01 April. Al Shabaab fighters attacked two (possibly multiple) AMISOM bases at Buulo-Marer and Golweyn settlements in Kurtunwarey district. A VBIED advanced towards Golweyn but AMISOM soldiers fired towards the vehicle destroying it. Causalities not known. The second incident involved two VBIEDs approaching an base at Buulo-Marer. One VBIED managed to infiltrate the base and detonated. Afterwards, there was an exchange of small arms fire between AMISOM and al Shabaab. AMISOM troops repelled the attack. At least four AMISOM soldiers and 22 al Shabaab were killed. Ammunition was also confiscated by AMISOM troops. AMISOM claims 30 al Shabaab dead; a Somali official claims 66 dead; numbers widely varied. The most common figure in the days following the attack is 59.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 01 April. A low level attack was launched by al Shabaab on an AMISOM base in Beled Amin. Causalities not known.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: 01 April. An al Shabaab IED targets UPDF convoy. One truck destroyed. Casualty figures unknown.
01 April. A government soldier shot and killed a civilian at Deynile district. The soldier opened fire on a mini-bus parked in front of the force base nearby.
01 April. US aircraft target al Shabaab locations at Kamjaroon. Causalities not known.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 01 April. An RCIED targeting an AMISOM convoy at Tabeekaha. An AMISOM truck was destroyed. Casualties could not be ascertained at the time of reporting.
01 April. Al Shabaab fire 11 mortar rounds towards a forward operating base in Beled Aamin. No casualties reported.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: 01 April. Al Shabaab fire mortar rounds towards Shalambood. No casualties reported.

01 April. An unknown warplane (likely either US or Kenyan) conducted an airstrike against an al Shabaab target near Aboodin, 100 km north west of Kismayo. A civilian was injured and taken to Kismayo hospital for treatment. Additional casualties could not be ascertained at the time of reporting.

source: Local Source; Shabelle Media Network; Somali Memo
notes: 01 April. An airstrike was conducted against an al Shabaab base located south west of Ceel-Buur town. Additional reports indicated that 16 al Shabab fighters were killed. A second report claims US responsibility. The Somali Memo claims four civilians dead.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 01 April. Sporadic gunfire between Somaliland and Puntland forces in Tuko Raq. Causalities not known.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 01 April. Puntland forces conducted security operations against al Shabaab in Booj and Dhagax Dhaabuur areas of Galgala Mountains. Four al Shabaab fighters were killed.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 01 April. Al Shabaab conducts an attack against Jubaland forces at Gaduud. No causalities.

01 April. Al Shabaab shot and killed a woman near Cinema Abdi-Wayel neighbourhood in Heliwa district. The woman was reported to be part of the women council in the district and head of sanitation for Barwaqo ward.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
notes: 31 March. Armed clashes erupt between Djiboutian troops and al Shabaab fighters near Belet Weyne. Outcome unknown.

31 March. Al fighters attacked local security guards guarding a weigh station during the evening hours. There was an armed clash which lasted for few hours after which al Shabaab fighters retreated with casualties, specific number not known.
31 March. Al Shabaab hurled a hand grenade at a police check point in Yaqshid district. The forces opened fire towards suspected directions of the attack. There were no reports of casualties.
31 March. Government forces clash over a land dispute in Daynile. Causalities not known.
31 March. Two men, one of whom is a district official are shot and killed by al Shabaab in Xamar Weyne.

31 March. Armed perpetrators hailing from Ali Saleeban sub clan ambushed people hailing from Ugaarsaleeban sub clan while travelling in a vehicle in Dhuudo, c. 80 km south east of Bossaso. The motive of the incident was clan revenge. Five people from Ugaarsaleeban sub-clan were killed and two others were wounded.

31 March. Unidentified warplanes (likely either US or Kenyan) conducted an airstrike against al Shabaab targets near Garoomiste, 95 km west of Kismayo town. Four civilian pastoralists were injured and taken to Kismayo for medical treatment. Initial reports indicated that at least four dead al Shabaab.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 31 March. Al Shabaab fighters attacked Jubaland forces at Afmadow town. Both sides exchanged heavy gunfire. No causalities reported.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 31 March. Jubaland forces clash with another Jubaland soldier who attempted to hijack a civilian vehicle. The soldier targeted was injured.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 30 March. Al Shabaab attacks an AMISOM convoy in Jowhar. Causalities not known.

30 March. Al Shabaab launched an attack against an SNA position in the village of Lafoole 6km southwest of Afgooye. Initial reports had suggested the position had been overrun, but SNAF have reportedly retained control of the position. Causalities not known.
30 March. Green-on-green fighting continues for a second day in Jowhar. Additional causalities not known.

30 March. A government soldier shot at a group of youth at Liido seashore in Abdulcaziz district. The soldier attempted to disperse several young people near a boat. One civilian male bystander was killed. The soldier was apprehended by the security forces.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
notes: 30 March. The body guards of a customs officer and armed men hailing from Warsangeli sub-clan exchanged gunfire at Kala Dhacda area, 71 km north west of Qardho, due to taxation on khat. One body guard was killed.
29 March. Al Shabaab gunmen shot and killed a senior military officer in Yaaqshiid. Two are reported dead in a source published two days after.
29 March. Al Shabaab fighters ambushed two SNA officers in Heliwa district. There was an exchange of gunfire. One SNA officer was killed and one al Shabaab fighter was wounded.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
notes: 29 March. Al Shabaab ambushed an AMISOM-BNDF convoy travelling from Mahaday to Cali Fooldhere settlement in Mahaday district. There was an exchange of heavy gunfire. Casualties not known. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

29 March. A group of armed men carjacked a vehicle of a religious leader in Garowe. The incident took place when the group of armed men and the guards of the religious leader exchanged sporadic gunfire. There were no reports of casualties. Both parties hail from Leelkase clan. The motive of the incident was unknown.
29 March. Infighting among security forces results in one dead. The motive for the clash is not known.
29 March. Al Shabaab fighters attack SNAF checkpoint in Balcad. Assailants repelled, casualties unknown.
29 March. An al Shabaab IED emplaced near a security force checkpoint kills one civilian and injures two soldiers in Heliwa.
29 March. A road side bomb detonates along the road in Deynile District. Two donkeys were reportedly killed in the explosion. No human fatality was reported. The intended target not known.
29 March. Two Oromo men were shot and wounded by unspecified perpetrators in two different locations of Bossaso. The motive was not clear.

28 March. Al Shabaab attacked government troops position at the Livestock Market, Heliwa District. The two groups engaged in a gun fire that had continued for approx. 30 minutes. Al Shabaab attackers were eventually forced to withdraw. One civilian was reportedly killed during the clashes.
28 March. Madobe militia clashes with al Shabaab in Bulogudud and Qam Qam. Causalities not known.
28 March. Al Shabaab shot and killed a government soldier in Dhagahtur. Police forces deployed to the scene, and reportedly arrested several suspects.
28 March. Madobe militia clashes with al Shabaab in Bulogudud and Qam Qam. Causalities not known.

assoc_actor_2: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent
notes: 28 March. An IED reportedly fitted to a ICRC national staff auto detonated in Wadajir District. One Red Cross staff member subsequently died, while the other two were slightly injured. No group has claimed responsibility for this attack.
28 March. Three are injured and one dead after a car bomb explodes near International Committee of the Red Cross in Mogadishu. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.
27 March. Unidentified men hurled a hand grenade to a police forces position in Wadajir District. One police officer was reportedly killed in the explosion. The assailants escaped.
27 March. Al Shabaab claims through their media sources that they overran a military convoy at Galhamar, near Belet Weyne, and killed 27 soldiers. Independent verification not known.
27 March. At least three people killed and 4 others wounded in heavy clashes between Somali government forces and Al Shabaab militants in Goof Guduud.
27 March. Two Government soldiers reportedly engaged in an exchange of gunfire in Deynile District. Reports stated that the soldiers have had land disputes in the area. Causalities not known.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 27 March. One under vehicle IED, allegedly fitted on Yaqshid District NISA commander's vehicle detonated. The officer survived the blast as he was not in the vehicle at the time of the incident. No group has claimed the responsibility for the explosion.

27 March. A road side bomb exploded at KM13 neighbourhood, Deynile District. The blast missed its target, believed to be an military vehicle. The forces reacted by opening fire in different directions. No casualties were reported. No claim was made in connection with the attack.

27 March. A Remote controlled RCIED exploded at Yabaryaale, 35kms SE of Beletweyne town. Nine soldiers sustained injuries and the front part of the vehicle was damaged. Al Shabaab fighters claimed the responsibility.

27 March. Unknown assailants gunned down a MP from South West state in Shibis District. The name of the victim identified as Ruqia Abshir Nur was attacked by the armed attackers while she was sitting outside of her home. Al Shabaab was later identified as the perpetrator.

26 March. Two land mine explosions occur in Mogadishu. The first occurred in Daynile, killing two. The second occurred along Industrial road (district not reported), causing injuries. Al Shabaab claimed five dead.
26 March. A security forces operation results in three government forces KIA in Baidoa. Despite the loss of life, government forces claim the operation was a success.
26 March. Al Shabaab fighters fire several mortar rounds towards a military base at Hosingow, followed by probing attack. No casualties reported, assailants repelled.
26 March. Al Shabaab fighters attack SNAF checkpoint near Afgooye. Casualties unknown.
26 March. Al Shabaab shot and killed one person and another was wounded in the milk market of Bosasso. The deceased was later revealed to be an intelligence officer. The Attacker escaped the scene.

source: Local Source; Shabelle Media Network; Somali Memo
notes: 26 March. Two land mine explosions occur in Mogadishu. The first occurred in Daynile, killing two. The second occurred along Industrial road (district not reported), causing injuries. Al Shabaab claimed five dead.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
notes: 26 March. An unidentified armed man attacked an INGO office and fired several rounds at the SPU guard post. The on-duty police officer responded and wounded the attacker. The perpetrator transferred to hospital. Police are investigating the case.
25 March. Al Shabaab launches an attack on security forces in Belet Weyne. Causalities not known.
25 March. Two groups of Government forces engaged in an exchange of gunfire for unknown reasons in Dharkenley District. One soldier killed and another one injured.

25 March. A VBIED suicide bomber detonates near a security checkpoint that sits at the entrance of Parliament building. The car had been stopped prior to its detonation. VOA report 6 dead, including three civilians.
25 March. Suspected al Shabaab shot and killed an elder and electoral college delegate at Bakara junction during the evening hours.
24 March. Two women are wounded after al Shabaab militants threw a grenade at a local police station. It is not known if the target of the attack was the police station or the civilians.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
notes: 24 March. Armed clashes erupt between al Shabaab and Djiboutian forces near Belet Weyne. Resulting casualty figures are unknown.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 24 or 25 March. Government and AMISOM forces launched an offensive against al Shabaab hideouts in North and East of the region. The forces clashed at Hees area. Six al Shabaab fighters killed and two soldiers injured. One of the killed al Shabaab members is reportedly Ali Ahmed Gure, the head of al Shabaab Zakawat in North and East of Hiraan region.

24 March. KDF attempts to continue building the security fence on the Somali Kenya boarder meets resistance from locals who claim the fence is annexing parts of Somalia. There were reported injuries between locals and KDF forces erecting the border.

24 March. Unknown attackers reportedly hurled a hand grenade to the district headquarters but it landed in front of a residential house opposite of the targeted location. Security forces opened fire to different directions. One person injured by the shooting and two female bystanders wounded as result of the explosion. There was a grenade attack against a police station elsewhere in the area.
24 March. Clan militiamen reportedly shot and killed two men hailing from Biyo-Maal in Muuri Settlement, Afgoye District. The perpetrators allegedly from Abgal sub clan of Hawiye fled from the scene.

23 March. Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a vehicle transporting Mira khat plants near Moodi Moodi village. Both sides briefly exchanged fire and al Shabaab fighters retreated from the area. One al Shabaab fighter and another armed man (unknown militia) escorting the vehicle killed during the clash.

23 March. Two groups armed with machetes and sticks from Essa-Muse (Reer-Wacays and Reer-Cadaawe) sub clans clashed near Laso Dawaco village over a land dispute. Police arrested around 40 people from both clans reportedly. Causalities not known.
22 March. Somali policeman assassinated by al Shabaab in Afgooye, assailants escaped.
22 March. Three men were shot and killed in Badbabo IDP camp, details remain limited.
22 March. A government soldier shot and injured three civilians in a house at Xaawo Taako village in Balcad District. The motive behind the attack is not known.
22 March. Unidentified assailants spray acid towards group of civilians cleaning the road. Three injured.
22 March. Nine civilians were admitted to hospital after inhaling a noxious gas that was released from a passing vehicle. At present it is unclear if the incident was intentional.
22 March. A Radio Controlled Vehicle Borne Improvised Explosive Device detonates outside the Wehliye hotel in Hawl Wadaag. At least 17 killed.

21 March. Al Shabaab attacked a government security checkpoints at Buundo-Yarey village in Afgoye district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about half an hour after which al Shabaab withdrew. Fatalities could not be established at the time of reporting.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 21 March. NISA and SNA clashed near Tarabunka Junction in Hodan district. Two civilian bystanders and two NISA soldiers killed and at least four other civilians wounded. The reason for the clash is not known.

21 March. SNA forces attacked an al Shabaab base located at Shangulow (Shaatilow) village. Four al Shabaab fighters killed and several others injured reportedly. The troops returned to Baardheere town.

21 March. KDF troops conducted an attack against al Shabaab fighters at Wardenle village, 30 km north of Cel Waaq. A warplane (unknown origin, however Kenya operates aircraft in this region) launched an airstrike targeting al Shabaab fighters followed by a KDF infantry troop attack. Casualties from al Shabaab fighters have not been confirmed at the time of reporting.
21 March. Al Shabaab launch a sustained attack against Kaxda in Dharkenley. Causalities not known.
21 March. SNAF forces launch operation against al Shabaab camp in Habal Been. Four al Shabaab killed.
21 March. One child died and 13 others wounded after an explosive detonated in Gaalkacyo. Initial reports indicated that the explosion occurred in front of Quranic School.

21 March. Unidentified armed men ambushed a minibus carrying passenger travelling near Laanta-Buuro settlement in Afgoye district. Four passengers were killed and the driver of the vehicle abducted. Motive of the incident is likely to be a clan retaliation.
21 March. Al Shabaab shoots and kills a tax collector in Afgooye.
21 March. Al Shabaab assassinated a tax collector in Heliwa market.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
notes: 21 March. Al Shabaab fighters fired two mortar shells towards Darawish Base at Afurur. The mortar landed on vacant place. There is no immediate report of possible damages.
20 March. Government forces, supported by 'anti-al Shabaab helicopters' conducted an operation against al Shabaab at Busley. Exchange of gunfire reported - causalities not known.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 20 March. SNA and AMISOM forces conducted an operation against al Shabaab positions outside Buulogudud village at Singaler/Wirkoy and Sabcasharaf areas. The forces clashed with al Shabaab. After a brief exchange of gunfire, al Shabaab fighters retreated. No reports of possible casualties.
