20 March. Al Shabaab shot and killed a soldier in Dharkenley.
20 March. Unidentified gunman assassinate civilian in Bariga. Assailant arrested, motives unknown.
20 March. Unidentified clan militia killed a civilian in Muuri. The motive behind the killing reported to be clan feuds.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: 20 March. SNA/AMISOM patrol hit by IED in Yoontoy Yarey. Casualties not known.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 20 March. US and Jubaland forces raid an al Shabaab hideout near Buur Koy. Details limited. No causalities reported.
19 March. Suspected al Shabaab shoot and kill a soldier and civilian in Yaaqshiid.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: 19 March. Al Shabaab launched an attack against AMISOM and government forces in Buurdhuubo. A second source states 5 al Shabaab dead. Shabelle Media Network reports they al Shabaab overtook the town, but vacated on their own accord later in the day.
19 March. A US airstrike against al Shabaab in Mubaarak. Two reported dead, three injured.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: 18 March. An al Shabaab roadside IED detonates against an ENDF convoy killing five soldiers. Al Shabaab claims 10 dead. The convoy was travelling outside of Luuq.
18 March. An SNA officer is shot and killed by unknown gunmen in Dharkenley.
18 March. Security forces open fire and kill three civilians. The reason for the attack is not known. Hundreds of youths were also detained in the security operation.
18 March. A civilian is shot and killed by an unidentified perpetrator with an AK47.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: 17 March. Armed clashes continue at Maxaas between AMISOM and AS. Additional causalities not known.
17 March. Three mortar shells were fired by al Shabaab towards Baraawe city. There were no reports of human fatalities.

17 March. Armed militias from Warsangeli sub-clan exchanged gunfire with body guards of the Governor of Bari at Ceeldahir area, 95 km south of Bossaso). One militiaman was wounded and eight other militias were arrested.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 17 March. Al Shabaab ambush an AMISOM convoy in Yurkud. The attack was initiated by an IED. Causalities not known.
17 March. A roadside IED strikes a Somali Army vehicle. Casualities reported; numbers not known.
17 March. US aircraft conduct airstrike against al Shabaab positions in the Galgala. Outcome not known.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: 17 March. Al Shabaab launched an attack on a KDF position with heavy mortars. Casualty figures are unknown.
17 March. A soldier shot and killed a civilian man and injured three others after he opened fire in Jowhar town. The soldier attempted to extort money from a rickshaw driver.
17 March. Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a local elder in Hodan on 17/03. The assailants escaped the scene.
17 March. Al Shabaab assailants shot and killed a traditional elder in Hodan district.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 17 March. Puntland forces claim kill 18 al Shabaab during a security operation in the Cal Madow Mountains.
16 March. Armed clashes erupt between armed civilians, SNAF and al Shabaab. Civilians resisted al Shabaab taxation. Causalities not known.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-); Unidentified Armed Group (Somalia); Pastoralists (Somalia)
source: Local Source; Shabelle Media Network; Somali Memo
notes: 16 March. Al Shabaab clashed with ENDF and Somali government forces in Bulale area near Maxaas. The fight started between Herders and Al Shabaab as Al Shabaab tried to put taxes on the Herders. The government reported 32 al Shabaab dead following the gunfight.
16 March. Two local unidentified clan militia groups clashed at Tagaabeeye village, near Dhuasamareb. Three people were killed. The incident was reported to be clan revenge between the two clans.
16 March. After the attempted assassination of a man from Siwakhron clan in Bargaal area, the perpetrators exchange fire with police. It is not known the extent of the Siwakhron man's wounds.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 14-16 March. Puntland security forces conducted security operations from 14-16 March against al Shabaab hideouts at Dhagaxbuur, Karin, Xagarood, Didigle and Madarshood of Almadow Mountains (c. 27-54 km south west of Bossaso). 23 al Shabaab fighters were killed across the varied locations.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
notes: 16 March. After the attempted assassination of a man from Siwakhron clan in Bargaal area, the perpetrators exchange fire with police. It is not known the extent of the Siwakhron man's wounds.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
notes: 16 March. An IED was remotely detonated by al Shabaab near the Bossaso port. One police officer and a civilian were killed and five other police officers were wounded.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 15 March. An IED, targeting an AMISOM convoy exploded near Arbacow settlement. One AMISOM truck was damaged and two AMISOM soldiers were injured. Perpetrators not named by the source.

04 November. 101 cases of rape were recorded in Somaliland between January and November 2018 (coded as one event per month); 105 individuals were accused of rape out of which 87 were arrested and charged.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: 15 March. An IED strike followed by an Ambush on an AMISOM convoy has resulted in one vehicle being immobilised and several Ugandan AMISOM soldiers wounded.
15 March. KDF helicopters raid al Shabaab positions near Ceel Waaq, claim 8 killed, no confirmation.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
notes: 15 March. Al Shabaab attacks and kills a police officer, as well as two civilians, in a grenade attack on a checkpoint in Bossaso city (Bari). Several other injuries were reported.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 15 March. Suspected al Shabaab operatives hurl a hand grenade towards Higlo Checkpoint. Two civilians and a Puntland security official injured. Assailants escaped.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
notes: 15 March. Two people were injured after Galmudug security forces clashed with local armed militia at Badiradley town (c. 70 km of South Galkayo). The incident occurred after the militia established an illegal checkpoint.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 15 March. Jubaland forces capture al Shabaab camp in Buur Koy, kill seven militants.
14 March. Four al Shabaab were killed in fighting with local militia.
14 March. People from Warsangeli blocked a road in protest of police burning a supply of khat. The road block was at Ceeldahir, 95km south of Bossaso.
14 March. Al Shabaab attacked a checkpoint at Calamada in Afgoye district. At least two soldiers were injured in the attack.
14 March. Al Shabaab attacked government soldiers in Bulo Mareer. Two deaths reported.
14 March. Suspected al Shabaab shot and killed a soldier in Wadajir District. The assailants stole the gun of the deceased soldier and escaped.
14 March. Al Shabaab claims an explosive targeting Kenyan forces in Ceel Waaq killed two. Kenya military command conducted an air strike in the area either before or after the incident.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 14-16 March. Puntland security forces conducted security operations from 14-16 March against al Shabaab hideouts at Dhagaxbuur, Karin, Xagarood, Didigle and Madarshood of Almadow Mountains (c. 27-54 km south west of Bossaso). 23 al Shabaab fighters were killed across the varied locations.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 14 March. Al Shabaab have shot and killed three Puntland soldiers in Bosasso.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 14 March. Two Puntland forces are killed attempting to disarm a IED they had discovered. Perpetrators not known.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 14 March. A roadside IED targets Puntland forces, two dead. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 14 March. Seven al Shabaab killed after launching an attack on Jubbaland Forces in Wurkoy, Kismayo.
13 March. Government forces attack an al Shabaab location causing them to retreat. Five soldiers dead, three wounded. Status of al Shabaab not known.
13 March. Green-on-green violence in Bulo Burto. Motive not known. One dead.

13 March. An explosive drone (likely US) strikes an al Shabaab position during the overnight hours. Causalities could not known at the time of reporting. The Shabelle Media Network claims the strike occurred 12/03 and hit a civilian truck.
13 March. Al Shabaab fighters attack a government base in Embresso from different directions. Assailants repelled, casualties unknown.
13 March. Two groups of al Shabaab fighters clash in Madarshon after one of the groups attempted to flee their base. Three dead, two wounded.
13 March. 12 government soldiers are dead following an encounter with al Shabaab.
13 March. SNA forces launch an attack on an al Shabaab position at Dudumaale, 24km east of Xudur. Causalities not known.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 13 March. Al Shabaab launches an attack against AMISOM forces near Qansahdhere. Causalities not known.
13 March. Al Shabaab ambushed a group of KDF forces outside on Ceel Waaq. The ensuing clash lasted for several hours. Several vehicles were destroyed. Causalities not known.
13 March. Al Shabaab attacked a soldier and a civilian in Janta Noobe area of Qoryooley. The soldier was KIA while two civilians were injured.
13 March. 13 are injured during a clash between Gaaljecel and Majeerteen groups over rights to a rock excavation site in Qandal.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
notes: 13 March. A police officer and civilian are dead following an al Shabaab attack in Bosasso.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 13 March. Jubaland forces attack an al Shabaab position at Buur Koy. One Jubaland soldier is reported wounded. A second report claims the death of four al Shabaab.
12 March. Unrest reported in Burao at the food distribution site. Several injuries reported.
12 March. Two unidentified militia were killed and 20 arrested following a clash with security forces in Cadaado. The reason for the clash is not known.
12 March. Unidentified armed group tossed a hand grenade at a group of soldiers in Qansax Dheere. One death reported.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 12 March. Al Shabaab attacks a AMISOM positon in Golweyn. A civilian was injured by a stray bullet. Al Shabaab retreated.
12 March. A military patrol was attacked by al Shabaab. One soldier dead and several others wounded.

12 March. Government forces attack a al Shabaab position in Mareer Dheer, Kurtunwaarey district. The forces killed seven al Shabaab members, including the son (Hassan Ahmed Diriye)of a commander. In a conflicting report, a second source claims the event occurred on 10/03 and claimed 6 lives.
12 March. Al Shabaab elements targeted government forces with a hand grenade at the main market in Qoryooley. The soldiers opened fire in the direction of the attack. No reported causalities.
12 March. Two groups of police officers clash in Mahahay. The incident occurred after one group wanted to arrest the deputy commissioner. Two police dead.
12 March. Security forces kill a suspected al Shabaab members during a security sweep of Dharkenley.
12 March. Al Shabaab fighters attack SNAF position at Maryaan Gubaay. Three hours fighting before al Shabaab withdrew. Casualty figures unknown.
12 March. A government soldier is shot and killed by al Shabaab.
12 March. A US strike targets al Shabaab checkpoint between Kamsuuma and Buur Koy. Casualties unknown.
12 March. Security forces open fire against the Auditor General's car after the vehicle failed to stop at a security force checkpoint. Any possible causalities unreported.
12 March. An SNA soldier opened fire on a UN vehicle, reasons not known. No injuries.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: 12 March. An RCIED targeted an AMISOM-ENDF convoy in Aawdiinle. The blast struck the truck, though only caused minor damage.
11 March. Youths stoned the offices and vehicle of an INGO in Hargeysa. The automotive was reportedly damaged. The reason for the unrest is not known.
11 March. Two groups of government forces exchanged fire in Belet Weyne. One soldier was critically injured. The motive of the exchange is not known.
11 March, noon. Al Shabaab killed a soldier and two civilians in Yaaqshiid. Another soldier killed several hours later.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 11 March. Al Shabaab shot and killed a NISA government soldier during a clash in Kahda district on 11/03. The attack led to a second clash four hours later.
11 March. Al Shabaab conducted an attack against a government military base in Garbahaarey. Injuries reported. A second source claims the attack took place on 12/03.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: 11 March. Al Shabaab launch an attack against an Ethiopian AMISOM troop position in Baardheere. Causalities not known.

11 March. A civilian man who hailed from Habargedir clan was shot and killed by Hawadle militia in Waradhuumaleh, near Mahas district. The attack is believed to be a revenge attack of an ongoing land dispute.
11 March. A man hailing from Ali Saleeban is killed by unknown actors in Qoton, near Bandarbeyla.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 11 March. An IED strike destroying an AMISOM vehicle between Baidoa and Burhakaba results in one AMISOM soldier dead and one wounded.
10 March. Al Shabaab and government forces clash in Gamboole, as al Shabaab controlled city. Somalia forces were able to gain control of the area. Causalities not known.
10 March. Six government soldiers are dead following an IED blast in the K13 area. A second source claims 8 dead.
10 March. A road-side IED strikes a military vehicle in Daynile. Two soldiers dead.
10 March. Al Shabaab and south-west state forces clash in Ugaari. Five al Shabaab and one military officer dead.
10 March. Two US soldiers dead and five wounded in a case of misidentification with Somali forces.
10 March. A land-based clash in Garowe reported. Two members of Omar Mahmud dead, two from Isa Mohamud wounded.
10 March. Al Shabaab and government forces clash outside of Afgooye. Gunfire lasted 30 minutes. Causalities not known at the time of reporting.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)

10 March. An Oroma civilian is kidnapped by unidentified perpetrators in Lanta Hawada. Motive not known.
09 March. An al Shabaab member threw a hard grenade at government forces in the Hawlwadag neighbourhood of Beletweyne. Three people, including two civilians were wounded in the blast.

c. 0200 hrs. SNA forces supported by clan militias - locally known as Macawisley - launched an attack against al Shabaab base in Moqokari village (c. 120 km south east of Beletweyne). al Shabaab retreated from the area and the local militias and SNA forces took control of Moqokori. Subsequently, SNA forces and the local militias withdrew from the village after receiving reports of al Shabaab reinforcement amassing near the village. No reports of casualties.
28th February, PM, Bardheere, Gedo: Suspected al Shabaab militants fire an undisclosed number of mortars at Bardheere airport. Causalities not known.

A hand grenade was hurled towards an SNA checkpoint near Ali Kamiin junction road in Wardhigley district. Soldiers reacted with gunfire towards the suspected direction of the attack. The attackers managed to escape. There were no reports of casualties. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

A hand grenade was hurled at an SNA base in Suuq Bacaad Market vicinity in Yaqshid district. Soldiers reacted with gunfire towards the general direction of the attack. One SNA soldier was injured. The attackers managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at a police check point at Black-sea road near MBC building in Hodan district. At least one officer and one civilian male bystander were injured. Soldiers reacted with gunfire towards suspected directions of the attack. The perpetrators managed to escape.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: Government forces, jointly with KDF, attack an al Shabaab position near Faafax Dhuun. At least 23 al Shabaab reported dead. A second report claims 25 dead.
Unidentified gunmen assassinate shopkeeper Omar Guelle at tea shop near Heliwa DC. Assailants escaped, motives unknown.
Unidentified gunmen open fire against vehicle transporting Somali team doing biometric registration of Puntland forces. Causalities not known.
28th February, PM, Hamar Weyne, Mogadishu: A local Rickshaw driver is shot and killed by a security force member.
Al Shabaab abducts two people, kills nine donkeys at Elboon, 15 kilometres west of Wajid. Radio Kulmiye claims one dead.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: PSF and al Shabaab fighters clashed at Balikhadar area of Galgala. There were no reports of immediate casualties and arrests.

BAY REGION (Area 12) Al Shabaab fighters reportedly attacked SNA position at Iska-Darki (c. 7kms N of Baidoa). Both sides briefly exchange fire and al Shabaab fighters retreated from the area. No casualty was reported from the attack.

Two groups who hailed from Omar Mohamud clan clashed near Taala'ad area (c. 15 km north of Galkayo) over a land dispute. There was an exchange of gunfire. Puntland police intervened and halted the fighting. Five people were injured. The injuries were taken to hospital. Authorities are investigating the incident.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed KDF forces at Gelgesha Abdi Kheer village between Faxfaxdhuun and Giriley (c. 20 km south of Giriley village). AMISOM forces were headed to Faxfaxdhuun base at the time of the attack. Exchange of heavy gunfire lasted for a few hours. Additional SNA troops, led by Faxfaxdhuun district commissioner, were deployed to the location of the incident. Later, Kenyan fighter jet, supported by ground troops were deployed. Three KDF troops were killed and the Faxfaxdhuun district commissioner sustained minor injuries. Number of al Shabaab causalities is not confirmed.

Al Shabaab assailants shot and killed a military court staff member at Tabeelaha Weydow in Dayniile District. The incident occurred shortly after the victim stepped out of a restaurant. The perpetrators managed to escape. al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the killing.
Al Shabaab fighters abduct several Somali doctors, possibly working for a local NGO. Assailants escaped, motives unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an SNA convoy headed from Afgoye to Baledogle at Waraboole village located at the outskirts of Afgoye district. SNA responded and al Shabaab attackers were forced to withdraw. Casualties could not be ascertained at the time of reporting. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: AMISOM/SNA troops clashed with a group of suspected al Shabaab fighters at Embareeso village (c. 05 km north of Afgoye district). Exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 30 minutes after which the suspected al Shabaab members withdrew. Casualties could not be confirmed at the time of reporting.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: Armed clashes oppose AMISOM/SNAF and al Shabaab near Embresso airfield. Initiator unknown. Al Shabaab withdrew after 30min long firefight. Resulting casualties unknown.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: KDF conducts route clearance operation between Dhobley and Afmadow, claims four militants killed.

Unidentified men hurled a hand grenade at the residence of Qansax-Dheere Deputy District Commissioner in Qansax-Dheere town (c. 90 km south west of Baidoa). Three people were injured. No arrest report.

US air forces conducted an airstrike against suspected al Shabaab targets in Jilib town (c. 105 km north east of Kismayo). The warplanes targeted an al Shabaab central base in the town and an al Shabaab checkpoint near Gududayda neighbourhood located north east of Jilib town. Initial reports indicate that the checkpoint was destroyed. Two al Shabaab dead, one wounded.

The driver of the District Commissioner of Kahda was shot and killed by one of his bodyguard at Ex-Control Afgoye vicinity in Dharkenley district. The district police attended to the scene after the incident and apprehended the suspect. The motive for the incident was reported to be verbal dispute.

Two armed men, believed to be al Shabaab militants, shot and killed a famous elder at Sarkuusta area in Dayniile district. The victim was a member of the defunct Somali Electoral College who elected the Members of Parliament from South West Regional Administration. The perpetrators managed to escape the scene.

IS shot and killed a 70-year-old clan elder at Hawo-Tako vicinity in Afgoye district. The victim was reported to be in front of his home after evening prayers when he was attacked by two armed assailants. Government soldiers conducted a security search operation but no confirmed arrest report.
Hodan, Mogadishu: A SNA soldier shoots and kills the driver for the district commissioner of Dayniile. The reasons for the attack are not known.

An unidentified armed man shot and killed a civilian man who hailed from Omar Mohamud clan at Garsoor neighbourhood in Northern Galkayo. The motive of the incident was unknown. The perpetrator escaped from the area.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force

25 Feb, c. 0945 hrs. A magnetic IED attached to a private vehicle detonated near Macalin Nuur village in Dharkenley district. The vehicle was destroyed and two people, who travelling in the vehicle, were injured and taken to the Madina Hospital for treatment. The motive of the incident was unknown.

Three suspected armed men shot and killed an SNA soldier at the Gaheyr vicinity in Hodan district. The perpetrators managed to escape. The district police attended to the scene but there were no reports of arrests made. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an KDFconvoy at a grazing area near Sheebow village (c. 18 km south east of Ceel Waaq town). The ambush was initiated by an IED that targeted the convoy followed by heavy armed clash that lasted for hours. Subsequently, al Shabaab withdrew after warplanes (not identified) reportedly arrived at the location of the incident. There were no reports of casualties.

. An SNA soldier shot and killed a driver of a rickshaw at the milk factory in Hodan district. The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene. The motive of the incident was not ascertained. The family of victim sought for justice from the government.

Sustained air strikes have been targeting areas in Lower and Middle Jubba regions in "recent days" (source dated 25/02). Affected areas include Jilib, Bu'ale, and Berhani. Several bases destroyed, 20 al Shabaab dead. (3 dead accounted for in Jilib on 19/02.)

Sustained air strikes have been targeting areas in Lower and Middle Jubba regions in "recent days" (source dated 25/02). Affected areas include Jilib, Bu'ale, and Berhani. Several bases destroyed, 20 al Shabaab dead. (3 dead accounted for in Jilib on 19/02.)

. Al Shabaab element hurled two hand grenades at the District Commissioner Office neighbourhood in Yaqshid district. Two SNA soldiers were injured. The perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack

Casualties from al Shabaab could not be confirmed at the time of reporting.

Two al Shabaab elements shot and killed a government municipal police officer who was collecting tax revenue near Ex. Daalo Airline vicinity in Howlwadag district. The perpetrators took the pistol of the victim and managed to escape. The district police attended to the scene but there were no reports of arrests. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

An RCIED, targeting an SNA vehicle, exploded as the vehicle passed near Biya Degeenka area in Heliwa district. There was a brief exchange of gunfire that lasted for about 10 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. The vehicle was damaged but there were no reports of casualties.

hrs. Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack on an SNA checkpoint at Captain Las vicinity (c. 12 km north west of Merka district). SNA responded and al Shabaab attackers were forced to withdraw. Casualties could not be ascertained at the time of reporting.

ISIS and locals clashed at Dacar area (c. 98 km south east of Qandala). The clash lasted for about 15 minutes after which ISIS fighters retreated back to the mountain. There were no reports of arrests.

24 Feb, c. 1147 hrs. An RCIED targeting an SNA convoy from Afgoye to Baledogle town, exploded at the outskirt of Tixsiille village under Afgoye district. The device exploded damaging the SNA lead battlewagon. At least two SNA soldiers were injured. The perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack. The Somali Memo claimed three soldiers dead.

24 Feb, c. 1030 hrs. An armed SNA soldier using an AK47 shot and killed a civilian auto-mechanic riding his motorcycle at Mukayga SNA checkpoint vicinity in Afgoye district. The victim was headed to town when a soldier who was at the checkpoint ordered for payment but the victim refused. The victim was shot as a result. The perpetrators managed to escape.

Galmudug security forces conducted a security operation to remove illegal checkpoint established by Sa'ad armed clan militias at Ceel-akhwaan village (c. 12 km south of Galkayo from the main road that links South Galkayo to Cadado). Two Galmudug soldiers were injured and four armed militiamen were arrested during the operation. The incident occurred after Galmudug security forces exchanged gun fire with some armed militiamen at the checkpoint.

Two blasts occur in Mogadishu on the evening of 23/02. The first blast, apparently caused by a suicide car bomber, occurred near Somalia's intelligence headquarters. At least 18 people, including government soldiers and civilian bystanders, were killed while more than 20 others, mostly civilians, were injured. AS claimed responsibility for the attack. The second blast near Villa Somalia totalled 30 dead.
SNAF forces raid and destroy al Shabaab camp near Jungal. At least two militants killed.

23 Feb, c. 0600 hrs. Somali government forces clashed with al Shabaab militants at their base in Aybutry village. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for hours. There were an unspecified number of casualties. Government forces overtake the village.

23 February 2018: Somali troops clashed with Al-Qaeda linked group, Al Shabab. The clash started when Somali military forces launched ambush attack against Al Shabaab near Awdhegle district. There was hours-long combat between them that caused an unidentified number of casualties.
Team of al Shabaab gunmen aboard a vehicle assault security forces after colliding with SNPF car.

Two blasts occur in Mogadishu on the evening of 23/02. The first blast, apparently caused by a suicide car bomber, occurred near Somalia's intelligence headquarters. A gunfight with security forces followed. 25 dead in the second blast, plus 5 al Shabaab attackers.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 20 Feb, c. 1120 hrs. Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM convoy traveling on the road between Ceel Waregow and Shalambood near Ceel Waregow village (c. 07 km north east of Merka district). There was an exchange of gunfire. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack stating that they targeted an AMISOM convoy transporting military supplies to Shalambood. Causalities not known.

A civilian man was killed by another over land ownership dispute. The two men hail from Issa Mohamud Hassan Ugaar sub clan. The two men argued which escalated to an altercation with one being shot and later succumbing to his wounds at hospital. The attack took place at an unknown location in Nugaal.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 20 Feb, c. 1400 hrs. PSF and al Shabaab fighters clashed at Ceeldibir and Dhadhaabo areas of Galgala (c. 49 km south west of Bossaso). The clash lasted for almost two hours. Three al Shabaab fighters were killed and two others were arrested. Fatalities split between events.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 20 Feb, c. 1400 hrs. PSF and al Shabaab fighters clashed at Ceeldibir and Dhadhaabo areas of Galgala (c. 49 km south west of Bossaso). The clash lasted for almost two hours. Three al Shabaab fighters were killed and two others were arrested. Fatalities split between events.
19th February, Jilib, Middle Jubba: U.S. Africa Command carried out a drone strike resulting in three militant deaths.
Al Shabaab fighters attack SNAF position near Qoryoley. Assailants repelled, at least two militants killed.

19 Feb, c. 0520 hrs. Two groups of Osman Mohamud and Wabeeneeye sub-clans clashed at Jidka Sodonka area (c. 02 km south west of Bossaso airport) due to a land dispute. The clash lasted for about 10 minutes. Police intervened. One person was wounded. Two others were arrested.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: 19th February, PM, IVO Bulo Gaduud, Kismayo Lower Jubba: A roadside IED disables an AMISOM convoy vehicle prior to an al Shabaab ambush at Yoontoy and Bulo Gaduud. Causalities not known in both instances.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: 19th February, PM, IVO Bulo Gaduud, Kismayo Lower Jubba: A roadside IED disables an AMISOM convoy vehicle prior to an al Shabaab ambush at Yoontoy and Bulo Gaduud. Causalities not known in both instances.

19 Feb. Unarmed SLP officers in Xariirad were physically assaulted by three men using sticks. The perpetrators escaped from the scene. The police officers were taken to Xariirad Hospital for further treatment.
Al Shabaab court sentenced a man to one hundred lashes after being accused of raping a civilian female. The court ordered that the punishment be performed at a public gathering in Jilib town.
IED detonates near civilians between Bundabaq - Embresso, near Baraawe. At least two killed.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: Jubaland forces, supported by anti-al Shabaab forces (identified as US in a second report), conducted a joint security operation against al Shabaab location at Araara village (c. 47 km north east of Kismayo). The joint forces briefly took control of the village without resistance from al Shabaab and subsequently withdrew from the area. During the operation an al Shabaab fighter who was in the village was killed and a civilian female was injured by a stray bullet.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: During an operation by Jubaland forces and anti-al Shabaab forces against an al Shabaab location at Araara village (c. 47 km north east of Kismayo), an IED exploded as the joint forces made their way back to Bulo Gaduud base. The casualty from the IED attack was unknown - al Shabaab's media claimed the death of a US soldier.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 18th February, AM, near Baraawe, Lower Shabelle: Unconfirmed reports have stated that joint SNA and AMISOM troops have carried out an offensive on al Shabaab locations around Baraawe. Causalities not known.
AMISOM & SNAF conduct large security sweep. Two al Shabaab killed, 21 mobile phones seized, 2 RPGs and 5 pistols.
Danab and US forces conduct a raid on Jilib. Ground forces supported by air elements. One al Shabaab camp destroyed. Casualties and exact outcome unknown.

A civilian man, who hailed from Omar Mohamoud sub clan of Reer Mahad, was killed by another man, hailing from Omar Mohamoud sub clan of Reer Hirsi, over a land dispute in Burtinle. The perpetrator escaped from the scene after the incident. Police were reported to be continuing enquiries into the incident.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 18 Feb, c. 0700 hrs: Somaliland and Puntland forces exchanged fire for about 30 minutes at the frontline near Tukaraq (c. 65 km north west of Garowe). There were no reports of casualties.

Hargeisa local government, supported by SLP in Hargeisa conducted an operation in where they destroyed illegal shops constructed on the main street in Jijiga yar neighbourhood. The owners of the shops resisted and police finally dispersed them. Three people were arrested.

Suspected al Shabaab militants attacked a SNAF defensive base at Embareeso vicinity (c. 05 km north of Barawe district). There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab forcefully withdrew. There were no reports of casualties.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of United Arab Emirates
notes: 17th February, AM, Buq-caqable, Bulo Burto, Hiiraan: Al Shabaab publically execute a captured SNA soldier.

Al Shabaab fighters fired around eight rounds of anti-aircraft artillery in the air targeting suspected anti-al Shabaab helicopters (not identified, however it is known US forces were active in the area two days later) that were observed flying over Jilib town. The helicopters did not respond to the attack.

17 Feb, c. 1130 hrs. Al Shabaab fighters executed a civilian at a public place in Buqda village (c. 45 km south west of Beletweyne). The victim was a former SNA who was traveling to Abudwaq district. The motive behind the execution was unknown.
Civilian vehicle hit by roadside IED near Ababay. 3 killed 5 injured.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against Jubaland forces based at Abdalla Biroole village (c. 45 km south west of Kismayo town). There was a brief exchange of small arms fire after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. There were no reports of casualties.

Rival government forces clash in Afgooye. The heavy fighting took place at a checkpoint manned by government forces in Bar-ismail neighbourhood. It is not clear what triggered the fighting, but the checkpoint was used by government forces to collect taxes from travellers using the Afgoye-Mogadishu road. Causalities not known.

Al Shabaab fighters shot and killed a local civilian during an operation at Buulo Xaaji Village (c. 69 km west of Kismaayo town). Al Shabaab shot the victim after he attempted to escape during the al Shabaab operation on the village streets.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 16th February, PM, Galgala Mountains, Bosasso, Bari: Two Puntland Security Force (PSF) officer were killed in roadside IED strike. Perpetrators not named by source.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: At least two Puntland soldiers were killed in a roadside bomb blast in Galgala Mountains of Bari region. Al Shabaab said in a statement posted on its affiliated website that the soldiers died after the roadside bomb struck the military vehicle on the outskirts of the Galgala Mountains.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: Detonation: 15/02, 1850L, Waaberi: A UVIED fitted to a NISA officer's car detonates, no casualties reported. Perpetrators not named by the source.
Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate SNAF soldier near Bar Ubaax junction. Assailants escaped.

SNA soldiers, escorting the Deputy District Commissioner of Dharkenley, shot and killed a municipal police officer at the DC office area in Dharkenley district. The incident occurred after an argument over unknown reasons. The perpetrators managed to escape. There were no reports of arrests made.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: Unidentified men hurled a hand grenade at the Former Presidential Palace in Isha neighbourhood of Baidoa. This facility was reported to be used by NISA as a temporary detention centre for captured al Shabaab fighters. The hand grenade landed and exploded at the perimeter of the facility. There were no reports of casualties. NISA forces at the facility responded with brief sporadic gunfire. The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene.

04 November. 101 cases of rape were recorded in Somaliland between January and November 2018 (coded as one event per month); 105 individuals were accused of rape out of which 87 were arrested and charged.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: IED targets AMISOM convoy ferrying supplies from Afgooye to Balidogle. One truck with container hit. No casualties, damages TBC.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: An RCIED, targeting a PSF vehicle, detonated at Sugure area located at the foothills of Galgala (c. 35 km south west of Bossaso). One soldier was killed and two others were injured. The vehicle was completely damaged. The victims were rushed to Bossaso General Hospital. PSF were reported to be conducting operations against al Shabaab bases.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: Al-Shabaab fighters have carried out attacks on AMISOM [Africa Union Mission in Somalia] soldiers in their camps in Lower Shabelle region in southern Somalia. The raids happened on AMISOM camps in Qoryoley and Bilal villages. Several [AMISOM] killed and injured.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: Al-Shabaab fighters have carried out attacks on AMISOM [Africa Union Mission in Somalia] soldiers in their camps in Lower Shabelle region in southern Somalia. The raids happened on AMISOM camps in Qoryoley and Bilal villages. Several [AMISOM] killed and injured.
14/02, PM, Hawl Wadaag: Unknown gunmen have shot and killed and SNA soldier.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: Al Shabaab fighters ambush KDF patrol after premature detonation of an IED. Three al Shabaab killed.

Al Shabaab militants executed two men accused of spying for the Somali, Kenyan and Ethiopian governments at Kunyo Barow Square field (c. 75 km west of Barawe district). The men were tied to poles and shot dead by masked armed men. A self - proclaimed judge read out their verdict in front of a crowd at the execution ground.
Al Shabaab executes two men for spying for the KDF.
Detonation: An RCIED detonated at a teashop frequented by SWSFP in Awdinle village (c. 30 km north west of Baidoa). There are no reports of casualties or arrests made.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: IED targets Puntland convoy near Sugure. Casualties unknown.

Al Shabaab attacked an SNA defensive base located at the main bridge of Mahaday town in Mahaday district. Al Shabaab initiated the attack by firing mortar shells and RPG rounds at the SNA base. There was an exchange of heavy gunfire which lasted for about 25 minutes after which SNA retreated from their position. Al Shabaab temporarily took control of the base. At least one civilian was killed and three others were injured.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: AMISOM fires artillery shells towards al Shabaab positions. Unverified report suggests seven civilians killed.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: Al Shabaab fighters attack AMISOM forward operating base Masilah. RPGs fired. No casualties, assailants repelled.
Al Shabaab fighters attack SNAF position at Ex-Perfume Factory. RPGs used. 20 minutes firefight. Al Shabaab withdrew. Three SNAF injured.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: Al-Shabaab forces have attacked a base belonging to AMISOM troops in the coastal district of Barawe at Ambareeso, Lower Shabelle region on the night of 13/02. Causalities not known.
13th February, PM, Dharkenley, Mogadishu: Infighting between MoSF and SNA result in one SNA soldier killed and several MoSF and SNA wounded.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against SNA troops based at the Livestock Market neighbourhood in Heliwa district. The clash was initiated using RPGs followed by an exchange of heavy gunfire which lasted for about 30 minutes after which al Shabaab militants were forced to withdraw. Three SNA soldiers were injured. Casualties from al Shabaab could not be ascertained at the time of reporting.
Al Shabaab elements shot and killed a soldier at Caymiska village neighbourhood in Yaqshid district. The perpetrators took the weapon of the dead soldier and managed to escape.
Government security forces shot amongst themselves at Baidoa animal market in Berdale neighbourhood. One civilian was killed and four others were injured. The motive behind the incident was unknown.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces
notes: Al Shabaab fighters conducted a probing attack against a South West State Special Forces position in Wajid (c. 90 km south west of Xudur). There was a brief exchange of small arms fire after which al Shabaab fighters retreated from the area. There were no reports of casualties.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: Armed al Shabaab militants shot and injured a NISA soldier at Suuqa Daawada (Medicine Market) neighbourhood near Bakara Market in Howlwadag district. The perpetrators escaped from the scene after the incident. The soldier was taken to hospital for treatment. Al Shabelle immediately claimed responsibility for the attack.
Al Shabaab militants, shot and killed an SNA officer while on his way to work at Timacadde village near Kawo Godey section in Wadajir district. The perpetrators managed to escape.
13th February, AM, Awdheegle/Mubaarak, Afgooye, Lower Shabelle: Unconfirmed reporting has claimed that al Shabaab have beheaded "several people."
13th February, AM, Awdheegle/Mubaarak, Afgooye, Lower Shabelle: Unconfirmed reporting has claimed that al Shabaab have beheaded "several people."
IED detonates between Shalambood and Beled Amiin. IED triggered by goats grazing in the field. Two children injured.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: SNA forces, supported by AMISOM and anti-al Shabaab forces (not identified), recaptured key villages in Lower Shabelle region after an offensive against al Shabaab. The allied troops took control of Mubarak, Darussalam, and Awdhiigle towns in the region during the joint operation. Reports indicated that there was heavy exchange of gunfire. At least four al Shabaab militants, including a senior officer who was head of Sakawat in Lower Shabelle region, was killed during the operation. It was reported that the joint forces destroyed two VBIED trucks in their operation. The joint forces later vacated the villages and al Shabaab returned and took control of the villages without resistance.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: SNA forces, supported by AMISOM and anti-al Shabaab forces (not identified), recaptured key villages in Lower Shabelle region after an offensive against al Shabaab. The allied troops took control of Mubarak, Darussalam, and Awdhiigle towns in the region during the joint operation. Reports indicated that there was heavy exchange of gunfire. At least four al Shabaab militants, including a senior officer who was head of Sakawat in Lower Shabelle region, was killed during the operation. It was reported that the joint forces destroyed two VBIED trucks in their operation. The joint forces later vacated the villages and al Shabaab returned and took control of the villages without resistance.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: SNA forces, supported by AMISOM and anti-al Shabaab forces (not identified), recaptured key villages in Lower Shabelle region after an offensive against al Shabaab. The allied troops took control of Mubarak, Darussalam, and Awdhiigle towns in the region during the joint operation. Reports indicated that there was heavy exchange of gunfire. At least four al Shabaab militants, including a senior officer who was head of Sakawat in Lower Shabelle region, was killed during the operation. It was reported that the joint forces destroyed two VBIED trucks in their operation. The joint forces later vacated the villages and al Shabaab returned and took control of the villages without resistance.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked an SNA checkpoint at Buundo-weyn and Mukayga neighbourhoods in Afgoye district. Al Shabaab initiated the attack with heavy gunfire and SNA forces responded with gunfire to the general direction of the attack. There was heavy exchange of gunfire which lasted about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. At least two SNA soldiers were injured. The troops conducted a search operation in the area after the attack. Casualties from al Shabaab could not be confirmed at the time of reporting.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked an SNA checkpoint at Buundo-weyn and Mukayga neighbourhoods in Afgoye district. Al Shabaab initiated the attack with heavy gunfire and SNA forces responded with gunfire to the general direction of the attack. There was heavy exchange of gunfire which lasted about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. At least two SNA soldiers were injured. The troops conducted a search operation in the area after the attack. Casualties from al Shabaab could not be confirmed at the time of reporting.
12/02, PM, Wajid: Al Shabaab attack a Police station. Outcome not known.

Suspected al Shabaab militants hurled a hand grenade at an SNA checkpoint at Buundo Yarey neighbourhood in Afgoye district. SNA soldiers reacted with gunfire towards general suspected directions. The perpetrators managed to escape. Casualties could not be confirmed at the time of reporting.

Al Shabaab combatants attacked a government troop position at Qoryoley Police Station in Qoryoley district. There was heavy exchange of gunfire which lasted for about half an hour after which al Shabaab fighters were forced to withdraw from the area. Casualties could not be confirmed at the time of reporting.
Government forces met "heavy resistance" from al Shabaab forces at Janaale on 12/02. Causalities not known.

SNA soldiers, in an escort vehicle, shot at a crowd of civilians at Hotel Amira Road near Zoppe junction road in Hodan District to clear the road of traffic. At least two civilians, including a driver of a rickshaw and passenger, were injured and rushed to Madina Hospital for treatment. The SNA vehicle proceeded after the incident.
SNAF soldiers shot Director of Relations for Ministry of Sports Abdullahi Hirey at checkpoint, reasons not known.
Al Shabaab executed two Kenyans on changes of spying. The two were publically stabbed.
A man from Dir clan was shot and killed by an armed man from Sheikhaal clan at Horumar neighbourhood. The cause of the incident was unknown. The perpetrator managed to escape from the scene.
A man was stabbed to death in Siinaay neighbourhood in Hargeisa. The perpetrator was arrested by the police after the incident.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: An RCIED, targeting an AMISOM convoy moving from Balcad district heading to Jowhar, exploded near Ceelka-Geelow neighbourhood in Balcad district. The AMISOM lead vehicle was damaged. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack. There were no reports of human casualties.
12th February, 1200L, El Lahelay, Dhuusamareeb, Galgaduud: Media reports have stated that two children have been killed when unexploded ordnance with which they were playing detonated.
12/02, AM, Gololey, Balcad: IED strike on a civilian vehicle. A second IED attack against a AMISOM convoy occurred about the same time. Outcome not known.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 12/02, AM, Gololey, Balcad: IED strike on AMISOM convoy. A second IED attack against a civilian vehicle occurred about the same time. Outcome not known.
A landmine explosion kills one and injures another at Hansheekh village, outside of Balcad. Perpetrators not known.

Reports from Warmooley village which is located between Elbuur and Dhusamareeb in Galmudug (50km from Dhuusamarreeb), say that residents have clashed with al-Shabab after the militant group proposed to train elders to fight for the group. The clash was triggered after al-Shabab killed two civilians in the area before they came to train the elderly on use of weapons. The clash between the two sides resulted in deaths and injures on both sides, specific numbers not known.
Suspected US drone strike targets al Shabaab camp in Tortoorow. Two vehicles destroyed, casualties unknown.
Al Shabaab gunmen assassinate local clan militiaman. Assailants escaped with confiscated AK47. Victim was manning an illegal checkpoint in Gambarlawe (SE Belet Weyne).
Al Shabaab operative hurls a hand grenade towards SNAF patrol. SNAF patrol opens fire, kills the driver of an auto-rickshaw and injure two civilians. Assailant escaped.
Somali soldiers kill another service member. Assailants escaped, motives unknown.
Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate a Somali soldier. Assailants escaped, motives unknown.
Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate unidentified Somali security officer. Assailants escaped.
11 February. Al Shabaab militants shot and killed an SNA soldier at Sanca junction road neighbourhood in Kaaran district.

Al-Shabab killed two civilians in Warmooley village which is located between Elbuur and Dhusamareeb in Galmudug (50km from Dhuusamarreeb) area after the group proposed to train elders to fight for the group.
11/02, AM, Beledweyne: IED attack against SNA checkpoint. Outcome not known.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: Two civilian bystanders are killed after unidentified perpetrators threw grenades at the home of a NISA commander. Security forces responded to the attack, however, they did not succeed in capturing the assailants.
Al Shabaab fighters attack Buulo Folyo checkpoint, temporarily capture the area. Casualties unknown.
10 February. A man was shot and seriously wounded by an armed perpetrator in Bossaso. The perpetrator was arrested and taken to the central police station for further investigation.
Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate a SNAF soldier in Buundo Weyn. Assailants escaped with confiscated AK47.

09/02, PM, Hawlwadaag: A grenade attack on the residential house of former Howl Wadaag district commissioner has resulted in two residents being killed, including one child. Perpetrators al Shabaab. A second report claims four dead.

09 February. Al Shabaab fighters and local clan militias clashed near Tardo area (c. 185 km south east of Beletweyne) at the border of Hiiraan and Middle Shabelle. The cause of the incident was related to ownership of disputed land at Xalfooley between Hawadle and Abgaal clan. Al Shabaab intervened and ordered Hawadle clan members to move out of the land which resulted in the armed clash. Causalities not known.
09/02, AM, Awdhegle, Afgooye: Al Shabaab launch low level attack. Outcome not known.
Somaliland Police attempts to destroy illegal roadside structures. Dhulbahante/Qayaad groups respond, injure a police officer.
Gunmen in uniforms suspected of being SNAF soldiers shot and kill Hormud employee. Motives unknown.
Al Shabaab operatives hurled two hand grenades towards SNAF checkpoint in Furayasha. Two SNAF injured. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: 08/02, PM, Gaal, Beledweyne: EDNF ambush al Shabaab. Outcome not known.

08 February. Suspected al Shabaab militants hurled two hand grenades at an SNA checkpoint at Furayasha village neighbourhood in Wardhigley district. Two SNA soldiers were injured in the attack. The perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
Two groups of Somali soldiers clash near Zobe Junction. Motives & resulting casualty figures unknown.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: Islamic State claims to have assassinated a NISA officer in Afgooye. Event not independently verified.
IED targets Southwest forces outside of Baidoa. Casualties unknown.
07th February, PM, IVO Afgooye, Lower Shabelle: A roadside IED strike on security forces vehicle results in two SNA killed outside of Afgooye.

Two groups of SNA troops clashed at Ex. Control neighbourhood in Deyniile district. There was heavy exchange of gunfire. Further reports suggested that the primary motive of the clash was a land dispute between the two groups. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting. A ceasefire was arrived at.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM convoy traveling on the road between KM 50 and KM 60 near Buulo-Nageey village (c. 20 km west of Afgoye district). There was an exchange of gunfire. There were no reports of casualties.
Suspected al Shabaab shot and killed a junior officer near Gaheyr University during the early morning hours.

Unidentified armed attackers shot and killed a civilian man at Buundo Kowaad vicinity in Waberi district. The perpetrators, suspected to be al Shabaab elements, escaped from the scene after the incident. The motive of the assassination was unknown.

An RCIED exploded in an open area at Alrahma located east of Bossaso. The RCIED was place beside the road targeting a government vehicle. The government vehicle passed safely. There were no reports of damages or injuries.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: IED targets UPDF convoy near Buulo Nigiriish, outside of Marka. One vehicle slightly damaged, no casualties.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
notes: An IED, targeting a police patrol, exploded at NATCO area. One police officer was killed and two others were injured.
Al Shabaab attack Police station in Jalalaqsi. Assailants repelled, casualties unknown.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: AMISOM ENDF and al Shabaab fighters clashed in Ilkacade area (c. 12 km north of Beletweyne) on the MSR which links Beletweyne to the northern regions of Somalia. The incident occurred after al Shabaab fighters ambushed AMISOM ENDF who were travelling from Ethiopia to Beletweyne. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about one hour. Casualties could not be determined at the time of reporting. AMISOM ENDF reached Beletweyne after the incident.

A group of al Shabaab fighters attacked a security post manned by SNA forces at Qalimow village in Balcad district (c. 30 km north of Balcad district). There was heavy exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 30 minutes. At least two SNA soldiers were killed while another was injured.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces
notes: 06th February, Saakow, Middle Jubba: Limited reports have claimed the SNA-special forces have carried out a strike operation on al Shabaab in the town of Saakow. Causalities not known.
Suspected al Shabaab assassins shot and killed two soldiers in Daynile during the overnight hours.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
notes: Al Shabaab attack forward operating base Cali Fool Dheere with PKM and RPG7. No casualties, assailants repelled.
Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a civilian as the victim left a mosque.

A 14-year-old boy was killed by a police officer at Abdullahi Isse stadium in Horumar section in South Galkayo. The incident occurred after the police officer shot at a crowd of young boys during an intermediate school football game. The perpetrator was arrested and taken into custody for further investigation.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
notes: An armed group conducted a complex attack against the central police station in Bossaso. The attack was initiated with an explosion and a volley of small arms fire. The attack was focused on the central police station and judiciary prison cell adjacent to the police station. During the attack, two civilians were killed and four police officers, including the deputy police commander of the police station, was injured seriously. Al Shabaab claimed the responsibility of the attack.
05th February, PM, Jalalaqsi, Hiiraan: Unconfirmed media reporting has stated that two people have been killed after a confrontation between al Shabaab and SNA.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against SWSPF based in Qansax-Dheere district (c. 90 km south west of Baidoa). There was an exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab retreated. There were no reports of casualties from the attack.
Unidentified gunmen assassinate teacher in Dharkenley. Assailants escaped, motives unknown.
05th February, PM, Beletweyne, Hiiraan: The Former Mayor is shot and killed when exiting a local Mosque after attending evening prayers.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: Puntland force fired artillery at Somaliland forces based at Higlo-Fiqi (c. 40 km east of Lasanod). Somaliland forces did not respond to the attack. No causalities.
A militia group loyal to Ahmed Abdi Hassan (Tajir), a member of the Jubbaland regional parliament, has blocked roads in the city in protest against the MP's arrest.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: Al Shabaab fighters ambush UPDF foot patrol. Casualties reported, figures unknown.
Armed clashes erupt between two groups of Somali soldiers in Jazeera. Casualties & motives unknown.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: Al Shabaab attacked an AMISOM convoy near number 60 vicinity (c. 30 km west of Afgoye district). There was an exchange of heavy gunfire which lasted for about one hour after which al Shabaab were forced to withdraw. At least four al Shabaab militants were killed and five others were injured in the attack.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate NISA officer Abdulkadir Aflow in Bakaara Market. Assailants escaped.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: Al Shabaab fire several mortar rounds against UPDF base in Danow. No casualties reported.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
notes: Suspected SPU Policeman kills a foreign Ethiopian NGO worker. Incident linked to ongoing rumours that foreigners are 'infiltrating Bossaso and stealing jobs.'

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: Police and NISA clashed at Jazeera village in Wadajir district. There was heavy exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 30 minutes. The motive of the clash was ascribed to disputes over extortion money. At least five SNA soldiers were injured.
03rd February, AM, Qoryooley, Lower Shabelle: Al Shabaab launch an attack on an SNA position. Government forces repelled the attack, with both sides taking a "number of causalities."
Al Shabaab fighters attack a SNAF position near Dalbiyango. Assailants repelled, casualties unknown.

Reports coming from Elwaq town, [Gedo region, southwestern Somalia] located on the Somali-Kenya border say Kenyan [military] helicopters carried out air strikes at an area known as Kalabayrka. The area is 8km from Elwaq town. No casualties reported, but following the air strikes [al Shabaab] fled the area.
Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate "Hassan", Hormud employee, in Wabeeri.

Unknown warplanes conducted an airstrike against suspected al Shabaab location at weel-buraad grazing area (c. 35 km south east of Dhobley town). At least two missiles were fired at the targeted area. Casualties from the attack was unknown.

An RCIED buried along the roadside, targeting an SNA battlewagon from Mogadishu headed to Afgoye, exploded at KM 13 vicinity near Omar fiasco Building in Dayniile district. The RCIED missed the convoy and exploded on a civilian vehicle. Three people, reported to be working for Hormuud Telecommunication company, were killed and two others were injured. The injured were taken to a nearby hospital. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

Two groups, both hailing from Jiroon clan, clashed opposite a UN compound in Baidoa town. The incident occurred after a dispute over the selection of a new clan chief. There was an exchange of gunfire. Two people were killed and two others were wounded. The two groups from Jiroon clan were reported not to have resolved their issues which created tension because there was a possibility of further fighting.

Somali National Army officials said they have conducted joint military operation with US forces on al-Shabab base in Tortorow area. Two al Shabaab commanders (Farah Ali Hussein also known as Farah Kalar and Mohamed Omar), along with "several others" killed.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: An al-Shabab commander has been killed in a joint operation in Raxoole.

Al Shabaab combatants attacked a government troop position at Dal Biyaango near Danow settlement in Qoryoley district. There was an exchange of heavy gunfire which lasted for a couple of hours after which al Shabaab fighters were forced to withdraw from the area. At least three people, including one soldier and two al Shabaab militants, were killed.
KDF combat helicopters attack al Shabaab positions between Ceel Waaq and Buusaar. Outcome and resulting casualty figures unknown.
Unidentified gunmen attack a civilian vehicle. One killed one injured.

A female, who hailed from Hawadle clan, was killed and another male, hailing from Hawadle clan, was injured by Galijecel clan militias in Burjada Cinta (c. 04 km west of Beletweyne). The clan militia attempted to stop a mini bus that was travelling from Mogadishu to Beletweyne but the driver of mini bus ignored the signals prompting the perpetrators to shoot at the minibus. The driver proceeded on and arrived at Beletweyne town. The victims of the shooting incident were taken to Beletweyne hospital for further treatment. The perpetrators escaped from the scene. There were no reports of arrests. The security situation was reported to be very tense.
02/02, Galkacyo: A UVIED targets and kills a prominent elder in the city or military officer. Al-Shabab claimed responsibility for the blast.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
notes: RCIED strikes BNDF convoy. One Caspir seriously damaged, three injured.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: Somali security forces in Puntland reportedly destroyed an al-Shabaab network after the militants attacked Sugurre area, west of Boosaaso town [on 1 February]. An official from the Puntland armed forces in Sugurre told Puntland Post website that three al-Shabab fighters have been killed during the raid [on the al-Shabaab position]. Several other fighters fled. Another official claimed 10 al Shabaab dead.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: Local unconfirmed reports have claimed that al Shabaab launched a mortar attack at an AMISOM position at Laantabuur. Outcome not known.
01st February, 1130L, Taredishe (Daynile), Mogadishu: A roadside Improvised Explosive Device (IED) kills three civilians.
Two soldiers are killed and two wounded when an IED targeted their vehicle at Tareedisho area. Perpetrators not known.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
notes: An unspecified number of al Shabaab and Dervish soldiers clashed at Baalaweyne area near Yalho (c. 45 km south west of Bossaso). The clash lasted for five minutes after which al Shabaab fighters escaped. There were no immediate reports of arrests and casualties.

Al Shabaab and local armed pastoralists clashed at Lebi-Duule vicinity near Ceel-Garas village (c. 40 km east of Dhusamareb). The incident occurred after pastoralists refused to comply with demands from al Shabaab to collect their livestock. Two pastoralists were killed. Al Shabaab casualties could not be ascertained at the time of reporting.

Unconfirmed reports have stated that al Shabaab have engaged an SNA position on the outskirts of Belet Weyne. Causality figures not known. A second source claims the event took place on the night of 30/01 and resulted in three causalities.

Two groups of SNA troops clashed at Gaheyr University neighbourhood in Deyniile district. There was heavy exchange of gunfire. Additional reports suggested that the primary motive of the clash was because of a land dispute between the two groups. Other SNA soldiers intervened and successfully mediated a cease fire. At least two soldiers were injured.

An unidentified number of armed men shot and killed a civilian man inside Darwiish Mosque near the main hospital in Kooshin Neighbourhood located east of Beletweyne town. The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene. The motive behind the killing was not clear. There were no reports of arrests.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
notes: State Minister of Puntland Port and Counter Piracy was shot and seriously wounded by a Dervish soldier in Hubaal area of Bossaso. The motive was not clear. There were no reports of immediate arrests. Police were reported to be investigating.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against SNA soldiers posted at Garmarlaawe village (c. 07 km west of Beletweyne town). There was a brief exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab retreated. There were no reports of casualties.
30th January, AM, Shalaambood, Marka, Lower Shabelle: Five locals were injured when a grenade was thrown at a group of SNA soldiers. A second source indicated the event occurred on 29/01.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 30th January, 1230L, Dayniile, Mogadishu: Firefight between SNAF and NISA reported. Motives for the incident unknown and no casualties reported.

Abgal sub clan militias attacked other Shiidle sub clan militias based in Dhagahow village (c. 18 km east of Balcad district). At least two clan militias were killed while two others were injured. The motive of the attack was related to clan retaliation. A second source claims the violence was over accusations of the practice of Sihr (illusion or magic).

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: IED targets KDF foot patrol. Casualties reported, figures unknown.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
notes: An RCIED, targeting a Puntland police vehicle at Balikhadar area, detonated on the road to Galgala (c. 35 km south west of Bossaso) killing one PMPF soldier and wounding three others. Perpetrators not named by source.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 30th January, AM, Sugurre, Bosasso, Bari: A roadside IED strike on a Puntland Security Force (PSF) convoy results in three KIA. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.
29th January, AM, Cariishley, Jalalaqsi, Hiiraan: Unconfirmed reports have claimed that locals have shot and killed two members of al Shabaab who were running an illegal vehicle checkpoint.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: Al Shabaab militants conducted a hit-and-run attack against NISA checkpoint base at Aymiska in Yaqshid district. There was an exchange of light gunfire which lasted for about 10 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. There were no reports of casualties.

29th January, AM, IVO Daynuunay, Baidoa, Lower Shabelle: Unconfirmed reports have claimed that al Shabaab have ambushed SNA travelling near Daynuunay. Al Shabaab claims at least four government forces dead.

29th January, AM, Lug Habar, Buur Hakaba: SNA have carried out a security offensive on the settlements 20km north of Buur Hakaba. At least 3 soldiers and a commander were killed; seven al Shabaab dead. Other injuries reported.

A SWSPF soldier shot and killed a civilian rickshaw passenger at the centre of Baidoa town. The motive of the killing was not clear. Other reports indicated that the victim was coming out from the rickshaw after which soldiers accidentally shot him.

Abgal sub-clan militias shot and killed a civilian man hailing from Hawadle sub clan at the outskirt of Mahaday district. The perpetrators managed to escape before security forces arrived at the scene. The motive of the assassination could be related to clan revenge between both sub clans.
Al Shabaab executed a man accused of sexual assault and murder.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 29th January, AM, Beledweyne, Hiiraan: A roadside IED strike has been reported on an AMISOM convoy vehicle. The explosion has inflicted casualties on the AU forces after one of their vehicles has been damaged by the IED, but the exact number of the casualty figures was not confirmed. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit- and-run attack against an AMISOM base at Halane neighbourhood in Qoryooley district. There was a brief exchange of gunfire after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.
28th January, AM, Beledweyne, Hiiraan: A Somalia National Army (SNA) soldier shoots and kills a civilian. The motives behind the incident are not known.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 28th January, Tukaraq, Las Anod, Sool: Unconfirmed reports have stated that Puntland Security Forces (PSF) and Somaliland forces have engaged in a firefight. No reported causalities. Somaliland army captured a soldier who fell off one of the battle wagons.
Al Shabaab operative hurls a hand grenade towards SNPF checkpoint at Fagaax Junction. 4 people killed 2 injured.
Unidentified actors attacked government soliders with grenades on 27/01. The soldiers responded with gunfire. The attack wounded five soldiers and civilians.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against AMISOM/SNA troops based at Bullo-Mareer neighbourhood in Kurtunwarey district. The clash was initiated with RPG rounds followed by heavy exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 25 minutes. Three SNA soldiers were injured. Casualties could not be ascertained at the time of reporting.
27/01, AM, Kismayo: IJA engage in a firefight with al Shabaab on the outskirts of Kismayo. Outcome unknown.
A deputy Judge is shot and killed by two suspected al Shabaab militants.
A government soldier shot and killed a civilian in Belet Weyne on 27/01.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: Southwest forces travelling along MSR notice IED. Device explodes while ENDF EOD attempts to defuse. One ENDF injured.

Al-Shabaab attacked Hirshabelle administration forces at Gambar Lawe, 3km from Belet Weyne, inflicting casualties. Two soldiers were killed in the attack, while five others were wounded. A reporter in Hiiraan Region said al-Shabaab forces captured the area.

Suspected al Shabaab militants hurled two hand grenades at Laanta Towfiq neighbourhood in Yaqshid district. One SNA soldier was injured in the attack. The perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: An RCIED, buried alongside the road to Jowhar and Balcad targeting an AMISOM/SNA convoy, exploded at Haan Sheekh neighbourhood (c. 12 km north east of Balcad district). Heavy gunfire followed. Perpetrators not known.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: Al Shabaab launched an attack on AMISOM forces at Bulo Mareer on the night of 26/01. Heavy weapons were used. Casualities not known.
A UN contractor is shot and killed in Mogadishu on 26/01. Perpetrators not known.
26/01, Busar: Limited reports claim that the KDF are shelling al Shabaab locations in the surrounding mountain area.
KDF shell suspected al Shabaab positions near Buusaar. Outcome and resulting casualty figures unknown.
One Somali federal government soldier was killed and his gun seized by al Shabaab in eastern Beledweyne District. The event occurred during the nighttime hours.
Wagardhac/Marehan gunmen assassinate two Ceyr/Habargidir/Hawiye civilians. Motive linked to old clan feuds. Assailants escaped.

Two pastoralists, who hailed from Ayr clan, sub-clan of Habargidir, were killed by armed men hailing from Wagardhac clan, sub-clan of Marehan, near Balanbal village (c. 40 km south east of Abudwak). It was believed that the incident was related to previous clan feuds between the two clans.
Al Shabaab operatives assassinate driver of auto-rickshaw in Ceelasha Biyaha. Assailants escaped, motives unknown.

Al Shabaab militants amputated the right arms of two men accused of theft at Kunya-Barow village vicinity in Barawe district. The two men were convicted for breaking into a shop and stealing 17,670,000 Somali shilling (USD 883). Hundreds of locals gathered to witness the incident.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: Reports coming in from Awdiinle area, which is located about 30 kilometres from Baidoa town, say that a pickup truck in a convoy belonging to the Ethiopian troops was destroyed when it hit a landmine. The convoy was travelling from Awdiinle to Bardale District. A reporter in Bay Region has confirmed that the vehicle was completely destroyed and an unknown number of Ethiopian soldiers aboard were either killed or injured. A similar attack took place in the area the previous day.
A landmine exploded in Digfer neighbourhood in Mogadishu's Hodan district, injuring a civilian and killing livestock kept nearby. Perpatrators not named by the source.
25/01, 0726L, Hodan: A roadside IED results in the death of an SNA colonel. Perpetrators not known.

Unidentified men hurled a hand grenade against SNA force manning the Horseed check point at Hawa-Taako village neighbourhood in Beletweyne town. SNA soldiers at the checkpoint responded with gunfire after the explosion. There were no reports of casualties. The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene and there were no reports of arrests.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: Somali security forces backed by Africa Union troops killed three Al-Shabaab militants and injured several others during a heavy fighting in Bula-burte town in Hiiraan region.

A hand grenade was hurled at SNAF soldiers on foot patrol at Bat Osma'il checkpoint vicinity in Afgoye district. The soldiers responded with gunfire at the general suspected direction of the attack. There were no reports of casualties. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: An al Shabaab landmine targeted and hit an Ethiopian convoy outside of Baidoa. Casualities not known.
24/01, 1800L, Yaqshiid: A roadside IED targeting a security force vehicle explodes, injuring two children.

An RCIED, targeting an SNA convoy exploded at Ex. Control area in Heliwa district. One SNA battlewagon was destroyed. SNA shot towards suspected directions of the attack and subsequently cordoned off the area. There were no reports of fatalities.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: AMISOM and suspected al Shabaab fighters clashed at KM60 village (c. 30 km west of Afgoye). The attack was initiated using RPGs followed by heavy exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 30 minutes after which al Shabaab were repelled. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.
24/01, AM Gol Weyne, Marka: Al Shabaab attacks an SNA position. Outcome not known.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: 24/01, AM, Berdale: IED strike against ENDF. Result of the strike not known.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
notes: Chief of police in Galdogob district was shot and killed after four police officers shot at his vehicle near Bursalah town (c. 30 North of Galdogob). The reason behind the killing was unknown. Suspects were arrested for further investigation.

23rd January, Balcad, Middle Shabelle: The Somali National Army (SNA) are today carrying out further offensive operation on settlements between Jowhar and Balcad. A number of villages were cleared. Casualities not known.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: An RCIED, targeting an AMISOM convoy moving from Afgoye to Shalamboot, exploded at Ceel Waregow village (c. 12 km north east of Merka town) in Merka district. One AMISOM truck was damaged. AMISOM reacted with gunfire towards suspected directions of the attack. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for this attack.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 23rd January, AM, IVO Shalaambood, Marka, Lower Shabelle: Unconfirmed local reporting has stated an African Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) convoy vehicle has been struck by an Improvised Explosive Device (IED). One death reported. Perpetrators not known.

23rd January, 1430L, Siinka Dheere, Banadir: A road side IED has targeted an SNA vehicle. Unconfirmed reports have claimed that the IED has resulted in two to five SNA soldiers KIA. Al Shabaab later claimed responsibility for the attack.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: Al Shabaab fighters fired at an AMISOM base located west of Buloburte district (c. 115 km south of Beletweyne) using PKMs. AMISOM responded with heavy weapon fire. There were no reports of casualties. The security situation was reported to be relatively calm after the incident.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: An RCIED, targeting a UPDF convoy moving from Ceel-Jaale to MIA, exploded at Buulo Nagaad vicinity in Merka district. The explosion occurred at the fuel tank of a vehicle severely damaging it and killing the driver. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack.

Armed al Shabaab attackers shot and killed a government staff who worked for Villa Somalia in front of his shop at Suuq Bocle vicinity in Dharkenley district.
